loans.name: Celestes Group
loans.use: Stocking merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma B. is from the village of Baluarte Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Irma is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Irma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Irma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Irma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irma is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Baluarte, Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: Doña Siomara S. A., tiene 36 años casada con tres hijos, D. los cuales  están a su cargo, se dedica a la crianza D. pollos ponedoras  D. esta forma a trabajado  durante 5 años atrás, venD. todos los días  huevos y con eso logra el sustento diario. Conjuntamente con otras vecinas deciden organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo. El cual será utilizado como capital D. trabajo y así poder  incrementar el volumen D. ventas. Son 6 señoras y 1 señor  que conforman el grupo   denominado “primavera”, las señoras D. dedican a diversas actividades productivas tales como: la crianza D. animales, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, venta D. verduras, venta D. carne, venta D. cerdos y la venta D. artesanía. En el lugar D. San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Sololá
texts.en:
Siomara S. A., 36, is married with three children, all dependents. She has raised laying hens for 5 years. Every day she sells eggs and with this obtains her daily sustenance. With other neighbours she decided to organize a group to request a loan. It will be used as working capital to increase the volume of their sales. There are 6 women and 1 man in this group called "Primavera" ("Spring"). The ladies engage in various productive activities such as raising animals, selling daily consumables, selling food, selling meat, selling pigs and selling handicrafts. They are in San Juan La Laguna D. Panyevar Solola.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Guadalupanas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama guadalupanas porque en la sección en la que viven es “sección de Guadalupe” aparte de que son personas muy devotas. Está ubicado en el Estado de  México.  El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes. 

Margarita D. es la presidenta  del grupo. Tiene 38, estudió hasta el 5 año de primaria,  es comerciante y ama de casa y tiene en total 2  hijos (1 mujer y 1 varon).  Ella se dedica a la venta de Tupperware que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para invertir en producto  Sus clientes son las señoras de la misma comunidad y poblados cercanos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito para comprar más producto. También espera poder ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida mejor y ayudar a su esposo.

Juana G. es otro integrante de este grupo. Tiene 28 años, estudió hasta el 6 año de primaria, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos (1 mujeres y 1 varones).  Ella se dedica a la venta de  Bolsas y carteras que inició hace 1 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar más mercancía. Sus clientes son las maestras de la escuela y las señoras que van a la iglesia los domingos.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta, quiere este crédito para invertir en mas bolsas   También espera poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
MARGARITA VENTA DE TUPPER
JUANA VENTA DE BOLSAS
RITA VENTA DE COSMETICOS
TRINIDAD VTA DE ABARROTES
MARIA CLAUDIA TAQUERIA
MARIA DEL CARMEN
LOURDES VENTA DE PLATA
MA INOCENTE VENTA DE PLASTICOS
MARTHA VENTA DE CALZADO
MARIA MERCEDES VENTA DE CERAMICA
texts.en:
This group is called "Guadalupanas" because they live in the "Sección de Guadalupe" neighborhood and are very devout people. This neighborhood is in Mexico State. The group is comprised of 10 members. Margarita is the president of the group. She is 38 years old, studied until the 5th grade of elementary school, is a businesswoman and housewife, and has two children (a girl and a boy). She works selling Tupperware, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy stock. Her clients are the women of her community and nearby towns. At the time of applying for this loan, she feels happy. She wants this loan in order to buy more stock. She also hopes to be able to offer her children a better life and to help her husband. Juana in another member of the group. She is 28 years old, studied until the 6th year of elementary school, is married and has two children (1 girl and 1 boy). She sells bags and purses, and began doing this a year ago. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise. Her customers are the teachers at the school and the women who go to the church on Sundays. At the time of requesting this loan, she is happy. She wants this loan to buy more bags. She also hopes to be able to help her husband with the school expenses for their children. The other members of the group are: Margarita - sells Tupperware Juana - sells bags Rita - sells cosmetics Trinidad - sells groceries Maria Claudia - runs a taqueria Maria Carmen Lourdes - sells silver Ma Inocente - sells plastic goods Martha - sells footware Maria Mercedes - sells ceramic goods

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more land to farm

loans.name: Anicita

texts.en:
Anicita V. is from the village of Nailon, Tudela Mis. Occ.. She is 54 years old. Anicita is married and has six grown-up children. To make a living, Anicita plants and harvests rice for sale. Anicita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Anicita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anicita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2007 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Anicita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Anicita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Miss. Sreymom P. (shown in the photo with her widowed mother), age 27, is a hairdresser and lives in a village along National Road Number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is engaged and will get married soon.

Sreymon is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a computer, printer and card pressing machine for her fiancé to operate his invitation publishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a computer, printer and card pressing machine for her fiancé to operate his invitation publishing.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị (20206030025) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 4 adult -aged children. N. owns and operates a business making and selling food,  primarily dried goods, in the local community. N. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, N. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. N. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. N. is now requesting a new loan of 7,840,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by N. from SEDA. N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


N. Nguyễn Thị (20206030025) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, N. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm sấy khô trong cộng đồng địa phương.  N. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, N. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, N. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  N. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.840.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  N. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Teresa P. y la Sra. Aurelia Bogarín, quienes se había acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa  Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, las mismas decidieron invitar a sus amigas y compañeras del Barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18(Díez y Ocho) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
 Ellas son independientes en sus labores como vendedoras de ropas, venta de comidas de todo tipo, tienen almacén, despensa, copetín, tienen huertas y comercializan sus propios productos. Venden artículos de limpieza, mercería, venden carbón, mandioca, bijouterie, etc. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa quien se dedica a la confección de ropas para damas y caballeros. 
Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace varios años y cuenta con buena cantidad de clientas quienes le solicitan las confecciones de acuerdo al modelo que cada uno elija.
Esta actividad es muy sacrificada ya que desgasta mucho la vista  nos comenta la señora  Teresa, pero es la profesión que elegí y es lo que sé hacer y hasta ahora con este trabajo pudo ayudar a su familia.
Ella aparte de los pedidos que recibe también confecciona prendas que ofrece a varias tiendas.
Actualmente desea confeccionar prendas de la temporada entrante y para ello solicita el préstamo para compra de telas  y otros accesorios que ella utiliza.
texts.en:
This group was formed by Teresa P. and Aurelia Bogarín who had approached the office of “Fundación Paraguaya” (Paraguay Foundation) to find out more about the “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women). The ladies decided to invite their neighborhood friends to become involved in group work in order to get ahead and improve their lifestyles. They are 18 humble, but hardworking women who must earn a daily living. They each run their business independently; businesses such as clothing sales, different types of food sales, general stores, and pantry stores. They also have crops and they sell their products. They sell cleaning products, general merchandise, charcoal, cassava, knickknacks, etc. Teresa, one of the members, and she makes men’s and ladies’ clothing. She’s been doing this for several years and she has a good number of customers who solicit her services, based on their needs. This is very hard work and it causes much eye strain, but Teresa tells us, “This is the profession I chose and this is what I know how to do.” She also says that this is how she is able to help her family. Aside from the orders she receives from her customers, she also makes clothing that she offers to various

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Maritza Amparo

texts.es: MARITZA AMPARO V.,Trabaja como  Responsable de Oficina en Relaciones Publica de la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería. ella tiene un hijoa su cargo y este se encuntra en edad escolar, ha trabajado nueve creditops con cepordel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en: Maritza Amparo V. works as the public relations office manager at the Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (National University of Engineering).  She has a school-age son under her care.  She has had nine loans through CEPRODEL and she has used them to make housing improvements.

loans.use: To make housing improvements (change the electric system in the house and plaster some of the walls).

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.en:
Mirian is twenty-one years old.  She is single and has no children.  She lives with family members in Pedregal Grande in the region of Piura.  This is an agricultural region.  The majority of the population are low income agricultural workers or farmers.

For the last two years Mirian has sold clothing and beauty products from her home.  She makes sales either by anticipating the demand or by sharing the company catalog with the potential buyer and taking orders.  She feels confident in her ongoing ability to anticipate her client’s needs and continue the business.

She is therefore requesting a ten month loan of 800 PEN in order to expand her inventory and fill the additional orders of her customers.  She has a number of loyal customers and she hopes to expand her clientele.

Mirian has one outstanding credit with another institution, which the credit analysis of Alternativa deems to be reasonable and within her ability to repay.  She has a good level of liquidity and business capital which she will use along with the new loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase additional beauty products and clothing to sell

loans.name: Pedro De Jesus

texts.es:
El Joven  Pedro tiene la necesidad de superarce en la vida, el tabaja de dia y
estudia de noche quire terminar su preparatoria para asi poder entra a la univercidad
y terminar una carrera por eso solicito el prestamo a fundacion para comprar una computadora y asi poder hacer con mas facilidad sus tareas.
texts.en: Young Pedro would like to better himself in life.  He works by day and studies at night.  He wants to finish his sixth form (senior high school) studies so that he can go to university and complete a university course.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FVP so that he can buy a computer and thereby be able to do his homework with greater ease.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina  G. is a single woman who lives in Prk. Malasbalas, Brgy. Orong, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating four business ventures: pig fattening, buying and selling vegetables, charcoal sales, and retailing gasoline.  Gina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future family needs. Gina G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

 About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her various business operations

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel Z. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. He is 38 years old. Roel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roel provides repair services for cars, jeepneys and multi-purpose cabs to local community members. He is also engaged in planting and harvesting vegetables like onions. Roel has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Roel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase tools needed to provide service. Roel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Roel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Rukiri Tukore Group A-Ibanda

texts.en: 42 year old T. Gaudy has been relying on agriculture for subsistence for a decade now. Her business location is Nyamkiika-Rukiri-Ibanda It is a business she says she began after she sold off her cows. The happily married mother of 5 says this business generates her shillings 20,000 a week. She also has a retail shop which she runs on the side. With this loan, she says she is going purchase manure for her gardens. She envisions this will improve the fertility of her gardens as well as her yields.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her gardens

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov P., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. Nov sells fruits and vegetables, earning an income of USD 3.3 per day, while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4.3 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 90 on other necessary expenses every month.

Nov is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for family use. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. In the future, she would like to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-age children. He has owned a perfume and accessories shop since 1995. He cooperates with his wife who works in a clothing store to keep the family’s financial status at a good stage. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional products to improve his business by increasing his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To purchase additional products

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a widowed woman with six children, two of whom attend school, while four have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a vegetable-stall business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she operates a clothes shop, which contributes to her other source of income. Rukia faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to sell at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables, coconuts and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Mahasa Bee Keepers Group-Kyenjojo

texts.en: T. Wilson is 63 years old, married, and has seven children.  For the past two years, he has been running a general merchandise retail shop in Kawaruju-Kyenjojo. His business generates 30,000 shillings a week. Wilson also runs a small agricultural business. With this loan, he is going to purchase more retail commodities to sell at his shop. He is affiliated with the Mahasa Bee Keepers Group-Kyenjojo.

loans.use: To purchase more retail commodities to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: This is 31 year-old Adama.  She is married, and has one child, aged 15 years. In 2005, Adama established her food business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain herself and family.  Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000.  Adama has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan to help buy a large quantity of food items for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, she plans to open a shop and hire workers. Transportation costs and inflation are her challenges in the business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To add more stock to her business

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married to a farmer and they have seven children. Yaa sells palm oil in Abrafo, a village near Abura. She first purchases palm fruit (shown in the picture) and boils the fruit to extract the oil, which she then sells. 

Yaa is keen to grow her business and will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more oil for sale. She plans to save up the additional profits to buy a piece of land for her family some day.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to extract more oil for sale.

loans.name: Kokoyian

texts.en:
Kokoyian E. K. is 55 years old, the married mother of eight children who depends on her. She has been a farmer in Nkareta-Narok, Kenya for a period of ten years with an income of about KES 6,000 per month.

She knew about KADET LTD through other women registered with them in her area of residence. She repaid the previous loans successfully and without complication. This is her third loan from KADET LTD which she wants to use to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer. 

She hopes to grow different crops on her farm and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; es  conviviente, la socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia tiene 4 hijos de (18, 7, 4 y 1 mes de nacido) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la crianza de cuyes, la socia tiene a sus cuyes en casa en un espacio designado para ellos y va comprando de grupos de 10 a 20 cuyes y los va haciendo reproducir poco a poco, la socia está un poco ocupada en la atención de su aún bebe y manifiesta que de todas maneras debe seguir cuidando a sus cuyes para que estos tenga su alimento diario y su atención adecuada para seguir con sus negocio y luego venderlo al por mayor a los diferentes restaurantes turísticos de la zona, la socia desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en esta oportunidad en la compra de cuyes tiernos para continuar con su labor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes i de este modo incrementar sus ganancias.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Manos Juntas Rumichaca - Alta Communal Bank located in the town of Rumichaca, province of Urubamba, and department of Cusco.

The member’s name is Emiliana.   She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 4 children (ages 18, 7, 4, and one month).  She alternates her activities in the home with raising guinea pigs.  She has a designated space in her house for them and is going to buy groups of 10 to 20 guinea pigs and make them reproduce gradually.  Emiliana is a bit busy caring for her baby. However, she states that in order to continue her business, she must still continue caring for her guinea pigs so that they have their daily food and adequate attention. Then she will sell them wholesale to various tourist restaurants in the area. Emiliana is requesting the loan at this time to buy fresh guinea pigs in order to continue with her work and thereby increase her profits.

Emiliana is very grateful for the loan and agrees to meet the payments in a disciplined manner.
.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs and therby increase her profits.

loans.name: Adu

texts.en:
Adu H. is married and has eight children. As a Muslim, Adu was reluctant to join GHAPE in the past for fear of rejection, but he was pleasantly surprised by the warm reception other members gave him. He joined the program in January 2010 and received his first loan February 2010 which he used to buy more items for his grocery store. Given the size of his immediate family and the many extended family members who rely on him, Adu faces considerable difficulty in meeting their needs. He has been a victim of bush fires several times that destroyed some of his crops. These fires come about as a result of the fact that many people rear cattle in his community and so burn the bushes in the dry season to allow fresh grass to sprout for the cattle.

With this new loan, Adu plans to increase the size of his grocery store to meet community needs. He will use the additional profits arising from the loan to pay school fees for his children and provide food, clothing and medication for his immediate and extended family members.

About GHAPE

The Grounded and Holistic Approach for Peoples’ Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries.

location.town: Acha, Momo Division, North West Region

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 44 years old, married to Joseph and they have 2 children. She has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 18 years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan of KES.10,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the loan to buy onion seeds and fertilizer and also to pay for labour.

In the future, Lydia hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en: Angelo, 25, is a teacher by profession. He is a bachelor who has been teaching for four years. He began teaching immediately he finished his studies at a university in Kampala. He teaches in Ntungamo. Monthly he says he makes about 470,000 as income. He also does some farming. He says he is going to use this loan to pay his tuition at a university in western Uganda where he is planning on upgrading his studies.

loans.use: To pay his university tuition fees

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 46 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Yolanda runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like shampoo, toothpaste, sardines, noodles, etc., to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for nine years and also earns income from selling fish. Yolanda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: El joven Luis es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, luis se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de chatarra ( reciclaje de desechos de metal), eligió este tipo de trabajo por que tiene familiares que se dedican a la misma actividad, viene realizando esta labor por mas de 4 años, la forma en la que transporta estos materiales es con un triciclo que es de su propiedad, los desafíos que enfrenta luis es que el triciclo que tiene es muy pequeño para transportar los materiales ,y el los enfrenta realizando el traslado 2 veces al día, llevando dicha mercadería a los almacenes para así venderlo diariamente, el dinero que esta solicitando luis es para construir su propio almacén el cual lo construirá en la casa  de sus padres, y así almacenar lo que recicla todo el día, y así venderlo semanalmente dándole mas tiempo para reciclar mas mercadería, luis esta muy agradecido con la ayuda que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Young Luis is single and lives in his parent's house.  He has a business buying and selling scrap metal (scrap metal recycling.)  He chose this type of work because he has relatives who are also in this line of business.  He has been doing this work for more than 4 years.  He transports these materials with a bike that he owns that has an attached cart.  One obstacle that Luis faces is that the bike/cart he has is very small and cannot hold a lot of material, so he has to make two trips a day carrying this merchandise to the stores where he sells it.  Luis is requesting a loan so that he can add a storage facility onto his parent's house.  Here he will be able to store the recyclable materials that he collects every day so that he can sell these materials weekly, which will give him more time to recycle more materials.  Luis is very grateful for the assistance that is being provided to him.

loans.use: to add a storage unit to his parent's house where he can store the scrap metal that he collects each day

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 60-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a baker for over 42 years. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. With his requested loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will renew his bakery’s oven so that he can proceed with his business operation properly. His bakery is an important source of income for his family. Lebanon has many pastry shops and bakeries and it is easy to buy fresh goods in one’s village or neighborhood. In the future, he is planning to further develop his business.

loans.use: to renew his bakery’s oven

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a 45 year-old married man with six children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Saidi does welding work of all sorts and has been in this kind of business for 20 years. His major constraint has been inadequate capital to buy the necessary equipment. 

Saidi needs the loan to buy angle bars, welding rolls and mud plates.  His dream is to own a workshop and to be able to pay school fees for all his children

loans.use: To buy angle bars, welding rolls and mud plates.

loans.name: Alba Jacqueline

texts.es:
Desde que era muy pequeña Alba se interesó y se inclinó por ser costurera, cuando terminó su primaria estudió en una academía de costura en Guayaquil y actualmente realiza confecciones en general ejerciendo su profesión ya de esto 15 años. Ademas le gusta el comercio por lo cuál vende productos Avon a sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios como costurera.}

Ella empieza su jornada desde las 7H00 am y cierra a las 8H00 de la noche dependiendo mucho de la demanda que tenga la costura sale a ofrecer tambíén sus productos como una ayuda adicional.
Junto a su esposo tienen dos niños de 11 y 9 años los cuales estudian en la escuela fiscal que queda frente a su casa.

Para seguir adelante ellas necesita una máquina industrial de costura, por eso son sus dificultades al terminal sus obras, su sueño es terminar de construir su casa y comprar su máquina industrial para lo que necesita el prestamo y brindarles comodidas al hogar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
As a young girl, Alba was interested in and inclined to becoming a seamstress. When she finished elementary school, she attended a sewing academy in Guayaquil. She now sews full-time as her profession and has been doing this for 15 years. Alba also likes the retail business, so she sells Avon products to her customers who request her services as a seamstress.

Her daily work schedule begins at 7am and ends at 8pm, depending on how much sewing she has to do. She will leave to go offer her products as an additional source of income. Alba and her husband have two children, ages 11 and 9, who attend the public school across from their house.

Looking ahead, Alba needs an industrial sewing machine because she has had difficulties with finishing her jobs. Her dream is to finish the construction of her house and to buy her industrial machine. Therefore, she needs this loan so that she can provide her children the comforts of home.

loans.use: to buy an industrial sewing machine, cosmetics, and construction materials for her home.

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
En la  parroquia Calderón de la ciudad de Portoviejo,  cada quince días se  reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Desarrollo Femenino. Este lugar se lo conoce por su rica gastronomía y su vegetación, es este lugar la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y comercio en general.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 8 años y el último de 4 meses de nacido, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela. El marido es albañil.
 
Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo de la marca Leonisa y de productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días a la semana pero por horas ya que este es un trabajo en el cual no tiene horario fijo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es la ropa intima de mujer ya que estas son muy solicitadas por las damas.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa interior. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. 

Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the Calderón Parish of the city of Portoviejo, the members of the communal bank "Desarrollo Femenino" (Women's Development) meet every two weeks.  This is a place known for its delicious cuisine and for its vegetation.  The majority of the people who live here make their livings in agriculture and general sales.

This is where Señora María lives.  She is 33 years old and lives with her partner.  Together they have three children who are 11 and 8, and the youngest is just 4 months old.  The two oldest go to school.  Her husband is a bricklayer.

 
Señora María is a housewife who, to have her own money, makes a living selling Leonisa brand clothing from a catalog and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories).  She works four days a week, but hourly, as this is a job that does not have a set schedule.  She sells her products on credit and collects payments on a weekly basis.  She has been making her living with this work for three years, and it has been going very well for her.  What she sells the most of is lingerie, as that is in high demand from the ladies.

This loan is for the purchase of perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and undergarments.  This is Señora María's fifth cycle with the communal bank.  She likes the bank because it is easy to make the payments. 

Señora María's dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lotions, cosmetics and undergarments.

loans.name: Progreso De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the coordinator of her group "Progreso D. Esperanza" 1 & 2 (Progress of Hope). She is excited to be taK. her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 3 years, starting to work out of her house after she saved around $70 US, and started selling underwear. She plans to use this loan to buy pants, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, etc.

Paulina makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their one child, from 4 children they have just one of them that still lives at home. She says that her biggest challenge is to improve her business, by building a locale for it next to her house. She said her most favorite activities are attending to her family and work. 

She dreams to have her own locale and an improved business, which she could have higher incoming, changing her living conditions and from her family. All the members in this group are taK. loan to improved their business and their lives and they are located in the urban slums surrounding Samana.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad de Vaquería,  distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está  casada y tiene 1 hijo.  Estudió la primaria.
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra de animales y venta  de carne.  Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro animales para su carneo,  la carne lo vende en la localidad de Ilave.  La señora trabaja sola en el negocio aunque a veces le ayuda su esposo, quien se dedica al servicio de mototaxi (transporte).
La señora desea seguir y  mejorar el negocio así aumentar sus ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el compañerismo, el ahorro y la alegría entre las socias.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the Central Vaquería communal bank, located in the Vaquería area in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, and department of Puno.  She is 30 years old and married with one child.  She finished elementary school.

Her first loan was for the sum of 500 PEN, which she invested in her business of buying animals and selling meat.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for one year.

With this new loan of 500 PEN she will buy four animals for their meat.  She sells the meat in Ilave.  She works alone in the business, although sometimes her husband helps her.  He works in transportation, in mototaxi service.

Delia wants to continue and improve her business as well as increase her profits.

What she likes about the communal bank is the camaraderie, the savings, and the happiness among the members.

loans.use: to buy four animals for their meat.

loans.name: Mohssen

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 53 years old, married, and a father of one child who works with him.

Mohssen has been the owner of a bakery since 2010. He produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven, such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,000 loan in order to purchase two stone ovens and barrels for oils. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase two stone ovens and barrels for oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of  tomatoes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
From P-3 Manabay, Ozamiz City, Amor is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Amor has owned and operated a general store selling dry goods and beverages for over three years, earning approximately 9,000.00 a month.

A member of GDMPC for almost a year, Amor is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000.00 which will be used to purchase more products to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell.

loans.name: Alexis Agustin

texts.es:
el sr. Alexis Agustín tiene 38 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 4 hijos, Alexis es Caficultor y Agricultor, cuenta con más de 8 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café. 
el sr. Alexis utilizara el credito para comprar un sistema solar y gozar de este servicio para iluminar su casa por las noches, ya que solo se han alumbrado con candiles y candelas, mismos que son dañinos para la salud y el medio ambiente.
tambien quiere darles entretenimiento por medio de television a sus hijos, con esto va a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Alexis Agustín is 38 years old, lives in a committed relationship and is the father of four children. Alexis is a coffee grower and farmer and has over eight years of experience growing coffee. 

Mr. Alexis will use the loan to purchase a solar powered electric generator and use this service to light his home at night, since up until now they have had light only from oil lamps and candles, which are harmful to human health and the environment. He also wants to provide entertainment to his children via television. Thus his family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a solar powered electric generator

loans.name: Edgar Francisco

texts.es: Telica, uno de lo principales municipios de la ciudad de León , donde as calles son de adoquines, casas de adobe y techos de teja  justo ahí es donde es originario Edgar , un sencillo pero trabajador comerciante , de 40 años de edad, padre de familia, casado, tiene tres hijos de  18 ,17 y 6 años de edad, el mayor de sus hijos esta estudiando su primer año de la carrera de contabilidad su segundo hijo esta cursando el tercer año de la secundaria y el menor de sus hijos asiste al Kinder Garden, su esposa es ama de casa pero lo ayuda a el con el negocio de  la venta de ropa. Don Edgar alquila un pequeño local cerca de la iglesia del pueblo donde vende ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos, camisetas , pantalones, blusas, shorts, camisas de varón, todos los días sale de su caso cargando toda su mercancía para acomodarla en su humildes carretones y comenzar a vender para poder reunir el aliento y suplir las necesidades de su familia, el nos cuenta que empezó hace tres años con este negocio lo puso son unos ahorros que tenía el  pues antes el trabajaba en la alcaldía de su ciudad y también laboro para diferentes empresas pero las escases de trabajo se hizo intensa y no conseguía empleo formal así que decidió poner su negocio propio al ver muy pocas posibilidades de conseguir trabajo pues las necesidades de su familia no podían esperar gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien y es así como se gana la vida y saca adelante a sus hijos. El requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa nueva tales como camisas, jeans de varón y de mujer, blusas, fajas, camisetas, pantalones de tela. Pues se acerca la época navideña quiere aprovechar a vender toda su mercadería, así mejorar sus ventas, pagar su deuda e invertir en compra de maniquíes, vitrinas y mas variedad de mercadería para vender, en lo futuro le gustaría  tener su propio local para poner una tienda de ropa y contratar a personas para que lo ayuden a vender.
texts.en:
Telica, one of the principal municipalities of the city of Leon, where the streets are made of cobblestone, the houses of adobe, and the roofs of tile, is precisely where Edgar is from. He is a simple but hardworking businessman, 40 years old, a father of a family, and married. He has three children who are 18, 17, and 6 years old. The oldest of his children is taking the first year of an accounting course. His second child is in the third year of high school and his youngest child attends kindergarten. His wife is a housewife but she helps him with his retail clothing business.

Edgar rents a small place near the town church where he sells clothing for children, juniors, and adults, including pants, blouses, shorts, and men's shirts. Every day he leaves his home carrying all his merchandise to fit it all into his humble carts and begin to sell--to be able to gather his strength and supply for the needs of his family. He tells us that he started this business three years ago with some savings he had, as before that he worked in the city's mayor's office and also worked for different companies. But the scarcity of work became intense and he couldn't get a formal job so he decided to start his own business when he saw very few possibilities of getting work. The needs of his family couldn't wait, and thank God it has gone well for him and this is how he earns a living and gets his children ahead.

He needs the loan to buy new clothing such as shirts, men's and women's jeans, blouses, girdles, t-shirts, and trousers. The Christmas season is coming and he wants to take advantage to sell all of his merchandise, in this way improving his sales to pay off his debt and invest in buying mannequins, display cases, and more variety of merchandise to sell. In the future he would like to have his own place to create a clothing store and hire people to help him sell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes such as shirts, men's and women's jeans, blouses, girdles, t-shirts, and trousers.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, vegetables, spices, and firewood. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables, and firewood.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Margaret is taking another Kiva loan of 35,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to boost her green grocery business. With this loan she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future and earn more profit in the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Irma Eloisa

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Irma; La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de madera, ella también ahora se ha dedicado a preparar tamales de sal y dulce, la socia compra maiz y prepara conmanteca, sal, y dentro pone una salsa de cebollas, con aceituna y un pequeño trozo de carne y los tamales dulces con una pasa dentro, la socia también prepara cuy asado con su respectivo aderezo; ella ahora es una microempresaria con muchos animos de crecer y prosperar. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la elaboracion de tamales dulce sy salados y compra de cuyes.
texts.en:
Irma continues with her business of buying and selling wood.  Now she also has devoted herself to making salty and sweet tamales.  She buys corn and prepares it with fat and salt.  She puts an onion sauce with olives and a small piece of meat inside.  She puts raisins in the sweet tamales.

She also makes roasted guinea pig with its respective seasoning.

She is now a small businesswoman with great energy to grow and prosper.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients and supplies to make the sweet and salty tamales and to buy guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies to make the sweet and salty tamales and to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar Augusto  tiene 39 años de edad, vive en Ica, Perú. Ica se encuentra ubicado en el Desierto de Sechura cerca de cuatro horas al sur de Lima, la capital del país, y es aclamado por los peruanos como "La Tierra del Sol". Es conocida en el Perú por sus frecuentes terremotos (un 8,0 en 2007 y 6.9 en 2011), su producción de uvas, espárragos y aceitunas, y tal vez sobre todo, como la fuente de la bebida tradicional del Perú, el Pisco. En este clima cálido y árido se encuentra la casa y empresa del cliente.  En su tiempo libre Cesar disfruta escuchar música;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Cesar Augusto  le encante es el  “Ceviche”. 

Cesar Augusto estudió hasta quinto año de secundaria y le hubiera gustado ser Oficial de Policía. Cesar se dedica la reparación y mantenimiento de cocinas, le dedica a este trabajo 7 horas, quien animo a Cesar a tener este trabajo fue su padrastro. En un día Cesar puede atender hasta 2 clientes ya que es un trabajo laborioso y delicado;  esto le permite ganar hasta S/. 30 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 50 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales del hogar, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo, además gracias a ello sus clientes recomiendan su servicio a otras personas. 

Esta infinitamente agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva porque gracias a su apoyo va poder comprar de 2 maquinas eléctricas. Esta mejora podrá ayudarle a tener mayores ingresos para su negocio ya que tendrá las maquinas necesarias para la realización de su trabajo dará un mejor servicio y le generaría mayores ingresos y así poder en algunos meses tener un taller más amplio para la realización de su trabajo lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su casa propia."
texts.en:
Cesar Augusto, age 39, lives in Ica, Peru, located in the Sechura Desert about four hours from Lima, the country’s capital. Ica is known among Peruvians as “The Land of the Sun”. It is also known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.0 in 2007 and a 6.9 in 2011), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and, perhaps above all, Peru’s traditional drink, the Pisco.

The client’s business is found in this hot and arid climate. In his free time, Cesar enjoys listening to music. As is well known, Peru is characterized by having the most delicious food in the world, and one of the dishes Cesar Augusto loves is ceviche. Cesar Augusto studied in secondary school until he was fifteen, and he would have liked to be a police officer.

Cesar is engaged in the repair and maintenance of kitchen ranges and cookers. He works 7 hours a day. The person who encouraged him to take up this work was his stepfather. In a day, Cesar can serve up to 2 customers since the work is laborious and delicate. This allows him to earn up to 30 soles a day, and on a good day he can earn up to 50 soles, which helps him with additional household expenses. He believes his business is doing well because he does a good job and, thanks to this, his customers recommend his service to others.

He is infinitely thankful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, he is going to be able to buy 2 electric machines. These will be better able to help him have greater income from his business since having the machines necessary to carry out his work will provide better service, give him greater income, and, thus, after some months, enable him to have a bigger shop for his work. This will help him to fulfill his greatest dream: To have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase machines to help in repairing kitchen ranges and cookers.

loans.name: Las Azucenas Group

texts.es: La Sra. America, tiene 3 hijos  es casada y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 3 año y medio junto al grupo “Las Azucenas”, grupo conformado por 7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. America trabaja en una bulcanizadora es decir ella tiene su propio taller donde  reparan llantas,este negocio surge con la idea de apoyar a su esposo ya que el es taxista, para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos ambos trabajaron muy duro, este negocio ya tiene 12 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado educacion para sus hijos, se compro terrenos en Huancayo y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad de vida,con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para mantenimiento y mejorar su negocio de llantas. Sabemos que America cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
América has three children and is married.  She has been working with EDAPROSPO for three years along with the Las Azucenas group, made up of seven members who work in various business activities.

América works in a repair shop.  That is, she has her own shop where they repair tires.  This business came from the idea of helping her husband, since he is a taxi driver.  They both worked very hard to be able to get their children ahead.  This business is already 12 years old.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has achieved education for her children.  She bought land in Huancayo and her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow she has requested a new loan to maintain and improve her tire business.  We know that América will achieve her goals with a lot of work and effort, and that the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

loans.use: to maintain her tire shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a widow with one grown up son and several grand children. She is an active member of Queen Esther Group and has benefited a lot from the group through loans she has been getting. Her first loan from KIVA of USD 300 enabled her to install electricity in her rental rooms. This lead to increment of monthly charges from USD 7 to USD10. She was also able to install power in her house which made a significant change in her life. Her family was touched by the loan because since she got married she had not seen electricity in her house. The whole family was touched by the loan and their living standard changed abit. Her grandchildren work as a team and they grow varieties of vegetables for sale and they help her in loan repayment. She supports the children with the income she get from rental rooms and she has housed them. She believes knowledge is power, thus it’s her responsibility to pay fees for her grandchildren as their father is not bothered. She finished paying her last loan payments in the last group meeting and she feels the next loan will not strain her much.This will enable her grand daughter to report to school on the opening date rather than staying for 2 weeks waiting for the tenants to make their monthly repayments. After paying the school fees for one year Lucy makes her monthly loan installments through Queen Esther women group. Lucy finds these arrangements very convenient for her family, her tenants and the school where her daughter studies from.

loans.use: Lucy wants to pay school fees for her granddaughter

loans.name: Gaméli

texts.en:
Gaméli D. was born in 1969 in Afagnan (Lacs Prefecture) and is married with three children. To meet his family’s needs, he stores corn in good seasons and sells it when there is a shortage. His wife helps make ends meet by selling food at area schools.

During the current period of abundance, he doesn’t want to waste the opportunity of very low corn prices and is requesting a loan of $950 to create a large inventory and increase sales. The income will be used to improve his family’s living conditions and increase his saving capability.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur D. Gaméli est né en 1969 à Afagnan (P/Lacs). Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Pour subvenir aux charges familiales, il fait le stockage de maïs en période d’abondance pour revendre en temps de pénurie. Sa femme qui vend des denrées alimentaires dans les établissements scolaires contribue elle aussi moyennement aux charges de sa famille.

En cette période d’abondance, Mr D. ne voudrait pas rater sa saison surtout que les prix sont très bas actuellement. Il sollicite un crédit de $950 pour faire des tonnes de stockage de maïs afin d’espérer un bon chiffre d’affaire. Le bénéfice sera destiné à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et à augmenter sa capacité d’épargne.

loans.use: Purchase, stocking and sale of corn

loans.name: Belem

texts.en:
Belem is very hard working. She really enjoys sales and interacting with others. These attributes have helped her a great deal in her business selling shoes. She works hard to improve every day and get ahead and demand for her products has been growing lately. To meet this demand, she needs would like to borrow $250 which she promises to repay in 3 to 6 months. You can play a key role in the growth of this business. Belem believes in those who help others in need and thanks you sincerely for any help you can give her.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Alexis Hult

La señora Belem es una mujer muy trabajadora y activa, a ella le gustan mucho las ventas, su carácter y la facilidad para relacionarse con las personas le han ayudado mucho con su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado, y se esfuerza cada día por mejorar y superarse, últimamente la demanda por sus productos se ha incrementado por la entrada de la nueva temporada, y para poder surtir estos pedidos necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses.

Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Belem confía en las personas que ayudan a quien más lo necesita y te agradece sinceramente cualquier ayuda que puedas ofrecerle.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her merchandise

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He has two children. He has a tailoring shop in Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1000 to purchase a new sewing machine and buy some raw material to help him to develop his business and increase his income. He is looking for a better life and an improved standard of living.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Joachim

texts.en: Joachim is 32 year old hard working resident of Vituka. He has got multi businesses in the area ranging from shops, kiosks and a grocery. At of the shop where this photo was taken, he has employed two assistants and it sells cosmetics, art crafts, and other house hold items. Joachim has received business management and entrepreneurship skills training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. All his three business are working out well for him and now needs another loan to expand his art and crafts shop. He is now in need of USD 1075 to help expand his business.

loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
ANGELA, age 34, lives with her 5-year-old daughter and her brother’s 2 children (ages 19 and 8). While her brother gives her some financial assistance for raising his children, she supports her home through the profits she earns from her shop. Her shop, called “Angel’s Boutique,” is open from 8:30am to 6:30pm daily and sells imported clothing, shoes, and accessories for women and children. She opened her shop 4 years ago right after she finished doing secretarial studies.

Her business consists of traveling to Dubai around 3 times a year to bring back clothes to sell in Dar es Salaam. From one dress she buys in Dubai, she is able to earn about $10 in profit. At her shop, around 3 or 4 customers come in every day, and she is able to make a profit of around $225 each week. She uses some of her profits to pay the shop rent of $90 a month and to also pay her shop assistant’s salary.

Earlier this year, Angela took out a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to hire someone to travel to Kampala, Uganda, to purchase jewelry for her shop. She was able to pay this loan back successfully. With this new loan, she hopes to return to Dubai sometime before Christmas to purchase more clothing.

She belongs to the group Tiger, which consists of 22 other members who keep each other accountable and support one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothes from Dubai

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. and her husband Mr. Dharma L. are both farmers in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. They grow different types of vegetables on their own land. Mostly they prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Mrs L.'s husband is a painter. He makes traditional paintings.

Mrs. L. has three children. All her children are grown. Her daughter is a teacher. Her only son is studying and working abroad and another son has left his studies and presently has no work.

Now Mrs. L. is requesting her 3rd loan, this time in the amount of US$ 325, to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Annamary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! Annamary M. is a 52-year-old widow with four children. Her children are between the ages of 19 and 34 years old. In 2004 Annamary established a bar and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of beer, liquor, and soft drinks. Undoubtedly, Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or 'words" in the world. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of "bar" selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness; Annamary notes that Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the less-populated areas, but she is sure that Pepsi is working on expanding into those areas too!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing, which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture regardless of whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd. in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of beer, liquor, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene is a hard-working mother, preoccupied with the well-being of her family. Ten years ago, with the help of her dear husband, she installed a little store in her house in order to satisfy the basic needs of her neighbors. Her continued labor and attention to customer service have helped her become innovative in sales and offer higher quality products month to month. She has a project in mind for her little store: she'd like to convert it into a sales floor with a larger variety of products as the demand for various items has increased little by little. For this reason, she needs your urgent help to realize her most desired dream.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Marlene, es una madre muy trabajadora y preocupada por el bienestar de su hogar. Con la ayuda de su querido esposo hace diez años instaló una pequeña bodega a fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus vecinos, con productos de primera necesidad.Su continuo trabajo y preocupación por mejorar las condiciones del servicio que brinda la han ayudado a innovar en la venta de sus productos y a ofrecer mes a mes mejores artículos.Tiene en mente el proyecto de convertir su pequeña bodega en un espacio de ventas con mayor variedad de artículos ya que la solicitud de los mismos ha ido variando y acrecentándose paulatinamente. Por esa razón solicita vuestra importante ayuda para hacer realidad su anhelado sueño.

loans.use: To buy a larger variety of articles so she can continue satisfying customer demands.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Mrs. Irma García Torrejón is a member of the Communal Bank "Nuestra Señora de la Paz". She lives in the department and province of San Martín, Tarapoto district. Her seamstress workshop is based out of her own home, located at Jr. Circunvalación #2308 in the same district. She started this business 33 years ago along with her mother; she was her inspiration and the person who constantly motivated her to become independent and get ahead in order to provide the best for her family. With the loan of $550 USD which will be paid in 6 months, she will purchase: threads of various colors, good quality fabrics of various materials (cotton, licra, broadcloth, dracon) with many designs in meters and bolts to satisfy her demanding customers and provide good service. Currently, she is 48 years old and has 3 independent children. She considers herself a woman that is happy about what she has accomplished. In the future, she is thinking about selling clothing for children, men and women out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Irma García Torrejón es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Señora de la Paz”, vive en Departamento, Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, su taller de costura esta ubicado en su propia casa ubicado en el Jr: Circunvalación Nº 2308 del mismo distrito. Se inicio hace 33 años en el negocio junto con su mamá que ella fue su inspiración y el ser constante le motivo a independizarse y seguir adelante para dar lo mejor a su familia. Con el préstamo de 1500.00 que será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprara: hilos de colores variados, telas de diferentes materiales: Algodón, licra, popelina, dacron, en variados diseños y de buena calidad en metros y fardos para satisfacer a su exigente clientela un buen servicio. Actualmente tiene 48 años de edad, con 3 hijos independientes, se considera una mujer feliz de lo que ha logrado en futuro piensa poner en su propia casa venta de ropas para niños, caballeros y damas.

loans.use: With the loan, she will buy materials for her business

loans.name: Agness's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Agness is 49 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 25,20 and 15 years old. Agness owns a small general store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

In the past, Agness has borrowed and successfully repaid a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy a machine to drill for water. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Sharifa and Habiba. who sell food.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. sells food items. She is married, with two children, but her husband's income is insufficient. Demand has been high, and she would like to expand her business.

She is asking for a loan as additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Pio

texts.es:
Pío M. is married but so far has no children. He is a small businessman who sells clothing and shoes for men, women and children in addition to various other items. Pío has worked in this field for four years. He also makes deliveries in the area and sells on credit to officials of the local cooperative and to an herbal healer. He has a good clientele in the city market as well. He keeps a good stock of merchandise which allows him to make a good income. He also always works at harvest time, gathering yerba mate (a coffee/tea-like herb) during which time his business is attended to by his wife.

Pío will use this loan to purchase additional merchandise, winter clothing, blankets and other seasonal items to sell. He recommends working with the Paraguayan Foundation as it has been a great help to small business owners who are just beginning to use credit in their operation.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Ann Kenney Molloy

Pío M. está casado y actualmente vive en alquiler pero aun no tienen hijos. El mismo es micro empresario, se dedica a la venta de mercaderías ropas para criaturas, calzados, ropas para caballeros, damas, artículos de bazar, etc.

Cuenta con 4 años de antigüedad en el rubro, no esta demás mencionar que también realiza repartos de mercaderías por la zona y vende a créditos a funcionarios de una Yerbatera y Cooperativa, además posee muy buena clientela lo que le genera la zona del mercado municipal de la ciudad. Posee un buen stock de mercaderías lo que le genera un buen ingreso.

También el cliente suele trabajar en época de zafra de yerba (cosecha) y el negocio entonces es atendido por su cónyuge. El destino del crédito será para la compra de mercaderías, ropas de invierno, frazadas y otros. El cliente recomienda operar con Fundación Paraguaya ya que es una gran ayuda para los microempresarios que están comenzando a trabajar con créditos..

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as winter clothing, blankets and related items

loans.name: Hekima Group

texts.en: Anna S. is hoping to expand the clothing shop that she started in Arusha in 2007.  She is married with three children, ages 11, 7, and 6.  She works every day from 9:00am to 4:00pm and can make a monthly profit of approximately $18.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her profit and grow her business.  She has taken out one previous loan through BRAC Tanzania which she repaid on time.

loans.use: To grow her small clothing shop.

loans.name: Nicholas Kah

texts.en:
Nicholas's first loan in 2001 was for 15,000 CFA francs ($38), which he invested in his farm. Over the years, he has used other loans to expand his businesses and increase his income.

GHAPE, a small NGO in northwest Cameroon, has a policy of increasing loan size only when borrowers have shown they are responsible. As a long-standing member with an excellent repayment record, Nicholas has recently applied for a larger loan over 24 months. He intends to use this money to further invest in his farm. Some of his output will help feed his family; the rest, he will sell at market.

Nicholas is 58 and has two wives and eight children, two of whom still live at home with him. He says that previous GHAPE loans have been a great help in paying for his children's school fees and looking after their health.

loans.use: To buy seeds and animals.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel empezó vendiendo cosmeticos primero porque necesitaba un ingreso extra ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba, y si trabajaba en una empresa no podria pasar tiempo con su familia, por eso empezó a dedicarse a trabajar por su cuenta, y poco a poco logro resultados positivos obteniendo buenas ganancias de sus ventas.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella saldra adelante.
texts.en:
Isable started selling cosmetics because she needed the extra income and because her husband's income was not enough to cover everything. And if she were to work for a company she would not be able to pass time with her family, which is why she started to work on her own account. Slowly she started to see positive results and she was seeing good earnings with her sales.

She requires a loan in the amount of $950 US which will be repaid in a term of 6 months. She will use thse funds to purchase merchandise. With your support she will continue to enjoy her success.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz inicio su negocio al ver que su esposo empezaba con el taller e iniciaba con pocos clientes por lo que en ocasiones su situación económica era difícil, entonces ella decide empezar a tocar puertas para la venta de productos cosméticos por catalogo, ya que en la colonia donde vive la conocían porque también vende tamales, pero en ocasiones la gente no compra mucho así que la venta no es muy segura, y corría el riesgo de que se le echarán a perder, asi que decidió dedicarse al 100% a la venta de cosméticos, ya que como es sobre pedido el riesgo es menor.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $225 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía tener inventario, y así venderlo en temporada Decembrina.
texts.en:
Beatriz started her business because her husband was just beginning in his shop and had few clients making their financial situation difficult at times. At this point she decided to go door to door selling cosmetic products from a catalog, taking advantage of the fact that she was well known in the area because she also sells tamales. At times the people did not buy much making her sales not that certain and running the risk of beginning to loose business, this made her decide to dedicate 100% of her time to the sale of cosmetics since they are based on orders and the risk is lower.

She needs a loan of $225 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and have inventory to sell in the December season.


Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gaibullo

texts.ru: Баротов Гайбулло житель города Душанбе. Женат . Имеет одного сына. Имеет автомашину "Opel" , которую использует  для частного такси. Он работает в центре города. Но в связи с тем , что цены на бензин растут , ему необходимо установить газовое оборудование. Поэтому он обратился к нам за кредитом. Он запрашивает 1200 долларов США.сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gaibullo B. lives in the city Dushanbe with his wife and son. He uses his Orel brand car as a private taxi in the city's downtown. Because gas prices are rising, he wants to install a natural gas-based fuel system in his car. To do this he came to us for a loan. He is requesting 1200 dollars, to be repaid in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of natural gas fuel system

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda sells vegetables to her neighbors. She is married to Pedro, a farmer who manages their rice and corn farmland. They are blessed with three children: Gilbert, 20 years old and a college graduate; Gerald, 17 years old and a fourth-year high school student; and Grace,11 years old. Like them, the villagers are disciplined and hardworking too.

Gilda requests a loan of $350 (16,000 PHP). She plans to purchase two piglets for their backyard piggery, and purchase supplies for their small farm. Gilda plans to use a larger portion of the loan to buy vegetables, meat, fish, beef, and other groceries that she can sell to her regular customers. These purchases will help bring in more income to her family. Like any other parents, Gilda dreams of good education for her children and a better life for them.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and farm supplies, and buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Adelaida
