To make a living, Herminia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Herminia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Herminia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herminia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to plant and harvest rice for sale. Herminia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Herminia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Mrs. Vivian S. B. is from the village of P1 Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Vivian is married and has five children -- three are grown up and two are teenagers. To make a living, Vivian owns and operates a business making and selling snacks. She makes a snack called "Biko," which is a rice cake made from Malagkit rice. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from her work. In 2007, Vivian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her family's riceland. The remaining amount will be used as additional capital for her Biko-making business. Vivian plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. She will use some of the revenue to meet her family's basic needs, and save some for future use and house renovations. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing snack vending  (Biko, Malagkit rice cakes) business.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben is 28 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 3½ years old. His eldest child is currently attending school.

Reuben is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for four years and has one employee. His product is milk which he sells to the tea estate. He also earns income from the sale of tea to the local market.

Reuben’s biggest challenges in farming are the constant fluctuation in milk prices and inadequate artificial insemination services.

Reuben has requested this Kes 45,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will assist him in meeting the basic needs of his family and in paying school fees for his children.

In five years time, Reuben hopes to acquire more quality dairy cows and build a dairy unit.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: L. Marie est née en 1949 à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Marie vit depuis une vingtaine d’année à Agblangandan, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à DANSOU Avocè, Marie est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Marie n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Marie mène comme activité la vente de condiments de sauce (tomate, oignons, piments, conserves, huile de palme) et du charbon de bois en détail à son domicile. Marie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marie exerce cette activité depuis vingt deux ans, et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite un troisième prêt pour rehausser le niveau de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Marie L. was born in 1949 in Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. She has been living for some twenty years in Agblangandan, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Married to Avocè Dansou, marie is the mother of two children, both of whom go to schol. Marie lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the various family expenses jointly. Marie did not attend school. In order to provider for her own and her children’s needs, she retails sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, canned foods, palm oil) as well as charcoal out of her home. She stocks up in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She has been in this business for 22 years, and had previously obtained two credits from ALIDé, both duly repaid. Facing ever increasing customer demand, she is seeking a third loan in order to expand her activities and to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sauce condiments (tomatoes, onions, hot peppers etc) and charcoal

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon P. is 39 years old and is the group leader, having been selected by its four members located in Ampil Toek village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes.
 
Mrs. Thon P. is a farmer and she also is a vegetable seller who works very hard to support her four children. Her husband, Mr. Phouk Soun, is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family's living costs. For vegetable selling, Mrs. Thon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business activities. This couple has four children: three are seamstresses in the garment factory and the last one is a student.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business activities.

loans.name: Jessie Leo

texts.en:
Jessie Leo J. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 19 years old. Jessie Leo is married and has one infant child. Jessie Leo owns  a business which provides motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jessie Leo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service and motorcycle maintenance. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jessie Leo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Hima Agahikaine Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
K. Bonefance, aged 43, is married and has a family of 4 children. He has been operating a retail shop from Munobwa trading centre, Kyenjojo for over 10 years. In his business, he trades in a variety of products such as commonly used household items like sugar, salt, soft drinks, sodas, water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. He does this business alongside his other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops in Uganda. His main drawback is that he has a limited variety of products in his shop. He find that his current stock cannot satisfy the customers demands. Therefore he is looking forward to increase stock in his business, when he gets this loan, and also to expand into a wholesale shop. This will help him earn more revenue and to sustain his daily life needs and to further the educate of his children. 

K. Bonefance belongs to a group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more stock like sugar, salt, soft drinks like sodas, water, cooking oil and much more for resale.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita M. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old and widowed, with two adult-aged children. To make a living, Clarita owns and operates a business venture raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Clarita is just starting this business.

In 2008, Clarita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to build a shelter for her livestock. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support her immediate family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.
texts.en: Mme S. Afiwa vit actuellement à Afomekponawoé oû elle est née en 1965. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Née dans une famille d’agriculteurs, elle s’est elle-même lancée dans les travaux champêtres notamment à la culture du maïs et du souchet qui lui procure un minimum de revenu. C’est par les maigres revenus tirés de son travail de la terre qu’elle arrive à subvenir aux besoins nécessaires de sa famille. Elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.use: augmenter sa superficie cultivable et acheter des intrants agricoles.

loans.name: Melba Isabel

texts.es: La Sra. Melba S. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como Secretaria del vice alcalde de dicho municipio donde tiene dos años de laborar. Es el primer crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos de piso, cemento y pago de mano de obra con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Ms. Melba S., a native of the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, is currently working as secretary to the town's vice-mayor, a she has been working in this capacity for two years. This is the first loan she is requesting to Ceprodel: she will use it to buy flooring bricks and concrete and to pay workers to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To buy flooring bricks and concrete and to pay workers' wages.

loans.name: Daisy Jane

texts.en:
Daisy Jane C. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and single. To make a living, Daisy Jane is an employee in a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of her income comes primarily from accept encoding and printing services in the local community. Daisy Jane is just starting this business.

In 2010, Daisy Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital of her business. Daisy Jane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better services. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Daisy Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy N. is a 17-year-old living in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero region of Uganda. Single and with no children, for the past two years Teddy has operated a poultry and pig production business.

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase chickens and pigs. With the help of the loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees, and in the future hopes to become a businesswoman.

Teddy is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to become independent and responsible.

loans.use: To buy chickens and pigs

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarem Y. (shown in the photo) has been running a grocery store at home for more than 10 years. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. 

Sarem asked for a Kiva loan one previous time already. She is now requesting another loan of $600 to purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and to continue expanding her grocery store.

The family lives in a small village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase a sugar cane juicing machine and to continue expanding her grocery store.

loans.name: Djiwonou Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est mariée et a 3 enfants en charge. Elle est née à Lomé et habite quartier adakpamé.  Pour contribuer au ménage, elle fait la vente de produits génériques.  Elle s’approvisionne dans une pharmacie villageoise et expose ses différents produits à la devanture de sa maison. En plus, elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 7 ans. L’objet du crédit sera essentiellement destiné à l’achat de nouveaux produits pour satisfaire plus de clients.
texts.en: Adjo is married and has 3 children in her care. She was born in Lomé and lives in the Adakpamé area. To contribute to her household, she sells generic drugs. She gets her supplies at a village pharmacy and displays her various products in front of her house. She has run this business for 7 years. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy new products to satisfy more customers.

loans.use: To buy generic products

loans.name: Alice Wangithi

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old, a widowed mother of three children. She lost her husband through a traffic accident in 2006. She has been operating her rice farm for eight years now with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

She is taking a third loan with KADET LTD and she intends to use the loan to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses.  She hopes to provide a higher level of education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses

loans.name: Baktybek

texts.en:
Baktybek C. is 29 years old, married and has three children. He was born in a large family of farmers and from early childhood was engaged in cultivating vegetables, which his family sold at the local market. After finishing school, Baktybek moved to the capital city Bishkek and started his business of reselling vegetables. Thanks to his wide experience in cultivating vegetables, he was able to open a selling point at the local market, which became known for its high quality products. With the starting capital of 5,000 KGS, he managed to earn about 15,000 KGS in a month.

Now Baktybek has applied for a loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden the assortment of goods by purchasing garlic and cucumbers. With the revenues, he plans to open a second selling point with fruits and vegetables. In the future, he dreams of building a house for his family.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Sangaré  est un homme marié de 43 ans qui est un polygame vivant au village N’Tjinina,  dans une grande famille traditionnelle,  avec ses  six  enfants, préfecture de  Kolondièba,    troisième région administrative de la République du Mali. 
Moussa Sangaré fait l’achat vente de céréales de toutes sortes depuis maintenant deux ans.
Pour augmenter son capital il adhère au programme de  Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son deuxième prêt. Le premier a été bien remboursé. 
En ce moment où les céréales sont chères, Monsieur Sangaré fait ses achats à un prix très abordable. Pendant  la saison sèche  il vend ses articles aux revendeurs et consommateurs.
Il compte acheter, 10 tonnes de maïs  céréales à  Kolondièba auprès des producteurs et dans les villages environnants.     
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice bimestriel de 50.000FCFA.
Le bénéfice  sera investi dans la nourriture et dans les frais scolaires.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa Sangare is a 43-year old married man who is polygamous and who lives in the village of N'Tjinina. He lives in a large traditional family, including six children, in the prefecture of Kolondieba, the third administrative region in the Republic of Mali. 

Moussa Sangare's business has been to buy and sell cereal grains of all sorts for the past two years. In order to supplement his capital he joined Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). It is his second loan. The first loan was successfully repaid. 

At this moment when cereal grains are abundant, Mr. Sangare makes his purchases at a very affordable price. During the dry season he sells his product to retailers and to consumers. He plans on purchasing 10 tons of corn in Kolondieba from the producers in the surrounding villages. 

He expects to make a bimonthly profit of 50.000FCFA. The profits will be invested in the purchase of food and to pay for schooling fees.

loans.use: To purchase cereal grains.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael W. is married and has eight children. He has been working as a farmer for 20 years, producing goods such as bananas, avocados and milk for sale. The main challenges he faces in running his business are the cost of purchasing pesticides and the lack of rain.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 KES in order to drill for water, which will be used to irrigate his farm. 

In five years, he hopes to have expanded his business through the purchase of more dairy cows. 

With the potential increase in income from the loan, he hopes to further expand his farming business.

loans.use: To drill for irrigation water

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en:
Mirriam M. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Mirriam is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Mirriam owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the market. Mirriam has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mirriam joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirriam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mirriam is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Mirriam from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace T. is from the village of Liong, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years-old. Grace is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling home products such as plastic plates, trays, glasses, spoon and forks in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over one years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Grace joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace is requesting a first loan from HSPFI in the amount of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as porcelain plates and mugs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as porcelain plates and mugs.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is 45, single and has three children. Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest is 3. For the last 24 years, she has made a living by selling goats. She has applied for this loan to buy more goals to sell, and is very committed to continue expanding her business by reinvesting her profits in it.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es: Gerson, de 37 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Irene de 25 años y sus 2 hijas Lizeth de 5 y Jenifer de 3 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Todas las mañanas Gerson se esmera mucho en trabajar sus tierras y dejarlas muy fértiles, ya que sabe que de eso depende la calidad de su café y plátano, productos que posteriormente cosechará para llevarlos a vender al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene mucha libertad para trabajar en sus tierras, ya que es su propio jefe, sin embargo el cuidar sus plantas de café de los insectos y el clima le resulta muy trabajoso. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la capacidad de pagar todas sus cuotas, es uno de los miembros más activos en su banco comunal, por eso es muy querido y respetado. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para hacer más fértiles sus tierras.
texts.en:
Gerson is 37 years old.  He is a very kind and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 25 year-old Irene, and his two daughters, 5 year-old Lizeth and 3 year-old Jenifer, who are the main motivation behind all his efforts.

Every morning, Gerson takes great care in working his land and making it fertile since he knows that the quality of his coffee and bananas depends on it.  After he has harvested his crops, he takes them to sell in the market in the town of Pichanaki.  What Gerson most enjoys about his work is the great freedom that he has to work on his land since he is his own boss. Nevertheless, he considers the most difficult part of his work to be weeding his coffee plantations.  Over time, Gerson would like to buy new land, in order to increase his production.

This is Gerson's second loan from MFP and he feels capable of making all his repayments.  He is one of the most active members of his community bank and, for this reason, he is very well liked and respected.  He will use the 600 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy more manure to make his land more fertile.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of manure

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa Q. is a 48-year-old married woman, who used to do her own house decoration. Her husband Ali and her children noticed that she is artistic and had a sense of creativity in doing that, so they encouraged her to start her own business.

Asmaa started 5 years ago, making beautiful baskets and painting frames at her house using straw and other materials. Over these five years she was able to gain more customers by word of mouth.

Since Asmaa’s business is growing, she applied for this loan so she can open her own independent store and to buy more materials to have more variety of products.

loans.use: to open her own independent store.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos secos, ella vende tirgo, cebada y maíz, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Jesusa, age 54, is married and has four children. She is a member of the communal bank  “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” located in the Zurite district of the Anta province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Jesusa divides her time between her daily activities with her business of selling dry products -- she sells wheat, barley, and corn. She sells them in the street, working from 8am until 6pm. Jesusa would like to expand her business of selling dry products. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase dry products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase dry products wholesale

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette M. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Rosette has a stationery shop business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Rosette has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more printing paper for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Rosette hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more printing paper for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is from the village of Pahindong, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Teresita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa, de 31 años, reside en la localidad de Puente Capelo (selva central peruana). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Nilton, con quien convive desde hace 12 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas Tatiana y Jocelyn. Desde muy joven comenzó a producir la tierra, ya que la principal actividad económica del lugar es “la agricultura”. Pero desde hace 12 años viene sembrando de forma independiente café, palta y plátanos. Los cuales lo realizan con el apoyo de su esposo. Juntos todas las mañanas se dirigen a sus plantaciones donde limpian, podan y cosechan sus sembríos. Cuando ya están listos los comercializan a la señora Alicia, quien tiene un depósito en la localidad. Llevando así los frutos a diversos lugares del país. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es pasar la mayor parte del día con su familia. Más le desagrada tener que ver los productos malogrados por las inclemencias del tiempo. Actualmente  empezará con la cosecha de café, pues con el dinero que obtenga en esta campaña podrá mejorar su casita y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Flor de café” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Elsa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café y plátanos de la variedad “isla”.
texts.en:
Elsa, 31, lives in Puente Capelo (in the Central Peruvian forest).  She lives with Nilton, her partner of 12 years.  They have two daughters, Tatiana and Jocelyn. She started farming at an early age, since "agriculture" is the main economic activity in the area.  But for the last 12 years, she and her husband have been farming coffee, avocados, and bananas independently. Every morning, they drive to their fields, where they clean, plant, and harvest their crops.  When the crops are ready, they sell them to Alicia, who has a depot in the area.  From there, their fruit is taken around the country.   What they like about the work is that they can be together as a family for most of the day.  But they hate seeing their crops ruined by the weather.  At the moment, they have begun the coffee harvest; they will use the money they get to improve their home and thereby give their children a better quality of life.  

Elsa is a member of the "Flor de café" community bank, and this is her third loan with MFP.  She promises to pay her installments on time, as she has always done before.  She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and very friendly people,  She will use the loan to buy bags of organic fertilizer to spread around her coffee plants and "island"-variety bananas.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married and is 47 years old. She has a retail shop where she sells both food and products for daily use, such as soap and shampoo, as well as instant noodles, cigarettes, soft drinks, condiments and eggs. Susan has had this business for five years. 

Susan is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods, and condiments to increase her sales.
In the future, Susan would like to increase her profit and be able to save for future expenses.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks, canned goods and condiments.

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
EL señor Marvin José  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en una empresa ubicada en Managua desempeñándose como analista de cartografía digital,  el señor es una persona responsable, honestos.
El señor solicito su crédito para hacer mejoras en su Vivienda,   para comprar materiales de construcción
Como verjas.
Las mejoras que   El señor va hacer es la instalación de verja para darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda.
   Manifiesta que con el préstamo que se le ha otorgado en ceprodel los va utilizar en hacer mejoras de su vivienda  y así mejoras las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Marvin José lives in the city of Managua and works in a company located in Managua working as a digital map analyst. He is a responsible and honest person. He requested his loan to make improvements to his house and to buy construction materials such as gates. The improvements that he is going to make are the installation of the gate to give his house greater security. He states that, with the loan that Ceprodel has granted him, he is going to make improvements to his house and therefore improve the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Lina has a shop that sells dried fish. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional dried fish to sell.

Lina has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 40 years-old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 22, 25 and 29.  

In 1999, Nirmala established her cow-raising business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to purchase a young milk-giving cow. In the future, Nirmala plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: La señora Rufina se dedica a la venta de comida específicamente sopa de pescado y su esposo trabaja como ayudante de albañil. Ambas activididades combinadas son la fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de papa, chuño y pescado, que son los ingredientes principales para su sopa de pescado. Es casada y no tiene hijos; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Rufina sells food, particularly fish soup, while her husband works as a masonry assistant. Both of these combined activities are the source of income by which they have to maintain their family. Rufina needs this loan to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish since these are the main ingredients used in preparing her fish soup. She is married and has no children. Rufina lives in her own home in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and fish.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine earns a living through farming. She is 49 years old and married.

Josephine owns and tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, where she and her family also live. Josephine primarily grows rice crops to sell. She said she wakes up early in the morning to attend to her farming duties. Josephine does her best to be a good wife and mother. She wants a happy family.

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necklaces, chains, bracelets, gold earrings and gold-plated jewelry.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a 67-year-old married woman with 8 children. She is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Fe helps her husband plant rice crops on their land. She also raises pigs to fatten and sell. Fe works hard to help improve her family's living situation. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials. Fe hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as silk and hemp thread for making hammocks.

loans.name: Jean Damasene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 28 years old, married, and the father of two children ages 2 and 5.

He  has been operating a well-organized business selling shoes for five years. It is open from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily, and he employs one person to help him. 

Jean Damascene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. He plans to save for his family's future and to reinvest in his business with his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is married to Philomena, and together they have one child. He distributes bread, and he raises livestock and poultry. He has been in the farming business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 from the business.


This is his first loan term from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase animal feed and more poultry.


With the expected profit, he will rear pigs at his farm. His dream is to have a stable income to support his young family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, oil and instant soups.

loans.name: Tania Doris

texts.es: Tania es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad, tiene 27 años, tiene 1 hijo, es socia D. FINCA Peru desD. hace 3 años. Tania se dedica a L. venta D.  abarrotes, galletas y los reparte a las zonas D. Tambillo, Checco, YanamilL., con los créditos que L. Institución le otorgó lo invirtió en su negocio y gracias L. rentabilidad obtenida ahora tiene su panadería, le gusta las capacitaciones porque le enseña a saber dirigir su negocio. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en L. compra D. insumos para hacer panteones y bolsas naviD.ñas. Su sueño es comprar su terreno y construir su casa y abrir su panadería en su local propio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Communal Bank “Generosidad” (Generosity). She is 27 years old and has one child. Tania has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years. She sells groceries and cookies and distributes her products in the districts of Tambillo, Checco, and YanamilL.. With the loans from the organization, Tania has been able to invest in her business. Thanks to the profits she has earned, she now has a bakery. She enjoys the training seminars because they have taught her how to manage her business.

The loan she is requesting now will be used to buy supplies for making panettone and Christmas baskets. Her dream is to buy a plot of land so that she can build a house and operate her bakery from her own location. This will help her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making panettone and Christmas baskets.

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children.
 
Rizan has a shop that sells fish such as trout, sardines and mackerel. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Rizan has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rizan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia, tiene 42 años de edad, casada desde hace 16 años, tienen 3 hijos de 10, 12 y 15 años de edad, quienes están estudiando, vive en una aldea de  San Manuel, Cortes. Su esposo trabaja en empresa privada en área de mantenimiento.

Ana Julia, una señora muy trabajadora, tiene 15 años de vender mercadería nueva como camisas, pantalones, jeans, blusas y trajes. Anteriormente, trabajaba en una empresa privada pero decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa porque obtiene mejores ingresos. 

Inicio su negocio con fondos propios, lleva  dos prestamos solicitados a ODEF para incrementar su inventario, con el préstamo actual va surtir mas de ropa como blusas, faldas, jeans, pantalones y ropa para niños. Ella vende en su casa y también de forma ambulante.

Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el mercado de  San Pedro Sula, donde incrementaría sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is 42 years old. She has been married since the age of 16. She has 3 kids that are 10, 12 and 15 years old who are in school. She lives in a neighborhood called San Manuel Cortes. Her husband works in maintenance for a private company  

Ana Julia is a very hard working woman. She has been selling clothing such as shirts, blouses, jeans and pants for 15 years. Before that she worked for a private company but decided to dedicate herself to selling clothing because she receives a better income. 

She began her business with her own capital. She has received two loans from ODEF to increase her business inventory. With this loan she will obtain more clothing such as blouses, skirts, jeans, pants and clothing for children. She sells from her home and also door to door. 

Her dream is to open a store in the market of San Pedro Sula where she could increase her sales.

loans.use: Buy new clothes for her store such as blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, jeans, and clothing for children.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married to a farmer and has five children. She sells pepper at Eyinase. She has been selling pepper for the past six years now. 

Ama uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more pepper for sale. 

With the new profit, Ama will buy pepper in sacks for resale.

loans.use: to buy more pepper for resale.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is from Calabayan, Ozamis City.  She is a 28 years old widow and has four children. 

To make a living, Jonalyn runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in her local community.  Jonalyn has been in business for 3 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

Jonalyn is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, to purchase new items to expand product offering.  

In 2007, Jonalyn joined GDMPC to access financial services to improve her business and living situation.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve fund for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella, se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en el Distrito de San Juan Bautista, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años y todo este tiempo pudo aprender cosas que le ayudaron en su vida personal como en su negocio, gracias a Finca pudo educar a sus hijos y criarlos de una buena manera, la responsabilidad y la puntualidad son valores que aprendió por la capacitaciones que le brindaron, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de frutas y verduras para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a member of the Estrella communal bank. She makes a living selling vegetables and fruits in the District of San Juan Bautista. She has been a member of Finca Perú for five years, and during this time she has learned things that have helped her both in her personal life and in her business. 
Thanks to Finca she could educate her children and raise them well. She learned the value of responsibility and punctuality through the training they offered. 

She will put this loan towards the purchase of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Te Agradesco Señor Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo que está formado por tres socias una de ellas es Yesenia que tiene una pulpería desde hace 10 años en su domicilio, tiene 22 años y es una mujer soltera, el crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de inventario de pulpería como granos básicos arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceites, productos lácteos, carne de res, carne de pollo, etc. Rosa vende pan y repostería ambulante y María de Jesús mercadería en general.
texts.en: This communal bank is made up of three members, one of whom is Yesenia.  She has had a small grocery in her home for 10 years.  She is 22 years old and single.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of inventory for her grocery, like basic grains, such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oils, dairy products, beef, chicken etc.  Among the other two members, Rosa sells bread and pastries as a street vendor and María de Jesús sells general merchandise.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of grains, like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, beef, chicken and dairy products.

loans.name: Thủy

texts.en:
Thủy is 25 years old and is married with 2 children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, and she has been involved in this business for 4 years.

The main hardship that Thủy faces in her life is not having a latrine, so her family has to share a neighbor's latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

This is Thủy's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women 

With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her business to do well and to be able to maintain it, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Mitoumide Group

texts.fr: MITOUMIDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Marguerite n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Marguerite  est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Théophile. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marguerite et son mari. Pour cette raison, Marguerite vend des boules d'akassa(pâte de maïs fermenté) et des bouteilles vides de façon ambulante depuis une vingtaine d'années, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marguerite sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MITOUMIDE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs et des bouteilles vides.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 70 years old. He is married and blessed with 4 children. 

He has had a dairy business for 25 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to purchase another dairy cow for milk production surplus.

With the anticipated profits, he will be able to harvest maize. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to supply more milk to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow for milk production surplus

loans.name: María

texts.en:
For 15 years Maria had made ends meet with her job as a seamstress but about 8 months ago she decided to venture into a new line of business. Maria saw a great opportunity in her community to open a phone center, where the locals could go to her phone booths and make calls. This is a particularly good business in these sectors of Guayaquil because people cannot afford to install phone lines in their homes. Therefore, these phone call centers are very popular throughout Guayaquil, especially because they also offer the ability to make international calls to family members who are overseas which can be very expensive, even for those who do have phone lines.

Maria’s husband has been extremely supportive in this new venture. They slowly accumulated their savings in order to buy the substantial start up investments necessary to launch this business. Maria now wants to put in two computers that have internet connections. Before she can do this she has to add a gate to her entrance and put in an alarm system in order to deter criminals from robbing her.

Maria has four children, one of which works at the business at night. Their family ties are very strong and they all do their part to help the business. Maria’s goals include continuing to improve her house which she always tries to keep up.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in security for her phone call center and possibly put in a computer with internet access

loans.name: Kossi

texts.en:
Born in 1962, Kossi M. is married to a woman who is a farmer like he is. His wife only draws a meager income from her work. In his household are three people, including two children, all of whom are his responsibility. Educated through secondary school, he farms as his principal business activity, something he had formal training in. And it has done the trick for him financially. But the soil is poor, and it must be fertilized and otherwise treated. This requires money he does not have. And so he is requesting a loan of $950 to stock fertilizer for a successful harvest. The income will allow him to take better care of his children's health, nourishment, and schooling.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Né en 1962, Monsieur M. Kossi est un homme marié. Cultivatrice comme lui, sa femme n’a que le maigre revenu de son travail. Il est instruit de niveau secondaire. Monsieur M. compte à sa charge trois (3) personnes dont deux (2) enfants. Faisant de l’agriculture son activité principale, il a fait une formation en agriculture qui lui permet de tirer son épingle du jeu mais les sols étant pauvres, il est nécessaire de les fertiliser par des engrais et autres intrants. Ceci demande des moyens dont il ne dispose pas.. Il sollicite alors un crédit de $950 pour s’approvisionner en intrants afin d’enrichir le sol pour une bonne réussite des cultures. Les revenus de cette activité permettront à Monsieur M. de prendre mieux en charge ses enfants en matière de santé, de nourriture, de scolarité.

loans.use: To stock soil amendments for growing crops

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: This young man was born in 1982 in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. He is single. He has run this business for three years. He has a plot of land where he grows grapes. Elshan works very hard to get a rich harvest. He needs a loan of $1000 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en:
Eliana A. is the proud owner of Venta de Comestico, a general store in La Union, a quaint community in the northern province of Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic. Although she is without a physical storefront, Eliana provides an additional service to her customers by faithfully delivering her customer’s orders to their homes. She will use this first loan to expand her inventory of cosmetic and hygienic supplies to better meet the needs of her community. Originally from Haiti, the 38-year-old Eliana enjoys spending time with her husband, Ambrody, when she is not tending to her business.

Note: Eliana A. is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $725 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To purchase hair coloring, cosmetic, and hygienic supplies.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Mrs. Vero U. is 57 years old and is happily married with 8 children. She hails from an urban sector of Benin City, Nigeria. Vero has been with LAPO for 7 years as a union leader. She has been running her business for 10 years and she needs a loan of US$ 800 to buy more drinks and food ingredients to enable her to prepare more food for sale in her little restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to cook for her little restaurant

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a 61-year-old father of four, is a retired civil servant. He has been running a grocery store and restaurant from his home for the past seven years. He also received training in business and entrepreneurship skills from the Youth Self Employment Foundation.

William requests a loan of $550 to purchase supplies to expand his grocery store and restaurant.

loans.use: Expand store and restaurant

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac B. is a carpenter who manufactures all kinds of furniture. He is married with five children. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, and soaps. He works very hard to support his wife since her income is low. He also makes coffins and supplies organizations with all kinds of furniture.

Isaac is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group.” The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – on the Accra Highway.

One challenge that Isaac faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them, but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers, and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from financial organizations. As a result, Isaac needs a loan of US $1,100 to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools, and the material used to manufacture furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: To purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, polish, tools, and the material used to manufacture furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness, age 22, lives with her husband. She has a business of selling clothes which she started in 2005. She works daily from 8am to 4pm and makes a monthly profit of about $165. Happiness is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.en:
Miguelina is forty years old. She and her husband have five children, four of them boys, that range from ten to twenty years old.  Miguelina owns and operates a tailoring shop in the community of Altagracia in Santo Domingo.  She learned to sew at the age of twelve.  The entrepreneur has three different sewing machines that she works with.  Miguelina explains that she mostly prepares party and wedding dresses.   Sometimes she offers her services to school-going children.
Miguelina is requesting a loan to by a lot of material such as cloth, sewing thread, and zippers in other to keep preparing dresses for her customers.  Miguelina’s business supports her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to satisfy the needs of her numerous customers

location.town: Altagracia VI Community, Santo Domingo N

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es:
Elsa, 32, lives in Managua's Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She's married and her husband earns a modest wage working for the Nicaraguan army. They have two young children, a one-year old and a three-year old. With their senior years in mind, they've set up a business, started by Elsa, selling light meals: fried pork, hamburgers and cold drinks. She's managed to operate the business for 8 years now. With the income from the business, Elsa has been able to improve her house little by little. It's walls aren't made of concrete, though, and the makeshift electricals are old. This loan will help her make additional improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa Núñez de 32 años de edad habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el ejercito en el cual gana un modesto salario con el cual asume los gastos del hogar. Tienen dos hijos pequeños uno de 1 año y el otro de 3 años de edad. Juntos lograron poner un negocio pensando en su vejez el cual inicio doña Elsa N. vendiendo carne de cerdo frito con toritilla, hamburguesas y Refrescos. Logró montar un pequeño negocio de venta de comida casera desde hace ya 8 años. De este negocio ha podido doña Elsa mejorar su vivienda de poco a poco, sus paredes no son de concretos y el sistema eléctrico es improvisado y viejo, este prestamos le ayudara a mejorar su hogar.

loans.use: Build cement walls, install new electricals and new floors.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 38 years old. He has three children. They are studying in school. His elderly father lives with his family and he is very sick. The entrepreneur has an old taxi and he applied to get $1200 to replace the old taxi with a new one to increase his income. He wants to save for a better life for his family and to take care of his elderly father .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Replace the old taxi with new one

loans.name: Mwanamrisho's Tujipemoyo Group

texts.en:
Mwanamrisho, age 47, is married with four children (ages 7, 12, 15, and 20). She runs a charcoal business, where she sells charcoal from 8am to 9pm daily. From this business, which started 5 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $45.

Mwanamrisho hopes for a loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members belong to group Tujipemoyo. These members guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita is 48 years old and has been married to Ramón for 26 years. They have six children between the ages of 15 and 28, three of whom still live with them, while the other three are married and have their own families.

Margarita operates a small store out of their home. As well as running the store, she also sells lottery tickets during the morning hours while one of her children looks after the store.

She explains that with a great deal of sacrifice she has managed to educate all her children. Because her husband is only a bricklayer, she doesn’t have a steady income.

Her biggest wish is to sell merchandise wholesale (items such as sugar, flour, rice etc) which can be obtained at a lower cost from wholesale businesses in the capital.

She needs a loan so that she can buy these items and in this way stock her store with a wider range of goods.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita tiene 48 años, está casada hace 26 años con Ramón y tienen 6 hijos de entre 28 y 15 años de edad. Tres de los mismos aún viven con ellos mientras que otros tres ya se han casado y formado su propia familia.

Margarita posee una pequeña despensa que funciona en su domicilio. Ella comenta que a la par de dicha actividad también se dedica a la venta de juegos de azar que vende en horas de la mañana mientras uno de sus hijos queda al cuidado de su negocio.

Cuenta que con bastante sacrificio logró educar a todos sus hijos debido a que su esposo se dedica únicamente a la albañilería, y no cuenta con ingresos constantes.

Su mayor anhelo es dedicarse a la venta al por mayor de mercaderías tales como:azúcar, harina, arroz, etc. y que se consiguen a menor costo en negocios mayoristas de la capital.

En esta oportunidad necesita de un crédito para la compra de mercaderías para surtir mejor su negocio.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bread, noodles, rice, flour etc.

loans.name: Emefa Emilie

texts.fr:
Born in Kpalimé on December 31, 1982, Mrs. Emefa Emilie A. is unmarried and the mother of one child. Settled in Lomé for some time now, she had the idea of buying charcoal in her native village to sell to retailers in the city of Lomé. This lucrative idea has brought her success and she has seen her clientele grow, which has led her to ask for a loan to expand her stock.

This first loan will allow her to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Kpalimé le 31 décembre 1982, madame A. Emefa Emilie, est célibataire et mère d’un enfant. Installé à Lomé depuis un temps déjà, elle a eu l’idée d’acheter du charbon de bois dans son village d’origine pour le vendre aux détaillants dans la ville de Lomé. Cette idée lucrative lui a été porteuse car aujourd’hui sa clientèle a augmenté ce qui la poussé à prendre du crédit pour augmenter son stock.

Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter 30 sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 sacks of charcoal

Achat de 30 sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Eliza's Group

texts.en:
Eliza has owned a salon and sold decorative crafts in Arusha since 2003. She is 40 years old, single, and has no children. She works daily from 8:00am to 9:00pm and generates a monthly profit of approximately $200.

Eliza has taken out two previous loans from BRAC Tanzania. She paid them both back successfully and on time. She hopes to use this current loan to buy more items for her decorative crafts business and to open a new business. She will share this loan with her two group members, Joyce and Lilian, who own clothing and food shops, respectively.

loans.use: To open a new business.

loans.name: Arif

texts.id: Arif M. menggeluti usaha sebagai pembuat dan penjual krupuk. Krupuk adalah makanan khas Indonesia terbuat dari tepung yang digoreng dan mengembang, dan biasanya dimakan bersama nasi. Setiap hari dia berkeliling menjual krupuk, dari satu warung ke warung lain, terutama ke pelanggan tetapnya. Krupuk merupakan makanan ringan yang paling laris karena harganya murah. Disamping itu, rasanya yang juga gurih membuat orang sangat senang memakannya bersama nasi. Bahan dasar pembuat krupuk sebenarnya hanyalah tepuk yang sudah dijadikan adonan, lalu dibentuk menjadi bulatan tipis lalu kemudian dijemur sampai kering. Setelah kering, krupuk digoreng menggunakan minyak panas sampai mengembang. Setelah selesai digoreng krupuk siap untuk dijual. Dengan harga yang sangat murah yaitu Rp.100 per buah, krupuk menjadi sangat familiar dengan masyarakat. Dari anak kecil sampai dewasa mengkonsumsi krupuk. Arif merasa usaha ini sangat menjanjikan. Oleh karena itu Arif berkeinginan memohon pinjaman dana untuk mengembangkan usahanya supaya lebih berkembang.
texts.en:
Arif M. makes and sells krupuk. Krupuk is Indonesian traditional cracker made of dough that is deep fried to fluff, usually eaten as side dishes with rice. Every day he travels from one kiosk to another selling his krupuks, usually to his regular clients. People likes krupuk due to its crispy texture, savory taste and cheap price. Arif makes krupuk by mixing flour to make the dough, then sun dried. After drying, krupuk is deep fried to make the dough fluff. After frying, the krupuks are then ready to be sold. Due to its very cheap price (Rp. 100 or US$ 1 cent per piece), krupuk is very popular. People of every age, from little kids to adults eats krupuks. Arif feels that this business can be promising. Seeing this potential, Arif is seeking loans to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en:
Azamjon A. is a self-sacrificing, loving father, who is 56 years old with four children, all of whom are independent. In spite of his age, he continues to fight to get his beloved family ahead and improve their economic situation. Ever since he was very young, Azamjon has been around people who have raised animals; and, thanks to this knowledge, he dedicates himself to raising and selling cattle, work that he learned from his humble parents. With experience gained over time in the business of purchasing and selling cattle, he has been able to bring stability to his family.

The desire that Azamjon harbors in his heart is to increase his capital in order to invest in acquiring more animals. In turn, by selling these animals, he can generate more income for his family. Above all, he hopes to offer a better quality of life for his beloved grandchildren, who always supports him unconditionally in his daily work. Accordingly, he requests $1,000 for the term of 6 months. Please get behind the request of this devoted father to help him keep bringing much-needed stability and security to the members of his family.

loans.use: To increase and expand his business by purchasing additional cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Suo Chan Thea's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group of Chamka Tamao Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of fifteen people. Each plans to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. S. C. T. is a housewife who cooks a delicious food for her household. She is a 45-year-old widow with three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is employed in a small position in a hotel. Since her children's workplace is too far from house, they spend a lot of money on transportation. Thus, Mrs. S. C. is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work. Mrs. Sok T.'s husband is presented in the picture.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
Ramatu F. is a 40-year-old divorced mother of two kids, both of whom are in school. She lives with her kids in Ashaiman, a suburb of Tema in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. Ramatu loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. More specifically, for the past 8 years, she has been trading goods such as maize, groundnuts, and millet in the Ashaiman market. Notably, she treks to Yendi (in the northern part of Ghana) to purchase her goods in bulk from farmers, and she then resells such goods to her customers. 

Unfortunately, she does not have an adequate amount of working capital to purchase enough goods to generate sufficient profits to support her family. As such, she is seeking a loan to purchase additional goods (e.g., maize, groundnuts, millet, and sweet potatoes) in bulk and to thereby increase her sales. In fact, she believes the loan would enable her to save enough money to support her kids in school. 

Ramatu is a member of the group known as the God is Good Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other's loans as social collateral (i.e., if one member does not promptly repay her portion of the loan, then the other members are responsible for curing the arrears), and they provide support for one another to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To increase her sales by purchasing additional goods in bulk (e.g., maize and sweet potatoes)

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
The Municipality of Naguillan in Isabela is known for its delicious native rice cakes. That is why Lilibeth is very proud of selling her homemade native rice cakes to her fellow villagers.

She is married to John, who paints buildings and houses. They only have one daughter, named Joanna, who is 2 years old now. She hopes that somehow she can save for her child's education.

Lilibeth is requesting a loan for $100 (4000 PHP) as additional working capital for her business. She plans to purchase native rice, brown sugar, coconuts, raisins, cheese, and other ingredients for her homemade cakes. She also accepts made-to-order special rice cakes for different occasions. Sometimes, because she lacks the funds, she is not able to buy the ingredients to prepare her cakes, so some of her customers go to other rice cake makers in the village. Lilibeth would be thankful for the chance to get the loan so that she can meet the orders of her customers and earn more income for her family.

Lilibeth and her husband are working hand-in-hand for the future of their daughter. They want to give her good education, which will be her stepping stone towards a better life. Lilibeth and John would also like to pursue their rice cake business so they will be known in their village and nearby municipalities as producers of good quality and delicious products.

loans.use: Buy the ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Soledad M. y su esposa el señor Alejandro González le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las ventanas y puertas, ya que tiene poco tiempo que adquirieron su casa de las económicas. Ellos tienen una hija de edad escolar  por lo cual quieren lo mejor y su seguridad cundo este en su casa.
 El que se encarga de los ingresos de la familia es el señor Alejandro González que trabaja en un centro comercial como encargado del aria de carnicería.
texts.en:
Soledad M. and his husband Alejandro González’s needs door and window locks, as they recently bought their humble home. They have a daughter that is still in school, and they want to provide her with a safer home. Alejandro González is the head of the family and the only financial support. He works at a mall, in charge of the woodwork area.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Place window and door locks

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is twenty five years old, is not married but has one child, a little girl. She lives with her daughter's father in a rented apartment in Koforidua, a small farming town not very far from Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Abena says she works to save money and so that she can acquire her basic needs and get prepared for marriage. For the past 6 years, she has been trading in cosmetics such as creams, pomades, body lotion, and many other products. She procures her goods from big cosmetic shops in the big cities at wholesale prices. Abena sells door to door and through the local market. It is Abena’s dream to save enough money to expand her business by acquiring a store. She would like a loan to procure items in bulk so that she can maximize her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure pomades and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Mrs. Sarom C., a villager in Press Theat village in Kandal province, owns a grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to increase income by purchasing more grocery goods to sell. She is 48 years old and the mother of three children: two are employed in a garment factory and one attends the local school.

loans.use: Increasing income by buying more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
C., 46, is a widowed mother of three children.  The children attend school.  The family lives in Pursat Province. 

C. makes a daily income by selling fish at the local market. As another income source, she raises pigs at her house.  The pigs mature in four months at which point she sells them to be slaughtered. C.'s investment in raising pigs is running smoothly and provides her with a lot of income.  She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy another piglet to raise.

loans.use: to buy another piglet to raise

loans.name: Nuhwuin

texts.en:
As a new member of GHAPE, R. is taking out her first loan of 40,000 CFA to pay for labor on her farm, which produces cassava, a popular vegetable in Cameroon. R. is married and a mother of two children, as well as a grandmother of two children under the age of fifteen.  She is helping the community by hiring workers to clear the farmland and by selling her produce in large quantities. 

R. and her family have faced the problem of sickness and poverty, but with the profits she will earn from her business, she will be able to pay for her children's school fees. Because of the gradual repayment plan, R. appreciates the policies of GHAPE and Kiva. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account, and most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: The clearing and tilling of farmland

loans.name: 40 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hường T. Thị (277) is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Phường, Thanh Hoa province, Viet Nam. Hường is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 40 Nam Ngạn (17.02.40).

Hường is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Hường owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fried foods in the local community. Hường has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Hường is requesting, for the first time, a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan of 1.626.900 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by this borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:
