1.  N. Thị H. Nguyên (272) is a 33 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  B. Thị H. Tươi (275) is a 23 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

3.  Ngô Thị Hương (276) is a 26 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  Lê Thị Thanh (278) is a 47 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  Ngô Thị Tự (279) is a 55 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

6.  Đỗ Thị Phương (280) is a 44 year-old woman who is requesting a 1626900 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Hường Phạm Thị (627981317) is a 56-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng nguyên. She is married and does not have any chlidren. To making a living, Hường owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Hường has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $117) a month from these activities.

In 1998, Hường joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hường has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000,000 dong from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Hường is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 dong which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 12th she has taken out from TYM Fund. Hường plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy breeding livestock

loans.name: Nakakeeto Lucy ‘S Group

texts.en:
Lucy is the leader of four other members of a group.  She is 35 and married with three children between 10 and 14 years of age. All her children go to school. She resides in, and rents, a two-room house where she is staying with five people. Lucy doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Lucy deals in spare parts in Kisekka Market, one of the markets in Kampala city. She sells to an average of four people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She uses public transport to and from work.  Her major monthly expenses include medication for the family, rent, school fees and feeding the family, She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her. Lucy has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to buy more spare parts. She aspires to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent home which will act as her business premises.
.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita O. sells provisions and drinks. She is married with a child and she is 26 years old. She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Wilhelmina

texts.en:
From only two piglets, Wilhelmina now has six hogs in her animal shelter. Through her hard work and patience she is able to surpass all the trials with regard to her business. At the age of 54, she sometimes has had difficulty in cleaning the pigpen because of the bad odor of hog manure. However, knowing that through the business of hog-raising, she can be able to send her children to school, she instantly disregards the smell. 

Wanting to sustain and maintain her hog-raising business, Wilhelmina wants to avail a loan of PHP12,000 from Kiva lenders to use as capital for purchasing feed for her animals. She is optimistic that her request will be granted. Wilhelmina also dreams to buy more piglets.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Oghomwen

texts.en: Oghomwen is 42 years old and she is married with five children. She sells grocery store items. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more items to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items to sell

loans.name: Ma. Theressa

texts.en: Ma. Theressa R. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Ma. Theressa works in someone else's business venture in the retail sector selling cosmetic products to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Ma. Theressa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy toys wholesale

loans.name: Morifat

texts.en:
Morifat sells crates of drinks, wholesale and retail, to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

Morifat is 42 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Mrs. Yen S. is a farmer in Cheav Phdey Kang Keit village in Takeo province. In her farming, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Sovann Prum, helps on the farming. Mrs. Yen S. is 55 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers for her purpose and she would use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and hire laborers to work on the field.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer emprendedora que a sus 33 años ha trabajado con valentía para su familia. Ella vive con su esposo (Iván), de 47 años, y con sus dos hijos: Miguel de 19 e Iván de 7 años. Iván es obrero de construcción.
Un buen día al ver que los amigos de su esposo buscaban un lugar donde beber algunas cervezas, Hilda pensó en vender ella misma esta bebida, ya que vio que era muy rentable. 

Para lograr esto habilitó la sala de su casa comprando algunas sillas y mesas para ofrecer mayor comodidad, es así que desde hace 4 años vende cerveza y así obtiene buenas ganancias, sobre todo los fines de semana que es donde hay mayor demanda, ya que la gente descansar y a sale a divertirse. 

Su hijo menor la ayuda en este negocio, ya que el mayor trabaja; pero lo que no le gusta es trasnochar y no dormir bien los fines de semana, pero sabe que las ganancias económicas son muy buenas y que si quiere progresar debe realizar algunos sacrificios. Ella espera muy pronto cumplir todas sus metas, entre ellas, la de tener una bodega.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta del trabajo en su banco comunal es la responsabilidad de cada uno de sus miembros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sus propias cajas de cerveza, ya que las que tiene en la actualidad son prestadas y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias económicas.
texts.en:
Hilda is a businesswoman, whom in her 33 years has worked with valiance for her family. She lives with her husband, Iván, 47 years old, and her two children, Miguel, 19, and Iván, 7. Iván is a construction worker.

One fine day, seeing that her husband’s friends were looking for a place to drink some beers, Hilda thought she would sell them this drink herself since she had heard that it was very profitable.

To achieve this, she furnished a room of her house, purchasing chairs and tables to offer more comfort. Here, she has sold beer for 4 years and has obtained good profits, especially on the weekends when there is the highest demand, since the people relax and go out to have fun.

Her younger son helps her with this business, since the older one works. But what she doesn’t like is to stay up late and not sleep well on the weekends. However, she knows that the economic earnings are very good, and that if she wants to move forward, she must make some sacrifices. She hopes that soon she will achieve her goals, including owning a shop.

This is her second loan with MFP, and what she likes about working in her communal bank is the responsibility of each member. With the money that she requests, she will buy her own cases for beer, since the ones that she has now are borrowed, and in this way she can make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Méminétou

texts.fr: Cette femme n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle s’est lancée en 2003 dans la vente d’une bouillie préparée à base de mil, très appréciée de la population. Elle exerce ce commerce dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle vend les matins et les après-midis. Les soirs surtout, elle dispose tellement de clients que la plupart ne disposent pas de place pour s’assoir. Elle voudrait avoir un crédit de WAGES pour pouvoir renouveler son stock de matières ; ce prêt lui permettra donc d’acheter 05 sacs de mil, 04 sacs de sucre, du bois de chauffage et d’autres éléments indispensables.
texts.en:
This woman is not married and has no children to support. To support herself, she embarked on selling millet porridge in 2003. People appreciate millet porridge a lot. She operates this business in the Agoè district in Lomé. She sells in the mornings and afternoons. In the evenings in particular, she has so many customers that most of them lack a place to sit. She would like to obtain a WAGES loan to be able to renew her stock of ingredients. This loan will enable her to buy five sacks of millet, four sacks of sugar, some firewood, and other indispensable items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet, sugar, firewood, and various products

loans.name: Sat's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sat U. is a group leader of four people who lives in Pou Preah Sang village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sat U. is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. KU. Huyny, is a farmer who owns 0.9 hectares to cultivate rice. This couple does not have any children yet.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Besilia

texts.es:
La señora Besilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 23 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Besilia, es una mujer trabajadora y por su espíritu optimista que siempre le ha caracterizado, por lo que hoy en día lleva 06 años, dedicándose al servicio de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su pareja se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Poco a poco, fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Besilia, se siente muy bien al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Señora Besilia is a member of the communal bank "10 de Agosto II," located in the Tarapoto district of San Martin province in the San Martin region. She is 23 years old, lives with a partner and is the mother of 2 children, both of whom are dependent on her as they are in school. Besilia is a hardworking woman who has always been characterized by an optimistic spirit. For 6 years she has had an urban passenger transport business using her motocar (light, 3-wheeled passenger vehicle). Her partner does the driving, taking the motocar to different places in the city. Little by little, she was saving and with this money she was buying spare parts in order to improve the service to the residents of the city. With this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy spare parts and oils such as: lubricants, wheel hubs and spark plugs, so that she can provide better service and meet the needs of her customers. Besilia feels great about belonging to a group of women who have helped her to better understand her rights, and who together have managed to become better respected. She is also very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement organization for helping her to start out in business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy spare parts for her motocar

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba is twenty–nine years old. She is divorced and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Takoradi. Takoradi is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people in the region. Abiba is a trader. She trades in textile materials. She does her selling through "hawking" (door-to-door selling)and also treks to nearby communities to sell on market days. She wants a loan to buy textile materials in bulk. Abiba has been in business for three years and she believes your support would enable her to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy textile materials.

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Jambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!
Meet Bakari M., a 34-year-old newspaper salesman and stationery shop owner. He is married and has two daughters, ages six and three. He also cares for his two younger sisters, who are 15 and 20, and their mother, who stays with them.
Bakari has been running his business since 2006. The shop is open from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. daily. He makes about 20,000 Tanzanian shillings a day, which is about US$15, giving him a monthly profit of about US$450. He plans to use this loan to buy school books for children, which are commonly sold in stationery shops like his along with notebooks, greeting cards, paper, pens, and sometimes even candies.
This is Bakari's first loan from a microfinance institution! He is grateful for your support. In the photo, Bakari is the first on the left, wearing a red shirt. He is pictured with the other members of his loan group, which named itself Khanga. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. This loan is what Tujijenge calls a "Motisha Loan." It is for borrowers who have excellent repayment histories and wish to take out a larger loan than the original amount before their first loan term has ended. Thank you for supporting these successful microfinance clients!

loans.use: To buy school books and stationery items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Manuel Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 69 años de edad, es separado, tiene dos hijas mayores de edad que ya son independientes y vive junto a su madre en la ciudad de Piura, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la venta y reparacion de relojes en el Mercado de la ciudad de Piura. Este negocio le ha ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia y ahora le permite hacerse cargo de su madre, que es de edad muy avanzada. El se esfuerza diariamente para seguir adelante y mantener a su progenitora.

Manuel se encuentra solicitando por segunda vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la ampliacion de su negocio con la compra de relojes de mano para esta temporada de verano.

Su más grande anhelo es seguir saliendo adelante con su negocio para brindarle a su madre una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado con nuentra Institución anteriormente y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Manuel is 69 years of age. He is separated and has two daughters of legal age that are already independent. He lives next to his mother in the city of Piura, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years he has been dedicated to the sale and repair of clocks in the Market of the city of Piura. This business has helped his family to get ahead and now permits him to take care of his mother, who is of a very advanced aged. He endeavors daily to continue ahead and to maintain his ancestor. Manuel is requesting his second loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles, which he plans to use to grow his business with watches purchased for this summer season. His greater desire is to continue doing well with his business in order to offer his mother a better quality of life. He has worked with our Institution previously and has shown himself to be a responsible and punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy watches to grow his business.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie P. is a 46-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Mahilum, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by making native handicrafts such as bags, wallets, baskets, etc. from pandan and by fishing.

Vergie’s husband Jose, who is 47 years old, is a fisherman and sometimes helps her run the business. They have 2 children who are 16 and 18 years old. The older one helps her parents in business and the younger one is currently going to school.

Vergie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by making native products made from pandan leaves and from fishing. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 8,000 from her business activities.

Vergie is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 9,500 was used to fund operations of her native products and fishing, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 12th loan, the amount of Php 10,500, which she intends to use to sustain the operations of her handicrafts production and also help fund the fishing operations of her husband.  Vergie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu B.  is currently in the business of selling groundnut-paste, bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to increase her stock of groundnuts for paste. She is a 38-year-old widow with four school-age children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock groundnuts to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Fanny Maritza

texts.es:
la señora Fanny Maritza F. M. tiene 25 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Agustin Montalvan y tienen una niña pequeña a quien quieren mucho,  son una pareja muy trabajadora y con buenos principios morales.
la señora F. tiene una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, tiene 5 años de tener su negocio, desde un inicio fue una bonita pulperia bien ordenada y poco a poco a ido creciendo, la sra. F. esta solicitando un prestamo para surtir mas su negocio.
nos comento que esta muy feliz porque todo le esta saliendo bien y que espera que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Fanny is 25 years old. She is married to Agustin and they have a baby daughter whom they love very much. They are a very hard working couple with good moral principles. Fanny runs a grocery shop from her home. She has been running this business for five years. It’s been a nice and well organized shop since the start and she has been growing it little by little. Fanny is requesting this loan in order to offer a greater variety to her business. She tells us that she is very happy because everything is turning out well for her and she expects that her business will continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Basharaf Group

texts.en:
M. M., son of M. K., 35 years old, is the group leader of 'Basharaf' Group. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he sells credit cards for mobile phones. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak in running the business, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and still he is furthering his business, attracting good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time. 

M. M. is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Serves Joint Stock Company) and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to expand their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: expanding his mobile phone credit business

loans.name: Ema Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Emma Elizabeth actualmente es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno tiene 26 años de edad y el otro tiene 12 años de edad y habita con ella. La señora posee un negocio de cafetín, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación, normalmente ofrece refrescos, gaseosas, y también ofrece golosinas, últimamente también ha estado invirtiéndole un poco al negocio de comida el cual distribuye allí mismo. La señora ya tiene 40 años de tener este negocio, el cual empezó con dulces, tortillitas. Con el tiempo fue invirtiéndole poco a poco hasta llegar a tener el negocio que posee ahora, más surtido y con mayor clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de productos varios, y ser distribuidos desde su cafetín. Su sueño más anhelado ha sido siempre establecer una pulpería grande en su casa de habitación, y de esta manera estabilizar un poco más los ingresos de la familia, ya que su esposo no trabaja por ser jubilado, sin embargo es muy poco lo que le dan para sobrevivir.
texts.en:
Emma Elizabeth is married and has two children, one of whom is 26 years old and the other, who is 12, and lives with her She has a café in her home. She usually offers soft-drinks, beverages, sweets. Lately, however, she has also been offering prepared meals that she sells there as well. She has been in this line of work for 40 years; she started out with just candy and tortillas. In time, she gradually invested more until she had the business she now does: better stocked and with a larger customer base. She will use the funds to stock her café. Her greatest wish is to establish a large grocery store in her home so that she can stabilize her income a bit more because her husband, who is retired, no longer works and what he earns is not enough to survive on.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her cafe.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn A. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 24 years old. Jovelyn is single. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling 'banana cue' (fried banana on a stick) in the local community. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cloth, wool and raw materials

loans.name: Carolino

texts.en:
Mr. Carolino R. is from the barangay of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years-old. Carolino is married to Dulcineta, his business partner and  they are blessed with two children who are both studying in college. To make a living, they sell chemicals wholesale and retail and most specifically “hypo” (calcium hypochlorite) and chlorine to be used for cleaning, disinfecting and for anti-stain. They’ve had this business for ten years  and earn approximately 2,600 PHP a month from this buy and sell activity. 

 In 2009, Carolino joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolino is now requesting a second loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of hypo for their business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family especially in meeting their basic needs and savings for future use especially for the children’s education and loan repayments.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional chemicals.

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun P. and her husband, Mr. Phally Sok (pictured together), live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh They were married in 1999 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school and another is pre-school age.

Sophoeun has been a silk weaver since she was twelve years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takesthem to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a farmer and has raised cows since 2000. 

She is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Let God Be Group

texts.en:
Tenneh K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Let God Be. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children who range from 10 to 20 years old.

She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support.

For four years, she has been selling oil, rice, onions, and pepper in Saye Town community in Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 20,000-Liberian-dollar portion of this 74,000-Liberian-dollar group loan to buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, and more pepper. She describes herself as humble and easygoing.

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Fatumata is inset at the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, gallons of oil, and more pepper

loans.name: Catarino

texts.en: Catarino G. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 45 years old. Catarino is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Catarino provides transportation services. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle-transport service. Catarino has been engaged in his business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. Catarino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catarino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Catarino is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the third loan taken out by Catarino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel J. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 67 years old and is widowed. Rachel owns and operates a specialized retail store, making and selling pillowcases in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Rachel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Rachel is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional materials needed and used as working capital. This loan will be her 6th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials needed and to use as working capital

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en: Bassam is a 26 year old single man from Lebanon, owner of a grocery store since 2009. Bassam is requesting a Loan from Al Majmoua for the first time in order to buy products that are not currently carried in his shop. He also wants to buy a backup  generator because he has to keep his fridges running 24/7 to keep his products fresh. Bassam helps contribute to his family's income. He hopes to open a big market in the future. He believes he can be successful since he is active and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy products not currently carried in his shop

loans.name: Lydia Cabrera's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Lydia C., 62 years of age, is married and is a resident of Gango, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is the group leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Lydia C.’s Group. Lydia is blessed with four children of whom three are already married while the other one is an adult but still single. To earn her living, Lydia decided to engage in doormats and used clothes (locally known as “okay-okay”). She is also doing some agricultural activities with kangkong as her product (also known as water spinach or morning glory). She also receives support from her husband, Florentino, who is a laborer. For 21 years already, selling doormats and okay-okay, Lydia has been able to maintain these business activities. Now, the couple is earning an average net income of not less than Php 3,000 a month which is so helpful to their family. In 2007, upon hearing the good news about Paglaum MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in northern Mindanao (awarded for being the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award in 2006) Lydia joined the cooperative. As an active member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) program of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, Lydia has successfully repaid a loan of Php 3,000. Lydia is now requesting a loan of Php 5,000 as her 7th loan, to be used as additional capital for her doormats and okay-okay business. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, for loan repayments to PMPC, savings, insurances, her grandchildren’s education and for possible business expansions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her doormats and okay-okay business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of ladies hand bags to sell.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El  Sr. A. es originario del municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón comarca cofradía en cuanto a los cuatro crédito anteriores han sido para compra de terneros pero este nuevo financiamiento lo  utilizado para mejoramiento de su finca como es construcción de galera para proteger los  terneros de ordeño del invierno, y evitar perdida en su hato
texts.en: Mr. A. is from the Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality. As far as his four previous loans, he has used them to purchase land.  He would use this new loan to make improvements to his farm, such as building a galley for his milking cows to protect them from winter.  He would like to prevent any losses in his herd.

loans.use: To make improvements to his farm.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
The smiling woman shown in the picture above, Mrs. Ek N., is a 38-year-old construction worker in the rural area of Kompong Tom Province. She married years ago, but she divorced her husband. Mrs. Ek N. has three children, two of whom are attending school while one is employed as a garment worker in a private factory and has a formal salary to generate income together with Mrs. Ek N.. 

Mrs. Ek N. typically makes around US$ 2.50 in income each day to cover her family's daily expenses. Presently, she said that her rice stock is depleted, and it is not enough to cover her family’s needs. To solve the problem, Mrs. Ek N. is looking for a loan to buy some rice to stock for her family.

loans.use: To buy some rice to stock for her family

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

She has operated a potato selling business for over three years, selling from home and at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Monicah faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to build a selling stall, purchase iron sheets, timber and pay labor charges. Monicah decided to join Yehu to get loans and expand her business.

loans.use: To build a selling stall, purchase iron sheets, timber and pay labor charges.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes L. is from the village of Talairon. She is 69 years old. Gertrudes is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gertrudes owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Gertrudes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gertrudes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gertrudes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gertrudes is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Gertrudes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita R. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 45 years old. Carmelita is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling vegetables like carrots, eggplants and cabbages in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables to buy and sell. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Saimon

texts.en:
Saimon is a married man with one child who is still young for school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

He has been operating a video café business for the past three years.  Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. Saimon faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to open a well-furnished video café in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000, he wants to purchase timber and pay for labor charges to establish a video café. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber and pay for labor charges to build video café

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S., 29, is a housewife. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. The family has to spend USD 25 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. Yem S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase a trailer to attach to her husband’s motorbike to expand his business.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. was unavailable so her husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike.

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf Koné est un célibataire de 27 ans qui vit dans une grande  famille élargie chez son père  dans le quartier Koko de la ville de Kolondièba (Préfecture) (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
Monsieur Koné  est un enseignant de l’école communautaire qui fait également la distribution des cartes téléphoniques prépayées des sociétés de téléphonies du Mali.
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son premier  prêt. 
Elle compte acheter, des cartes de recharge orange à Bamako (la capitale de la République du Mali) et pour les revendre à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. Il ravitaille aussi plusieurs boutiquiers de la place à crédit payable hebdomadairement.
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  24. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf Koné is a single, 27-year-old man who lives in a large extended family at his father’s house in the Koko neighborhood of the Kolondièba prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Koné, a community school teacher, also sells prepaid mobile phone recharge cards from various telephone companies of Mali. 

To increase his working capital and meet customer demand, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and is now on n his first loan cycle. 

He plans to buy Orange recharge cards in Bamako (capital of Mali) for resale to a customer base of both men and women, for cash and occasionally on credit. He will also supply several local shopkeepers on credit, payable weekly.

He expects to make an average monthly profit of 24,000 FCFA to be reinvested in the company.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone recharge cards

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with six children; all of them graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over twelve years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Asha faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She hopes to expand and establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to get financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Luu

texts.en: Luu T. N. is 51 years old and has 2 children who attend high school . She is a very hardworking farmer. She is currently growing rice, beans and corn in a paddy of 3,600 square meters. Her agricultural  products are used to support her family's food demands and some is also sold  to earn daily income. Luu T. N. joined the Seda credit program  in 2007. She has used her loans very effectively and has always repaid them well. Luu T. N. wants to have a loan of 8,502,000 VND to buy seeds and fertilizer for her next crop.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita G. is from the village of Abu, Bayalao, Mambajao, in Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Teresita is widowed and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and beverages in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 36 years old.  She has a 9-year-old child.  Her husband owns a bar. Alphonsine sells fruits and vegetables to earn income.  She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Las Escogidas 4 Group

texts.en: Angeli is the coordinator of her group, Las Escogidas 4, and her story is representative of both her group and Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients in general. Her group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macorís, surrounded by sugar cane fields where there is no potable running water and electricity is unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. Angeli is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, almost three years after she started doing business and taking out loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, beauty items, shoes, clothing, etc. She will use her profits to start rebuilding her house as a safer structure. Her most difficult challenge is living in her community. She likes to work and her future plans include attending church. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Keu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Keu and her husband have three children: one is a staff worker in an NGO, one is a grocery seller, and the third is attending a local school. Keu is a group leader; she was selected as the leader by the other four members.

Keu and her husband sell beef in the market and are able in this way to earn a small income to support their family. Since this business is doing well, Keu wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more beef to enlarge her current business.

loans.use: To buy more beef to enlarge her current business

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, reside San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 21 y 23 años de edad, es agricultor, siembra maíz y frijol, desde hace 25 años, aprendió el oficio de su padre, trabaja todos los días en las actividades agrícolas.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta compra le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para realizar su labor agrícola.
Su objetivo es continuar trabajando, apoyar a su familia para sacarlos adelante, que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Florentín resides in San Rafael Oriente in the Department of San Miguel. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 21 and 23.

Florentín is a farmer who grows corn and beans. He has been working for 25 years and learned this trade from his father. Florentín works every day in his farming activities.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and fertilizers for cultivating corn and beans. This purchase will help him acquire everything he needs for his farm work. His goals are to continue working, help his family get ahead, and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a la venta de una variedad de productos de plástico los mismos que los comercializa en el interior del país. El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción como ser: arena, cemento, vigas, etc., ya que construirá una nueva habitación. Vive en casa de parientes  la misma esta ubicada en la zona de Alto Jinchupalla en la ciudad de La Paz; Julia  es separada y tiene cinco hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Impro y KIVA.
texts.en: Julia's business is selling a variety of plastic products.  She makes her sales in the provinces.  She needs this loan to buy construction supplies such as sand, cement, beams, etc. as she is going to build a new room.  Julia lives in her relatives' house which is located in Alto Jinchupalla district, in the city of La Paz.  Julia is separated and has five children.  This is the first time that she has worked with Impro and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, wood and bricks so that she can build a room and live more comfortably

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is 41 years old. She has been married for 10 years now and has four kids. She started sewing and tailoring clothes and curtains at home two years ago to support her husband and the family's financiA. situation. During these two years, Siham has managed to gain a good number of customers. Now, Siham has applied for a loan to buy another tailoring machine to help increase her productivity and enable her to serve her customers on time. 

Since Siham is a conservative person, her husband agreed to be in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Marlene es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” donde lo conforman 07 personas responsables y donde ella ejerce el cargo de secretaria. Marlene nos cuenta que llego a formar parte del grupo por intermedio de una conocida que le comento sobre él grupo. La señora Marlene es madre de 2 niños que depende de ella y de su conyugue, ella trabaja como enfermera técnica en un centro de salud, teniendo ya  11 años laborando en ese puesto, y que  también cuenta con un carrito sanguchero en la cual trabaja 3 veces a la semana en donde tiene un  ingresos más para su familia, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  Marlene  pudo comprarse un terreno y construirlo. El deseo de Marlene es de tener un negocio de comida en su casa donde pueda ofrecer sus variedades de platos. El crédito obtenido Marlene lo invertirá para los insumos de su negocio del carrito sanguchero como aceite, descartables, panes, embutidos, etc.  La Alcancía Comunal “Yahve Yire” tiene 4 meses  participando en el programa prosperidad y están agradecidos  y comprometidos.Gustavo no estuvo presente en la reunion porque viajo a sufragar a un pueblo del interior del Perú.
texts.en: Marlene is a member of “Yahve Yire” Community Bank, made up of seven responsible people and where she holds the office of Secretary. Marlene tells us that she became a member of the group through an acquaintance who commented on the group. Marlene is mother to two children who depend on her and her husband. She works as a technical nurse in a health center, having already eleven years experience working in this role, and she also has a hot dog cart where she works three times a week where she can earn more income for her family. Thanks to her work and effort, Marlene was able to buy some land and build. Marlene's wish is to have a food business in her house where she can offer a variety of dishes. The loan obtained by Marlene will be invested in the necessities for her hot dog cart business such as oil, disposables, bread, sausages, etc. The “Yahve Yire” Community Bank has been participating in this prosperity program for four months and they are thankful and dedicated. Gustavo was not present at the meeting because he traveled to cover a town in the interior of Peru.

loans.use: to buy oil, sausages, cans, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Las Samaritanas De Xequemeya Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Cecilia, es casada,  tiene 34 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y a la venta D. comida y bebidas, inició cuando contaba con un pequeño capital y hasta el momentos lleva 5 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. sus esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamos que le servirá para comprar insumos para la preparación y venta D. alimentos: comida y bebida, va a comprar: verduras, fríjoles, azúcar, sal, saborizantes, pollo, condimentos, etc. En el futuro desea ver su negocio mejor y as granD.. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a la producción agrícola, al comercio y a la artesanía.
texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is 34 years old and married. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has two children who are in school. Her work is selling food and drinks and also selling cosmetics. She started her business when she had a small amount of capital, and she now has 5 years of experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a merchant. 

She decided to organize a group in order to apply for loans which would allow her to buy supplies for the preparation and sale of food and drinks. She will buy vegetables, beans, sugar, salt, seasonings, chicken, condiments, etc. In the future, she would like to see her business become larger and better. The other members of the group work in the fields of agricultural production, commerce and handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn, 32, is married with two children, aged 11 and 9. She lives with her family in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato.

Jennlyn is engaged in farming and has been growing rice and corn crops for four years now. She earns as much as 15,000 PHP per month when the harvest is good.

Jennlyn requested this loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes for her farm to always be productive.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Villa Lipe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA LIPE” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Virginia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de almuerzo, venta de queso, compra y venta de ganado, tienda de barrio, venta de papa, venta de químicos. 

La señora Virginia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de venta de queso, que viene trabajando desde hace diez años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de queso) que adquirirá de las comerciantes de Achacachi y lo comercializará de la feria de la Ceja los días jueves y sábado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene siete hijos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Villa Lipe will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi regional office. It is made up of 11 members and is led by a directive board headed up by Mrs. Virginia. The businesses carried out by the members of the communal association are varied; among them they have: lunch sales, cheese sales, purchase and sale of livestock, neighborhood grocery, potato sales, and chemical sales. 

Mrs. Virginia indicates that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution at the invitation of the loan officer. Currently she has a business selling cheese, which she has been working in for ten years, having learned it from her mother. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital to buy cheese which she will purchase from the merchants of Achacachi and sell at the La Ceja market on Thursdays and Saturdays. This type of work allows her to generate resources for supporting her family, since she is a widow and has seven children.

loans.use: to purchase cheese.

loans.name: Green Machine Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 49 years old and comes from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is widowed and has three children, aged 23, 25 and 28. She also cares for two dependents. 

Rosemary runs a retail cross-border business selling clothes, blankets, duvets and stoves. Her business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges she faces are import duties and high transport costs. 

Rosemary has requested a loan of $400 to buy DVDs, blankets and stoves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her family members and neighborhood orphans to school. In the future, Rosemary plans to open several shops in Gweru town centre.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blankets, duvets and stoves to sell

loans.name: Jazgul's Group

texts.en: Jazgul is the leader of this group. She is 24 and together with her husband she is bringing up a newborn baby. Two months ago, with an initial investment of 500 soms, Jazgul started to sell Oriflame and Faberlic cosmetics. Her business is running well; at the moment she earns 3000 soms per month. She applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to purchase more cosmetics in order to increase the commodity turnover. In the future, with the profits gained from her sales, Jazgul wants to repair her house. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: William

texts.es:
Willian de 26 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mórrope que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque . Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y turística de los pobladores.

Willian se dedica desde hace 2 años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes o a los distintos mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y con los ingresos que obtenga pueda solventar los gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, al estar bien alimentados los puede ofrecer a sus clientes a un mejor precio,  con la finalidad de que obtenga  más ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Willian es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es salir adelante y seguir ayudando a sus padres en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
26 year old William is single and lives with his parents in a house that is connected to the electricity grid. They live in a rural zone of the district of Mórrope, which is part of the department of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by its agricultural activity, livestock, and tourism.
William has been working for two years raising and selling pigs. He has a sty behind his house and he feeds them a special balanced diet. Once they reach their optimum size, he offers them to his clients or takes them to the various markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque and he uses the profits that he makes to cover his personal expenses. 
He has requested a loan of $750 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their respective food. When they are well fed he will offer them to his clients at a better price with the goal of obtaining greater profits so he can have a better quality of life. William is a hardworking and responsible person and the only thing he wants is to be successful so he can keep helping his parents with what they need.

loans.use: to buy animals and their respective food.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina farms rice and corn in the Philippines. She is 41 years old and married. Dina has three children who are all in school. Her husband is also a farmer and her partner in managing the farm. 

Dina has been in farming for 21 years. With her experience in rice farming, she is confident that her rice is high quality and always sees to it that her crops are in good condition. Her profit in rice farming depends on the weather and amount of fertilizer applied to the crops.

Dina wants to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice farm. The loan will be a big help in earning a higher income because she will be able to buy the farm supplies she needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her rice farm.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de inviernos para mujeres, hombre y niños ya que sus clientes le están solicitando este tipo de mercancía, antes de que llegue el invierno ya estar preparados.
Doña Rosa Maria es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas bajo su responsabilidad y a  quienes que terminen una carrera profesional. 
Desea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que los gastos familiares y escolares sean cubiertos con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como maestra. 
La señora Rosa Maria ya ha tenido un crédito con KIVA el cual pago puntual, espera contar con su cooperación para este préstamo que será para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Maria has been selling new and used clothing for more than four years. She is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing for women, men, and children. Her customers want to be prepared, so they are requesting this type of merchandise before winter arrives.

Doña Rosa Maria is a single mother and has two daughters who are her responsibility. She wants them to finish a professional degree. Rosa Maria wants to repay this loan using the earnings she generates from her business. The family and school expenses are covered by the salary she receives from her job as a teacher.

Rosa Maria has already had one loan with Kiva which was repaid on time. She hopes to have assistance with this loan so that she can invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing for women and men.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar de 37 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona urbana del departamento de la Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad principal es la minería, comercio, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Oscar tiene como actividad laboral la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela y también realiza trabajos a pedidos, la competencia en el rubro no es mucha, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 para comprar material y dar mantenimiento a su máquina, ha así puede seguir brindando un buen servicio y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le han hecho sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener más ganancias para mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.  Oscar con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo a sabido sacar su negocio y a su familia adelante y a que  se superen en la vida.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old, he lives with his family in a house of his own equipped with the basic services and located in the urban area of the Cajamarca department. The main activities of the area are mining, trading, agriculture, livestock breeding and tourism.

Oscar created and sells clothes and he has been engaged in this activity for various years. His workshop is located in his house, he can count on recurring customers and he also makes clothes to order. The competition in this field is not tight, and with the money he earns he is able to pay for the necessities of his family.

He has requested a loan to Edpyme Alternativa though Capital Semilla de 2000 to buy materials and to pay for maintenance works on his sewing machine, so that he can continue providing a good service to his customers and realizing the clothes he has been requested. In this way he will be able to earn more in order to improve his family’s standard of living. With great effort and hard work Oscar has been able to make his activity progress and to provide for his family and for them to become someone in life.

loans.use: To buy materials to create clothes and to pay for maintenace works on his sewing machine.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en: Elida is from the village of Erazgavors in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is happily married with three sons (fourteen, nineteen and twenty-two years old).  Elida has a high school education and has been working as a farmer for the past twenty years.  Her eldest son will soon marry and she would like to help him with the wedding costs.  She also dreams of renovating the family house.  Elida would like a loan to purchase additional cattle.  She expects this investment to bring the family thirty percent additional income.  She has a positive opinion of microfinance and the opportunity to expand her business.  She enjoys living in her native village of Erazgavors near her relatives and good friends.

loans.use: purchase additional cattle

loans.name: Bessy Carolina

texts.es:
Bessy, vive con sus hijos y su familia, se dedica a atender una granja de pollos y una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, este negocio es propio, inicio hace tres años, por la necesidad de generar ingresos para su familia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de 20 quintales de concentrado y 1000 pollos de engorde pequeños,  la compra le permitirá abastecer la granja, iniciar un nuevo crecimiento de pollos para que dentro de algunos meses inicie la venta.
La aspiración de Bessy es convertirse en una microempresaria de éxito, sacar a delante a sus hijos, con puro esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Bessy lives with her children and her family.  She runs a chicken farm and a grocery store.  The business is hers and she started it three years ago needing to generate family income.  

She’s asking for a loan to buy 20 quintals of feed concentrate and 1000 chicks to raise.  The purchase will allow her to equip the farm and start a new chick growing period so that they can be sold in a few months. 

Bessy’s hope is to become a successful micro businesswoman and to raise her children through just with her efforts.

loans.use: to buy 20 quintals of feed concentrate and 1000 chicks to raise.

loans.name: La Seriedad Group

texts.es:
Luz Benita es miembro del Grupo Solidario La Seriedad, es comerciante, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos y junto a ellos reside en la Comunidad de San Nicolas. Muchos años atras su padre le prestó algo de dinero y con eso compró ropa de segunda mano para vendersela a sus vecinos, de sus ventas le quedaba algo de ganancia y volvia a comprar mercaderia. Despues de un tiempo Luz decidió dedicarse a la venta de condimentos, y aprendió de una de sus hermanas. 

Sus hijos la ayudan a preparar los condimientos y luego ella sale a las Aldeas cercanas a venderlos, se transporta a jalon por alguien conocido. Las ventas las realiza cada 15 dias pero en su casa vende de forma permanente. Sus mayores dificultades son el clima y que cuando no encuentra a nadie que le de jalon tiene que caminar grandes distancias. 

Con el apoyo del prestamo comprará condimentos como ser: achiote, especias, canela, clavos de olor, romero, linaza, y tambien comprar bolsitas, grapas para el empaque. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podrá surtir su negocio y espera que sus ventas aumenten. 

Su meta es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que estos se graduen, dos de ellos ya lo hicieron gracias a su esfuerzo laboral. Luz es clienta de FAMA por mas de 15 ciclos y ha sido muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luz Benita is a member of the 'La Seriedad' community bank.  She is a saleswoman.  Luz is 43 years old and a single mother of four children.  She lives together with her children in San Nicolás community.  Many years ago, her father loaned her some money which she used to buy second-hand clothing to sell to her neighbors.  Her sales made her some profits and so she bought some more merchandise.  After a while, Luz decided to start selling seasonings and learned from one of her sisters.  

Luz's children help her to prepare her seasonings and then she goes out to nearby villages to sell them.  She hitches a lift with somebody she knows.  She makes these sales every two weeks but she sells from her home all the time.  Luz's main difficulties are the weather and when she can't find somebody to give her a ride because this means she has to walk long distances.

With the support of this loan, Luz will buy seasonings such as annatto, spices, cinnamon, cloves, rosemary and linseed.  She will also buy small bags and staples with which to package them.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and she hopes that her sales will increase.

Luz's goal is to continue supporting her children so that they graduate.  Two of her children have already done this thanks to her work.  Luz has been a FAMA client for more than 15 loan cycles and she has been very punctual in making her loan repayments.

loans.use: to purchase seasonings.

loans.name: Jessivel

texts.en:
Jessivel is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Jessivel has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jessivel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jessivel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Residenciales El Campo N° 2 Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Residenciales El Campo #2 está integrado por tres socias, los cuales realizan diferentes actividades económicas. Doña Elbia es una las socias, tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos. De lunes a viernes, ella tiene un empleo fijo como aseadora y el fin de semana vende verduras. El problema más difícil que enfrenta es que no tiene una vivienda propia, y los directivos de la escuela le dieron permiso para que construyera una habitación dentro de las instalaciones de la misma y gracias a los préstamos obtenidos en FAMA pudo hacerlo, aunque la habitacion es muy pequeña para su familia. Su reto es ahorrar aunque sea de poco en poco para comprar un solar y poder construir su casa, seguir manteniendo a su familia porque hace dos años su esposo murió y no tiene ningún otro soporte económico. Elbia solicita el préstamo para comprar papas, chiles, cebollas, zanahorias, pataste, repollo, coliflor, brocoli, entre otras verduras. y así ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Una de sus ventajas es que su hijo mayor le ayuda a transportar en una carreta las verduras desde la escuela hasta el mayoreo y no tiene que pagar transporte ni empleado porque él también le ayuda a atender a los clientes. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias para ahorrar un poco, seguir llevando el alimento a su casa y seguir pagando el estudio de sus cuatro hijos menores. Su sueño es tener también un puesto de venta de ropa para contar con otra entrada de dinero y así poder empezar a construir su casa, y graduar a sus hijos. Elbia se siente muy agradecida porque con el financiamiento obtenido en FAMA ha podido mejorar sus condiciones económicas y de antemano se siente agradecida con todas las personas que invertirán en ella a través del préstamo.
texts.en:
The united group called, “Residenciales El Campo #2” is made up of three members who run different businesses.  Elbia is one of the members.  She’s 51 years old, a widow, and has five children.  She has a steady job as a school advisor from Monday to Friday and sells vegetables on the weekends.  Her biggest problem is that she doesn’t have her own home and the school managers have allowed her to set up living quarters within the school.  Thanks to the loans she’s gotten through FAMA, she’s been able to set it up, although it’s too small for her family.

It’s a challenge for her to save money, but she’s saving a little at a time to buy a lot on which to build, while continuing to support her family.  Her husband died two years ago and she has no other means of financial support.

Elbia is asking for this loan in order to buy potatoes, peppers, onions, carrots, chayote squash, cauliflower, broccoli, and other vegetables, so that she can offer the greatest variety of products to her customers.  One of her advantages is that her oldest son helps her transport her vegetables from the school to the marker in his cart, so she doesn’t have to pay for transportation or for an employee because he also helps to serve the customers.

With the support of this loan, she hopes to increase her income to be able to save a bit, continue feeding her family, and continue paying for her four youngest children’s school expenses.
