Her dream is to also have a place to sell clothing so that she can have another source of income and be able to build her house and graduate her children.

Elbia feels very grateful because this loan she obtained through FAMA has allowed her to improve her financial situation.  She is grateful to all the people who will invest in her through this loan.
.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Doña Alba Luz tiene 56 años de edad, vive el en barrio san antonio en san lorenzo y se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, accesorios para damas y adornos para el hogar, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, ahí le llegan todos sus clientes y amigos que tiene, los fines de semana sale a vender a las aldeas y caserios cercanos a su comunidad. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, desea tener bien surtido su negocio para la epoca de navidad que es cuando mas se vende.
Su deseo es que su familia este bien de salud y tengan trabajo para salir adelante.
texts.en: Alba Luz, 56, lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the city of San Lorenzo. She sells new clothing, accessories for women and home decor. Her business is located in her house, and all of her customers and friends come there to buy. On weekends, she goes out to sell in the towns and villages nearby. She will use the loan to buy new clothing. She wants to have the business well stocked for the Christmas season, when her sales are highest. Her wish is that her family is in good health and that they have jobs so they can keep moving ahead.

loans.use: to buy new women's, men's and children's clothing.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: A sus 36 años de edad, la señora Claudia Patricia se dedica desde su pequeña finca ubicada en una vereda del Municipio de Sonsón localizado al oriente de Antioquia al cultivo de tomate de árbol, aguacate, curaba y cebolla desde hace 10 años, dicha actividad la da los frutos para el cuidado y sostenimiento de sus dos hijos de 6 y 14 años de edad. Con el ánimo de reactivar su cultivo de tomate de árbol el cual redujo su producción debido al invierno, la señora Claudia Patricia necesita de la compra de abonos, riegos, fertilizantes e insecticidas con los cuales pueda cumplir su objetivo y así poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y cumplir su sueño de  ver su finca bien productiva.
texts.en: At age 36, Claudia Patricia has been cultivating tomato trees, avocados, curaba, and onions for 10 years on her small farm located on a path from the municipality of Sonsón which is located to the east of Antioquia.  This activity gives her the income to care for and sustain her two children who are 6 and 14 years old.  With the intention of reviving her tomato tree crop which reduced its production due to the winter, Claudia Patricia needs to buy fertilizers, hoses, and insecticides.  With these items she will be able to carry out her objective and therefore be able to improve the quality of life of her children and fulfill her dream of seeing her farm being very productive.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, hoses, and insecticides

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is 33 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. She is married with two children. Vicky has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for two years. Vicky requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Vicky hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 34 year old married woman who has 5 family members from Al Karak Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for clothes to sell in her area,she wants to expand her project.In the future she would like to open a shop for her products to sell.Also she hopes to provide for her family a good environment to live in.

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase three local pigs and renovate the cage

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the town of Chitungwiza, north of Harare.  She and her husband have 5 children, the youngest of which is 2 years old. 

Several years ago, Elizabeth established a fruit and vegetable stall in the local community. The business provides the sole source of income for the family, with Elizabeth’s husband now also helping out on the stall.

Family expenses are a struggle, given the school fees needed for 4 of the children, plus the support Elizabeth gives to her own and her husband’s parents back in their rural communities.  Elizabeth has also been trying to gradually make improvements to the home, building a three-roomed cottage for the family.

Given all of her family commitments, Elizabeth would like to expand the business.  She will use her loan to invest in a wider variety of stock, which she knows will be popular locally.

loans.use: To purchase a wider variety of stock such as fruits and vegetables in order to expand the grocery business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: A popular agricultural produce seller in her community. She sells farm produce including eggs, tomatoes,garden eggs, green pepper among other organic produce to the community members with a population of 5,000 inhabitants. The proximity of the community to Accra, the National capital also gives her added advantage as she supplies fresh farm produce to the local markets and workers in Accra who live and work in the community. She is a valued client of Kraban Support Foundtaion. She has acquired skills in agribusiness records keeping and has developed a simple but smart business plan. She needs working capital to purchase more farm produce to sell to her numerous customers.

loans.use: WORKING CAIPTAL

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is married and has 9 children, four of them are still in school.  Her business involves selling a variety of foodstuffs such as porige, chapaties, and Nyoyo, which she serves to 
low-income people. She has been in this business since 1983 and has been able to sustain her family and provide for their daily needs.

Given the loan, she wants to buy foodstuffs in bulk to enable her to maintain serving lower class clients and reduce the cost of buying retail.  She also wants to buy utensils to replace old ones.

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau works as a day laborer and plants rice. She has three children who are in school. Their income is low at only $9 per person per month. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow to raise.

loans.use: Chau wants to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Alma Delia

texts.es:
Alma is 35 years old. She is married and mother of two children - a 10 year-old boy and a 12 year-old girl. They are originally from the town of Escobedo located in Nueva Leon state. She started her own business selling cosmetic products so that she could help support her family and improve their living standards. Due to requests she received she began also selling sneakers and ladies' sandals to family members and friends. Soon her clientele increased thanks to the good service she has offered. She puts in a lot of effort to combine work 's and family's needs - she sells merchandise from home or door-to-door.

Alma wishes to purchase a pick-up truck that will be very useful to her business. In order to continue expanding her business she now needs a loan in the amount of US$1200.00. This amount will be used to purchase more merchandise to increase sales. She agrees to repay her loan within 3 months. Be a part of Alma's venture and make a point to sponsor her way to success. She and her family deeply thanks you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer.

Alma tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y madre de un niño y una niña de 10 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León. Para poder contribuir con los gastos familiares y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia Alma inició su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, a petición de sus clientes fue incorporando la venta de tenis y sandalias, ella comenzó a realizar sus ventas entre familiares y amigos, pronto fue incrementando su número de clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece. Ella se esfuerza mucho para sacar adelante su negocio sin descuidar a su familia, realiza sus ventas en su hogar y en ocasiones sale a ofrecer sus productos casa por casa.

Alma desea poder adquirir una camioneta que le será de mucha utilidad en su negocio, ahora para poder continuar creciendo, ella solicita un préstamo de $1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en solo 3 meses. Forma parte en los logros de Alma, y decídete a apoyarla, ella y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Candi

texts.es:
Mrs. Candi belongs to the Ricardo Palma Communal Bank, of the Calleria District, Ucayali Department. She is 25 years old and has one child. Together with her husband she has dedicated herself to the making of stocks for making brooms. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300 (approximately US $94.00) they had the opportunity to acquire a machine to plane wood, later they decided to buy sawmill waste wood and thus create stocks, the same as those that are sold to the people who make brooms. Now they have requested a loan of S/. 900.00 (approximately US $285.00) for the purchase of a wood truck that the sawmill is not using, three bundles of piasaba (fibrous product of two Brazilian palm trees used in making brooms), also they require a telephone to make orders to the sawmills and thus diminish the current costs of making the orders. In addition to caring for their little son, she continues in this work, at her side with this small machine they can make stocks and sell to the women who make brooms by hand made artisanal methods.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Candi pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, y 1 hijo. Junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de tacos para armar escobas, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) tuvieron la oportunidad de adquirir una maquina para cepillar madera, luego deciden comprar de los aserraderos desperdicios de madera y así elaborar tacos, los mismos que son vendidos a las personas que arman escobas. Ahora han solicitado un préstamo de S/. 900.00 (US$ 285.00 aprox.) para la compra de una camionada de madera que no utilizan los aserraderos, 3 fardos de piasaba, además requieren de un teléfono para hacer pedidos a los aserraderos y así disminuir los costos al momento de hacer los pedidos. Además de cuidar a su pequeño hijo, se siente realizada en dicho trabajo, a su vez con esta pequeña maquina pueden hacer tacos y vender a las señoras que hacen escobas de manera de forma artesanal.

loans.use: Purchase of material (wood and basic supplies) . Acquisition of telephone line. - Compra de materia prima (madera e insumos).  Adquisición de linea telefónica.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born June 24, 1959 in Tsévié. He is a carpenter who takes care of four (04) other people. Having suffered a great deal from his parents’poverty, he has worked hard to face life’s challenges. To do so, he opened a carpenter’s workshop in his house. He works with limited means, but he is very talented and his furniture is greatly admired. He needs financial assistance in order to pay for the wood and other tools needed to make and display his furniture. He is thus requesting a loan of $1000 to achieve his goals.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né à Tsévié le 24 juin 1959, monsieur Kokou A. est menuisier et a quatre (04) personnes à sa charge. Ayant beaucoup souffert à cause de la pauvreté de ses parents, il travaille dure pour lutter contre les difficultés de la vie. C’est pour cela même qu’il a ouvert son atelier à la maison faute de moyens financiers mais ses meubles sont fortement appréciés grâce à son talent. Il a besoin d’un appui financier pour payer les bois et d’autres outils en vue de fabriquer des meubles pour exposition. Alors, il désire un crédit de $1000 pour arriver à ses fins.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to make and sell furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise.

loans.name: Ushirika_A Group

texts.en:
Adela, age 39, is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 16, and 11. She also takes care of two other children, ages 7 and 9. Adela started a clothing business in 2003 and a cow grazing business in 2001. She works from 6am to 5pm daily. From both of her businesses, she earns a monthly profit of about $78.

In the past, Adela took a loan from BRAC Tanzania to enhance her businesses. She now requests a new loan for the same purpose by buying more inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Janeth, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
The sale of cosmetics in León is a very common and lucrative business that has been surging in many Nicaraguan cities. Mrs. Maria Auxiliadora V. first dedicated herself to this trade 20 years ago in order to aid her husband in home expenses.

She began her business with some money she had saved herself. She has worked with Ceprodel for 20 years obtaining loans that have crucially helped her business. Because of the credits she has been able to increase her income and procure a greater volume of cosmetics for marketing. Her history shows 11 credits with Ceprodel, all paid on time and in agreement with the contract.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La venta de cosméticos en la ciudad de León es un negocio muy común y rentable que ha venido creciendo no solamente en León son también en el resto de ciudades de Nicaragua. La señora Maria Auxiliadora V. se dedica desde hace 20 años a este negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.

Inició su negocio con un pequeño capital obtenido por medio de sus propios ahorros y desde hace 20 años ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de cosméticos para su debida comercialización.

Su record crediticio actual es de 11 créditos con Ceprodel pagados en tiempo y forma según lo acordado.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva V. R. owns her own business working as a seamstress in the city of Morales, San Martin. She started the business from her living room in 2000 because she had a useful skill, wanted to take charge of her life, and did not want to rely on her husband. Now she makes and sells custom bedspreads, blankets, and covers to her neighbors, friends, and family.

Genoveva is 34 years old, married and has three children. She is happy that she can work from home so that she can also take care of her children. Genoveva is proud to be a productive member of her community and a positive role model for her children. Her goal is to save enough money to send all of her children to university so they can have more opportunities in life than she had.

A member of Manuela Ramos and the community bank Las Moralinas, Genoveva is requesting a loan of $525 to repay over 6 months. With the loan she would like to buy a selection of new fabrics and threads so she can offer her clients different, creative products.

loans.use: With the loan she would like to buy a selection of new fabrics and threads

loans.name: Salongo Kalam's Group

texts.en: Salongo K. is such an outgoing person, and no doubt this has enabled him to keep his all-time customers. He is 43 years and married with 6 children. He used to look after his relatives’ children, but now they are old and most of them married. He is a farmer of rice, tomatoes, coffee, vanilla, cassava, and potatoes, and he has been doing this all his life. The loans have helped him buy from other farmers when he does not have enough for his customers, especially in a bad season. So he needs a loan to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi. Both Salongo and Sarah are members of Zibula Atudde Women’s Group.

loans.use: Salongo Kalam plans to buy coffee and green bananas from farmers to sell in the markets in Buikwe, Kawolo, and Lugazi.

loans.name: Sarah Namutebi's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is the leader of 5 members. She is 38 and married with 7 children. They are 18, 14, 12, 10, 8 (twins), and 5. All of them are in school. The community she lives and works in is semi urban and a slum within a low-lying area that floods in the rainy season.

Her main challenges are the high transport costs and the floods that make her place of work inaccessible to clients.

She rents an open space and uses part of her courtyard to display the eucalyptas poles. These poles are used in the construction of houses. There is an available market because the construction industry is booming everywhere in Uganda.

She is able to pay rent and school dues and contribute to the family welfare.

Her biggest plan is to buy a motor vehicle to help in the transportation of these poles from the villages to the distribution point.

Sarah has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: Her biggest plan is to buy a motor vehicle to help in the transportation of poles.

loans.name: Aguilas De Oro Group

texts.es:
In the city of El Alto there is the association called “Águilas de Oro” (Golden Eagles) that works with Pro-Mujer very responsibly, they are a very likeable and united group. Most of them are married with kids, their husbands’ salaries are not enough to support them; therefore they work to support their homes. They have several different activities like beauty products sales, cell phone and other appliances repair shops, but the principal activity is the production and sales of delicious hand made chocolates (filled with fruits, coconut, chocolate bars, and in animal shapes) that are later on sold on the streets and at open markets in the city of La Paz. Their goal is to increase their capital to buy better quality packaging and improve the presentation of their products so they can reach more demanding markets and buy more supplies to increase their production, so they can create more income for the good of their children.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra a la asociación “Águilas de Oro” que trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer con mucha responsabilidad un grupo muy simpático y unido sobre todo. La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con hijos, nos cuentan que con para mantener sus hogares no les alcanza con los sueldos de sus esposos, lo que les llevo a buscar una actividad que les permita generar ingresos para solventar la economía de sus hogares. Varias son las actividades a las que se dedican por ejemplo la venta de cosméticos de marca, reparación de celulares y equipos electrónicos y otros, pero la actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de exquisitos chocolates artesanales (chocolates rellenos de fruta, de coco, en barra, chocolate puro en formas de animalitos) que luego de elaborarlos los venden de manera ambulante o en puestos de ferias en toda la ciudad de Paz. El objetivo de ellas es el de aumentar su capital para la compra de empaques de mejor calidad y presentación para que axial sus productos puedan llegar a mercados mas exigentes y comprar mayores insumos para generar mayor producción, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para el bien de sus hijos.

loans.use: Need capital to buy provisions and packages to improve the quality of their products / Necesitan capital para la compra de insumos y empaques de mejor calidad para sus productos

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose J. sells electrical parts, a skill she learned from her husband over a four year period. She has owned the business since 2004. Rose is 42-years-old and has five children. She has been the secretary in her union for the past three years.

Rose is requesting a loan to buy more electrical parts which will enhance the prosperity of her business.

loans.use: To buy more electrical parts

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en:
Tatu has owned a business selling vegetables in Arusha since 1999. She is single with two children, ages 11 and 17. She works daily from 8:00am to 6:00pm, which allows her to earn a profit of approximately $30 per month.

Tatu has taken out two previous loans through BRAC Tanzania. She paid back both loans successfully and on time. She hopes to use this current loan to increase her inventory and expand her business. She hopes that doing so will allow her to earn a greater profit. Tatu will share this loan with her group member, Honoraiha, who also sells vegetables in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Boeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Boeurn S. lives in Roka Village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Chhuom Chhoeun, is a construction worker. They have seven children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other five attend school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Boeurn S.'s family has only three business activities which make a small income to meet the needs of household expenses. Currently, the family do not have a toilet in the house. Thus, Mrs. Boeurn S. has decided to ask for a loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet for the household.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Fortaleza” se dedica a la elaboración de almuerzos y servicios de té, estos distribuidos en oficinas pûblicas de la ciudad de El Alto. 
Dicha asociación se reúne en el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, a la fecha esta integrada por 14 socias que trabajan con Pro-Mujer hace más de cuatro años.
Casi todas cuentan con familias  bastante numerosas, es así que todos ayudan en el negocio, desde la preparación de los alimentos, hasta la distribución de los almuerzos ya realizados.
La asociación Fortaleza quiere obtener mayores pedidos para obtener mayores ganancias, por lo que quieren contratar ayudantes, es por eso que ellas solicitan mayores créditos para este fin. Luego de llegar a sus objetivos de venta, están seguras de mejorar la actual difícil situación económica por la que estan atravesando.
texts.en:
The association "Fortaleza" (Strength) is a lunch and tea services business, mainly working to serve government offices in the city of El Alto. This group of 14 women meet in the city center of Villa Exaltacion, and have been working with Pro-Mujer (Pro-Women) for over 4 years now. Almost all of the women have large families, and count on their family members for help with the business services, such as food preparation and distribution of lunches. The group has requested this loan because they want to hire helpers in order to obtain higher profits. They believe that reaching new sales targets will improve the current difficult economic situation which they are going through.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To hire helpers

loans.name: Loem

texts.en: Mr. Loem D. lives in Tasen Village in Kampong Cham Province. He uses his motorbike to carry a cart in order to transport goods and passengers for a fee. In this business, he now faces a small problem because his cart is too old, which make his passengers uncomfortable. Thus, he would like a loan of $500 to buy a new cart to replace the old one. Mr. Loem D. is 42 years old and married with four children, one of whom helps him in the current business while the remaining three are attending the local school.His wife, Mrs. Chhorn Sambour, is a housewife who takes care of her family and appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike transport cart.

loans.name: Hyde Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Hyde del Carmen M. O. tiene la edad de 26 años, su estado civil es acompañada, con 3 hijos a su cargo: el mayor con edad de9 años cursa el 2 grado de  primaria, el segundo con 4 años de edad no estudia y el mas pequeño con 7 meses de edad, su compañero de vida labora como ayudante de albañilería, los sueños de Hyde es tener su propia casa y en ella establecer su negocio  para  seguir generando ingresos para su familia y también para darle a sus clientes las comodidades necesarias, así podrá darle a sus hijos un buen futuro y obtendrán buena educación por medio de su esfuerzo.




La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general como lo es: ropa para niños, camisas sport, calcetines y ropa interior, el  tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 5 años, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de independizarse de su familia y empezó la distribución de sus diferentes productos de forma ambulante y fue así como ella decidió incrementar mas en su negocio para que este le fuera una fuente de trabajo para el, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para invertir mas en sus productos así ofrecer calidad y cantidad a sus clientes para obtener mas ganancias y realizar los planes que tiene para su futuro.
texts.en:
Hyde del Carmen M. O. is 26 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children. The oldest is 9 and in second grade, the second one is 4 years old and not yet in school, and the youngest is 7 months old. Her partner works as a bricklayer assistant. Hyde dreams of having her own home and setting up her business there so she can continue earning income for her family as well as to offer more conveniences to her customers. In this way and with her efforts, she will be able to give her children a good future and a good education. She sells merchandise such as clothing for children, sport shirts, socks and underwear and has had this business for the past 5 years. She started the business because she needed to become independent of her family. She began distributing her goods by means of traveling sales and then decided to increase her business so that it could become a source of income for her. The loan is for working capital to invest in more goods and to offer better quality and quantity to her customers and thus, have more earnings and work toward her future plans.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Iganga Road Group

texts.en: Suzan N. is married with 4 children, all in school. For the past six years, she has been selling used clothing for women, men, and children from Jinja Market. She buys her stock from the large market in Kampala and some times from Jinja, from the recently opened stores, at a discount and then displays the items for sale at a higher price. For the stall in the market, she pays a daily fee to the authorities and with her loan, she plans to buy a bale of used clothes for her stock. By buying in larger quantities, Suzan can get a larger discount, hence more profits. She has been a member of the Iganga Road group for 2 years.

loans.use: Buying a bale of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Hoàng Thị Lân  năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004.  Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh doanh chè khô và lương thợ xây của chồng với thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị Lân mong muốn được vay 7.000.để phục vụ cho công việc buôn bán chè khô nhằm tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Lân is 42 years old. She joined the TYM Fund in 2004. At the moment, the family's main sources of income are selling dry snacks and the husband's construction worker salary. They have an income of 4,000,000 VND per month. For this loan cycle, Mrs. L. hopes to borrow 7,000,000 VND to invest further into their dry snacks business and increase the family's income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling dry snacks

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is Fatmata J., age forty. Fatmata was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and the two have two children. One is in secondary school and the other has dropped out of school and is now training to become a motor mechanic. Fatmata sells cloth: cottons and “Laise” cottons. She has been in business for over twenty years now. She began the business when she was a little child with her mum. This will be her very first loan from SMT. She is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to help her strengthen her business.

With this loan, Fatmata will expand her business by buying two bales of cottons to add to her current stock. She will need additional money from her capital to enable her to buy the two bales. A bale of cotton in Freetown costs Le 1,500,000 and a bale of Laise cotton costs Le 1,700,000. The fare to Freetown is Le 24,000 round trip. There is a Le 1000 delivery charge for each bale transported with her from Freetown.

Business is going fine for Fatmata. The only challenge she has been facing is that of low capital, but with the loan she now receives from SMT, that challenge has been overcome. With this loan she receives from SMT, Fatmata is expecting a vast improvement in her business and an incremental increase in the amount of profit she makes. The increase in profit will make her feel good.

loans.use: Buy one bale of cotton and one bale of laise cotton

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en: Mrs. Chanry T. lives in Angk village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough rice seeds to cultivate rice to earn a living. Chanry has decided to ask for a loan, partly to buy rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season, and the rest to buy fertilizers and pesticides to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Nguon Pov, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Chanry T. is 23 years old and married without any children.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to cultivate in the dry season, and to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ibodatoy

texts.ru: Каримова Ибодатой проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 49 лет, замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается торговлей на центральном рынке. Торгует растительным , в частности хлопковым маслом. Товар завозит из города Душанбе. В данный момент возникла проблема с тем , что произошел дефицит денег . Поэтому она решила получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ibodatoy K. lives in the Gissar region. She is 49 years old, is married and has five children. She sells products at the central market. She sells vegetable, in particular cottonseed oil. She brings her products in from Dushanbe. Right now she has a problem with a money deficit. This is why she has decided to take out a loan in order to increase her inventory. She will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 34-year-old woman who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and their four children. Mariam has owned a grocery store since 2003. She requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her fourth cycle and she has always paid on time. 
Her previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Mariam is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and family members. When she first started her work, she didn’t have enough startup capital. Mariam decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe E. is a mother to four children. She is married to Jose E., who is a rickshaw driver and also a farmer. Her eldest son, Jose, is a graduate of Hotel and Restaurant Management. The youngest is an 18 year old high school graduate.

Fe's life has not been easy. She ventured in different businesses like growing corn and backyard poultry. Now, they realize there is demand for firewood for students and at the market. In her loan application she proposes to use the loan for additional capital to buy firewood and rice for retail sales.

She is hopeful that these businesses will grow and will bring them back enough proceeds for sustainability, and can support their family's needs. In the future, she is looking forward to selling her products in other markets in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: To buy firewood and rice for retail sales.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Née en Mars 1981 à Gapé Hlihagbé, Mme A. Abra a abandonné les classes très tôt et s’est lancée dans le commerce de préparation de l’huile rouge ou huile de palme communément appelé « Amidjè ». Mère de deux (02) enfants, elle se débrouille seule pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Vu son effort et le dynamisme, Mme A. Abra demande un crédit pour renforcer son commerce afin d’améliorer sa situation socio-économique.
texts.en:
Born in March 1981 in Gapé Hlihagbé, Mrs. A. Abra left school at a young age and began the business of preparing red oil or palm oil, commonly called « Amidjè ». Mother of two children, she manages to support her family alone. In view of her effort and her dynamism, Mrs. A. Abra is requesting a loan to bolster her business so as to improve her socio-economic situation.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: production and sale of palm oil

loans.name: Nusrat Sultana Rana Gulzar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Nusrat sultana baji has lived in Borewala in Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines, for the past fourteen years. She is uneducated because her father could not afford to pay for her education. Nusrat sultana baji is skilled in making embroidered dresses. She earns an income by making dresses for her neighbors. Her husband has an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times he sells animals to butchers.

Nusrat sultana baji is applying for a loan to buy animals (goats) to increase the profit of her husband’s animal-selling business. She is the leader of a group comprising two other women from her locality. Nagina parveen baji and Mumtaz baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Amelie

texts.fr: Madame Amelie S.  vend des produits tels que l’huile de palme, les jus de citron, du pain de singe, des balaies et du miel. Chaque mois elle parcoure plus 700km pour aller chercher ses produits en Casamance  au sud du Sénégal. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités commerciales les revenus génères par le commerce lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne et à l’entretien du ménage.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amelie S. sells products such as palm oil, lemon juice, monkey bread, brooms, and honey. Every month she travels over 700 km to go and buy her products in Casamance, in the south of Sénégal. She is asking for this loan to bolster her little business. The income from this business permits her to share in covering daily expenses and household upkeep.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of palm oil

loans.name: Raema Group

texts.en:
Raema is the group leader of Raema group. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan for expanding their business to make it larger.

Raema wants to take a loan for her bakery business.

Hateka wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

Razei wants to take a loan for her carpet-weaving business.

Karema wants to take a loan for her husband who has a carpentry shop.

So they are requesting a group loan of 42,000 Afghani and they are very thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders who are able to support all the poor people.

loans.use: To expand her bakery business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 48 years old and she is married with three children. She sells garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) in the market in Benin City, Edo State. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN to purchase more garri to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more garri to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Danelia C. A., es cliente de la institución Fundación León 2000 es una mujer muy trabajadora su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Aquí habita con sus hijos y su esposo. Aquí es donde fabrica mochilas, pantalones cortos de niño, bolsos y uniformes para estudiantes, por lo que ha logrado mantener el bienestar a su familia, su cónyuge es el encargado de comercializar los productos en el mercado oriental de la ciudad capital. Juntos han logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de hilos, tijeras, tela, centímetro y otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle a su familia lo mejor.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en:
Bummi produces and sells hair and body cream on a wholesale and retail basis to customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She started this business seven years ago. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more materials to produce body and hair cream to sell.

Bummi is 47 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to produce hair and body cream to sell

loans.name: Felesia

texts.en: Felesia F. is an entrepreneur Tanzanian business woman. She runs a business of selling charcoal at Yombo Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam. Charcoal is the main source for domestic used in most of the developing countries due to high price of an electricity power. She purchases the business goods direct from the producers in whole sales and selling to retail customers for domestic consumption. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to enlarge his farm

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo F. is 26 years old and married to Marichu F., who is now working abroad. The couple is blessed with one child, Darius, who is four years old. Bernardo and Marichu are helping one another to provide for the needs of their family. Bernardo hopes to improve his family's standard of living, and he believes that through “sacrifices and patience” he will be able to achieve success in life.

Bernardo would like to have additional capital for the general maintenance of his motorcycle and for his other businesses, such as farming and hog-raising in his backyard. He is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 5,000 PHP.

loans.use: As additional capital for his motorcycle business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
This is Eliza D. R., a 53-year-old general store owner who lives in Tala, Caloocan City, with her husband Mariano, a driver, and their four children.

Eliza opened her store three years ago and has since been an alternative source of income for her family.  It is located just in front of their house.  She earns more than $225 a month.  She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative only last year but has since been active in inviting other women in her community to her group.  She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative.  Now on her 4th loan cycle, she has applied for a fresh loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP as additional capital for her store. She dreams of having a larger grocery store someday.  



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her store

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 26 years old and married with one young child. He has a business in the Kayole area of Nairobi buying and selling electronics, such as televisions, DVDs, and MEKOs (gas cookers). He's been in this business for two years and employs one person. He also earns income distributing kerosene. 

He requested this loan for 80,000 KES from Faulu to purchase more electronics to sell. He describes himself as stable and focused and says that since he became a member of Faulu he has been able increase his overall income. In the future, he hopes to open more branches of his business.

loans.use: Add to stock of electronics

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 42 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a commercial driver and also a welder and he also supports the home. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans and cooking oil. Patience is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting a loan for the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine S., 45 years of age, is a sari-sari (general) store owner and a gasoline retailer.  She is married, but separated, and a resident of Maquilao, Tangub City. She is blessed with three children, two of whom are still dependent minors.  She is also receiving support from her common-law husband who is a fisherman. To help support their family needs, she began a sari-sari store and for five years she has been able to maintain her business. She joined Kiva partner PAGLAUM MPC two years ago because she was very much interested in PMPC's wide product offerings. With her good credit record, she was given the privilege to apply for a loan of 5,000 PHP as her fifth loan to allow her to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and gasoline retailing business. The future income from this business will be used for their daily basic needs and savings.

loans.use: To provide additional capital.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a businesswoman. She sells Dumas cloth, linen, lace materials and also flour, margarine and yeast etc. to the bakers around her community. She mostly sells the clothing materials through hawking, that is, personal selling method. This, she said, makes her goods move very fast. She is 31 years old and a married mother with three children. All her children are in school. She is very supportive to her family through the proceeds she makes from the business.

Cecilia has been selling for the past eight years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas cloth, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. She dreams of having her own house from the savings she makes every day, and she would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas cloth etc. in bulk

loans.name: Shahid

texts.en: Shahid M. is a 43-year-old trader who has been selling sewing supplies in his own shop since 1996. He is married and a responsible father of two sons. He started his business with $100 in capital and now his monthly income is now approximately $300. This business is the only income in Shahid`s family and it is a stable income that allow him to cover his family's needs. But his main dream is to provide the best education for his sons, and to achieve this, he need to earn more money to accumulate some savings. Shahid has applied for 1600 AZN to purchase more sewing supplies to increase his profit.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing supplies to sell

loans.name: Chilbert

texts.en:
Chilbert B. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 42 years old, married, and has school-aged children. To make a living, Chilbert owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing construction services to local community members. Chilbert has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Chilbert joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Chilbert is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide his services. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for his construction business

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: El señor Francisco José tiene 55 años de edad, es casado pero no tiene hijos. El señor brinda negocio de transporte, ya que es poseedor de una unidad de taxi. francisco  tiene trece años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sin embargo fue hace siete años que logro obtener su taxi propio, con los ahorros que obtuvo durante 5 años, lo cual le ha brindado una mayor estabilidad económica ya que ahora las ganancias le quedan a él. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizar unas compras de artículos para el vehículo, ya que necesita algunas reparaciones. Cabe señalar, que el vehículo está en muy buen estado, sin embargo desea mejorarlo. Actualmente, al igual que todo el sector transporte está enfrentando el desafío de mantener los precios y las ganancias, pese a la alta inestabilidad del combustible, lo cual hace que cada día sea más cara la canasta básica y todos los artículos. Su sueño es tener una empresa de taxis de al menos 5 vehículos, y con las ganancias poder algún día comprar su propio terreno y su propia casa.
texts.en:
Francisco José is 55 and married, but he does not have children. He is in the transportation business; he has a taxi. He has been in this business for 13 years. Seven years ago he got his own taxi with five years of savings. This has given him greater economic stability because now the earnings stay with him. He is asking for this loan to buy some things for his vehicle because it needs some repairs. He points out that the vehicle is in very good condition, but he wants to improve it. Like everyone else in the transportation sector, he is confronted with the challenge of maintaining his prices and earnings amid the great instability of gas prices. This makes the price of basic needs more expensive everyday. His dream is to have a taxi business with at least five vehicles. With the income he would one day be able to buy his own land and his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei M. is 44 and married with 9 children (ages 3 - 23).  She owns a business venture, providing dress making services to local community members.  Talalelei has 4 years of experience in this business.  Talalelei needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase new sewing machine.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Talalelei joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Talalelei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Talalelei M. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Javier

texts.en:
When Javier first opened his cosmetics stall at the Berryessa flea market in San Jose two years ago, he found that demand for the products he carried grew quickly. He can attribute much of his success since then to excellent rapport with his customers and high receptiveness to their suggestions. “I receive a lot of help from my customers. In this business, particularly, you have to treat people well, and then they’ll come back.” 

Before he began selling “everything for the woman,” as he describes it, Javier worked in construction and sold vegetables at the market, but he had a strong desire to be his own boss. He knew that he had the customer service skills, as well as the strong work ethic, to open his own stall. Javier sells his products at the market on the weekend, and works at a factory full-time during the week. He explains that he gets anxious if he has too much free time on his hands and enjoys his full work schedule. 

Javier learned about Opportunity Fund years ago from a friend that also operates a stall. This is Javier’s second loan with Opportunity Fund, and he will use the $4,500 to increase his inventory. By making monthly trips to Los Angeles, he will be able to purchase more goods at a cheaper price to bring back to his customers in San Jose. He hopes that the loan and his increased earnings will allow him to hire an employee to help manage the stall.

loans.use: Help fund trips to Los Angeles to increase inventory of his flea market business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Mrs. Lilia M., 48 years of age, is married and is a resident of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is married to Manolo M., a carpenter, and is blessed with three children who all are now of school age. To help her husband in supporting their family, Lilia decided to engage in business. She has a sari-sari (variety) store located near the government elementary school of her village. For six years, already, she has been able to manage her business and now she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500 a month, which is so helpful to her family income. Lilia joined the cooperative in 2007. As an active member of the PDP-LP Program (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) of Paglaum MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she was able to obtain multiple loan amounts. Her previous loan was P14,900. This time, Lilia is requesting P20,000 as her 7th loan to add to the capital of her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions of her family, to meet their basic needs, and for the education of her children for their better future. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Saroun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroun K. and her husband, Mr. Thorn Chan, have been married since 1998. They live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Saroun and her husband have been selling vegetables for more than five years. They buy them from the Dem Kor market, in Phnom Penh, for resale at the Kor Ky market near their village. 

The couple hopes to expand their business, but they do not have enough capital, and so Saroun is requesting a loan of $600. 
Saroun's husband is in the photo, as Saroun was unavailable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa T. H. was born in 1975. She is married with two young children (a daughter and a son). She is a worker in a factory near their house. Her husband is a mechanic. They have a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND. Mrs Hoa has participated with Kiva partner SEDA since 2009 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to buy a new sewing machine and cloths to make gloves.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and cloth.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin is 35 years old and is an internally displaced person from Fuzuli city. Currently he lives in the Fuzuli region, an area still under Azerbaijan's jurisdiction. He is married and has a 17-year-old son.

For the past five years, Ramin has worked as a delivery man, transporting grains and barley from farms to the shops. He is now teaching his son how to drive so that he can help him with the business.

Ramin is seeking a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his delivery truck. He hopes that this will help his business by making his deliveries more reliable. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his delivery truck

loans.name: Ida

texts.fr: H. Ida est née en 1948 et est mariée à ADIDO Gaspard, un marchand. Le couple a dix enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent maintenant à leur charge. Ida vit avec son mari au quartier Koutongbé à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ida assure avec son mari les différentes charges du foyer. Ida n'a pas fréqenté l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Ida prépare de la nourriture (riz, haricot) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Parallèlement, Ida vend divers autres produits (biscuits, farine de manioc, lait, etc.). Ida s'approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Ida exerce cette activité depuis une trentaine d'année. Ida a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Actuellement, Ida désire agrandir son étalage et augmenter la quantité de repas préparé, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de se faire plus de profits. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Ida H. was born in 1948 and is married to Gaspard ADIDO, a merchant. The couple has ten children; all the children have attended school and two are still in their care. Ida lives with her husband in the Koutongbé neighborhood of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. Together with her husband, Ida provides for the various needs of the household. Ida did not attend school. To provide for her needs and those of her children, Ida prepares food (rice, beans) that she sells from her home. At the same time, Ida sells various other products (biscuits, manioc flour, milk etc.) Ida gets her supplies at the Ouando market at Porto-Novo. She has engaged in this business for about thirty years. Ida has already obtained one loan from ALIDé and repaid it satisfactorily. Now, Ida wants to expand her display of goods and improve the quality of her prepared meals, with a view to better satisfy her customers and to make a greater profit. This is what led her to request another loan.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino B. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Severino is married and has 13 school-aged children. To make a living, Severino operates a family member's business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating bus transport services. Severino has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Severino joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Severino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. Severino is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for registration, franchise and licenses. This loan will be the tenth loan taken out by Severino from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for registration, franchise and licenses.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
B. Juliet is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala east region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Juliet has a tailoring business, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Juliet is requesting a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more fabric to be used for sewing.  Juliet plans to use the loan in order to make more clothes to sell. She wants to generate a good amount of profit in order to help her save for the future.  She hopes to go back to school for her studies and to go on to university.


Note to lenders: BRAC Uganda has recently begun posting a new loan product to Kiva which funds young entrepreneurs in BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  This Kiva borrower is receiving a new ELA loan. The ELA program first provides disadvantaged adolescents, usually girls who are out of school, with livelihood training and financial literacy skills.  Afterward, ELA participants can receive micro-finance loans to expand their small businesses.  These loans offer adolescents a unique chance to access finance at a young age and improve their prospects for the future, and target a segment of the population not typically served by traditional micro-finance.  Kiva is privileged to partner with BRAC Uganda in posting these new loans, and give Kiva lenders the opportunity to fund deserving young entrepreneurs and support a promising new sector in micro-finance.

loans.use: to buy more fabric for sewing

loans.name: Simar

texts.en: Simar Martinal is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant. Simar is 42 years old and is married, with a husband who is a business man. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo A. is from the city of Ramos Village, Sta.Isabel, Dipolog City. He is 64 years old. Romeo is single. To make a living, Romeo owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing mechanical services to local community members. Romeo has been engaged in his business for over 41 years and earns approximately PHP 20,000 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Romeo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 20,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase equipment to improve the business. Romeo is requesting a new loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This loan will be the 22nd loan taken out by Romeo from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to improve the business.

location.town: Dipolog-Sta.Isabel, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and has four children. She has no educational background. Aba sells 'kenkey' (a staple made of fermented corn dough) and fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Aba uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Aba will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: purchase more bags of maize to prepare 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es: El Sr. Oscar Danilo G. A.  el se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa nueva el vende de casa en casa, el tiene once años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente, tiene un  niño en edad escolar. Ha tenido  nueve créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno  los ha realizado para la compra de mercadería para su negocio y así ampliarlo en mercadería,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su negocio y su   condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Danilo G. A. sells new clothes door to door.  He has been doing this for 11 years.  He is married and has a school age child.

He has had nine loans from Ceprodel.  He used each one to buy merchandise for his business.  That is the way that he increased his merchandise.  The loans from Ceprodel have been extremely beneficial to him.  That is how he has improved his business and the living conditions for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses, and comforters

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa T., age 42, makes snacks and delicacies like rice cakes, which she sells in the local community. Andresa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have four grown children and live in the village of Old Kibawe, Bukidnon. 

Earlier this year, Andresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Andresa is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her prepared food items for sale

loans.name: Napisa

texts.en:
Napisa J. is 55 years old, single, and has three children. She was born into a low-income family of farmers and helped her parents in the household: she milked cows, pastured the cattle, and looked after her younger siblings. When Napisa was 15, she was given in marriage in accordance with antiquated nomadic traditions which fortunately quite rarely exist in present times. However, she was able to finish school and with an infant at her side, entered Trade College. 

The salary of her husband, who was a policeman, was too low and didn’t meet the essential needs of the growing family. In order to find an additional means of subsistence, Napisa began to work as a sales assistant. Later, she made it a career and took on the position of head of the local department store. 

This experience became the basis for Napisa’s own business in reselling goods, which she started in 2008. Together with her elder daughter, she opened a small grocery store and managed to develop it. Now Napisa is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by expanding her range of products. With the revenue from this investment, Napisa plans to open one more sales point at the market for her daughter.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods

loans.name: Pes

texts.en: Pes P. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in the Takeo province. To earn a living, she sells bananas in the local market and is able to make about US$6 of profit a day. She has been selling bananas since 2004, and her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. Her husband earns US$3.50 each day. Three of her children are in school. Pes P. really wants her children attend the university if she can support them. Currently, she is asking for a loan of $1,200 to create a new investment. She wants to buy a store, so she can sell clothes at the market. This will allow her to make more profit.

loans.use: To sell clothes.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe A. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 33 years old. Ma. Fe is married and has 4 school-age children. To make a living, Ma. Fe owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She also buys and sells bananas & firewood. Ma. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ma. Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ma. Fe from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie B. is from the village of Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old. Elvie is married and has school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elvie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Khen

texts.en: Khen N., 37, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 4 on electricity supply, and USD 65 on other necessary expenses every month. N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es: María Esperanza P. C. de 52 años de edad, reside en Santa Anita, en el departamento de San Salvador, en donde vive únicamente junto a su padre de avanzada edad. María es una señora muy trabajadora, quien posee una venta de mariscos en el mercado de San Jacinto, en el mismo departamento. María posee muchos clientes, gracias a los cuales posee un negocio bastante estable, lo que es muy bueno para ella ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para vivir. María solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor variedad de mariscos, los cuales son muy bien vendidos, de esta manera María desea hacer crecer su negocio y así mismo contar con una vida estable junto a sus padres.
texts.en:
María Esperanza P. C. is 52 years old.  She lives in Santa Ana, in San Salvador department, together with her elderly father.

María is a very hard-working lady who owns a seafood stall in San Jacinto market, in the same department.  María has a lot of customers, thanks to whom she has a very stable business.  This is very good for her since hers is the only source of income on which she has to live.  María is requesting a loan so that she has the money she needs to buy a bigger variety of seafood, which sell well.  In this way, María would like to grow her business and also be able to live a stable life together with her parents.

loans.use: To buy seafood to sell

location.town: Santa Anita, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Juana Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Alicia D. es una señora actualmente casada con una edad  de 56 años honrada, responsable y emprendedora que trabaja día a día en su pulpería que mantiene desde hace 4 años. Su hijo y su nuera le apoyan en su negocio.
Su deseo como una mujer emprendedora es obtener un crédito que le permita incrementar los productos que ofrece en su Pulpería y así crecer como microempresa.
texts.en:
Juana Alicia D. is married.  She is 56 years old, honest, responsible, and hard-working.  She works day to day in her store, which she has maintained for four years.  Her son and daughter-in-law help her in her business.

As an enterprising woman, her wish is to get a loan, which will allow her to increase the products that she sells in her store.  That way she will grow as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: Basic grains

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old.  She is a resident of Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 26 years. She is the mother of 2 daughters, both are studying in a local school. 

Mariam's husband operates a grocery store in the community. He sells daily use items such as cooking oil, rice, sugar and spices, etc. at cheap rates.  Mariam supports her husband financially by doing sewing work.  She takes orders from her neighboring clients and completes them on time to earn income.   

Mariam's husband wants to add more groceries to his store to increase his business.  For this purpose, Mariam has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. A larger stock of groceries will help her husband offer more range of products to his clients and make more sales.  She is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business after this loan investment, and as a result her family will be able to enjoy better facilities in life. 

Mariam is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 6th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and had never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy larger stock of groceries for grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, and has been a carpenter for the last four years. He used to work for others but now he has his own workshop. His hardship is lack of enough manpower, and his vision is business expansion and educating his children. Sem needs the loan to buy lumber for his carpentry work.

loans.use: To buy lumber for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Westfall Humberto

texts.es:
Westfall, de 33 años de edad, nació en Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Estelí, es casado, tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, estudio administración de empresa, pero dedica a las labores de siembra de hortalizas.
Inicio con esta actividad hace 7 años cuando tenia 25 años de edad comenzó sembrando una manzana de tomate lo hizo a medias financiado con fondos propios y un préstamo. Antes era profesor de ingles  y deportes para niños de primaria, pero después dedico de lleno a la siembra, también cultivo chiltoma. Hoy en día tiene 5 manzanas de tierra propias tiene 3 trabajadores que le ayudan. En este negocio cuenta con la ayuda de su papa y hermano. Además tiene una venta de insumos agrícolas pequeña no esta muy surtida pero le ayuda a mantenerse, distribuye sus productos en Sebaco y la ciudad de Estelí.
Solicito el crédito para la compra de abonos solubles que se utilizan en la siembra de tomates. Con esta inversión espera sacar 2,500 cajillas de tomates que le generaran buenas ganancias, satisfacer la demanda de sus compradores ya que el exporta su producto a Managua, Salvador, Honduras, mejorar el rendimiento de sus cultivos. 
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poder comprar una camioneta de trabajo, darle mejor mantenimiento a su tractor y como meta comprar otra manzana de tierra para ampliar su cultivo, trabajando de manera tecnificada con un mejor sistema de riego.
texts.en:
Westfall is 33 years old, married, and has a 2 year-old son.  He was born in Pueblo Nuevo, in Estelí municipality.  Westfall studied business administration but he works growing vegetables.  He started his business 7 years ago when he was 25, at first growing tomatoes over one 'manzana' (just over 1.5 acres) of land.  Half of the money he used for this was his own and the rest was from a loan.  Westfall used to be an elementary school English and gym teacher but then he started growing crops full time.  He also grows sweet peppers.

These days, Westfall owns 5 'manzanas' (just over 8 acres) of land and has 3 workers who help him.  His dad and brother also help him in his business.  In addition, he has a small sales location where he sells agricultural supplies.  It isn't very well stocked but it helps him to support himself.  He distributes his products in Sebaco and the city of Estelí. 

Westfall requested this loan to buy soluble manure which he will use on his tomato crop.  With this investment, he hopes to harvest 2,500 small crates of tomatoes which will make him good profits and satisfy the demand of his buyers (he exports his produce to Managua, Salvador and Honduras).  He also hopes to improve his yield.
