Some of Westfall's future plans are to buy a work truck, to do better maintenance work on his tractor and to buy another 'manzana' of land so that he can expand his crop.  He also plans to make use of technology and use a better irrigation system.

loans.use: to buy soluble manure for his tomato crop

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is married. She has two children. One of the children is a driver, who gets a low salary. The other child is studying in local public school. 
She is a Khmer noodle and a porridge seller in the local village where she earns some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Hieng, is a sand seller and a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice and the rest of the rice the family uses. 
In the rice field, it is time to plow, but Mrs. Neang's family does not have enough oxen to plow. So Mrs. Neang is seeking a loan to buy oxen to plow the field.

loans.use: To buy an ox

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lida; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras, ella vende verduras como tomates, cebollas, zanahorias, pepinos entre otras verduras, la socia vende las verduras en forma independiente llevando a lugares como huaypetu que queda en la selva de la ciudad de Cusco, la socia por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This client, Mrs Lida, is a member of the communal bank "Los Angeles", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco. She is 40 years old and has one child. She alternatives her daily activities with sales of vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, carrots and peppers. She sells these vegetables on her own, traveling to areas such as Huaypetu in the tropical region near the city of Cusco. She uses the revenues from this business to provide for her child, and is hoping to increase her volume of sales through this loan. She is looking forward to receiving this loan and promises to adhere to the loan repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras al por mayor.

loans.name: Magda Ivania

texts.es: Magda madre soltera, anteriormente trabajaba para el minsa recibe pensión siendo muy poco para mantener su familia. Tiene su propio negocio de manualidades desde hace un tiempo inicio siendo su fuente de recurso económico. Mujer emprendedora, trabajadora ha sabido salir adelante con sus propios esfuerzos. Se le ha presentado dificultades que en momentos que disminuye los trabajos. Su proyecto es dejar un mejor bienestar a su familia. El préstamo que solicitad es para invertirlo en materia prima como: lanas, ajugas, cinta mantequillas entre otros materiales que requiere para elaborar una variedad de trabajos en estos días de celebraciones. Permitiéndole obtener ganancias y ser utilizadas en su negocio.
texts.en: Magda is a single mother. Previously she worked for the Ministry of Health. The pension she receives is very little to support a family.  For awhile now, she has had her own handicrafts business, as her source of income. An entrepreneurial and hard-working woman, she has known how to get ahead by her own effort.  Difficulties have presented themselves that at times reduce the craft works. Her project is to leave her family with greater wellbeing. The requested loan is for investing in raw materials such as: wool, needles and ribbon among other materials required to make a variety of craft works in these days of celebrations, allowing her to make a profit using them in her business.

loans.use: To buy craft materials.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William  tiene 36 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y alegre que vive en el caserío Maravillas (comunidad rural en vías de desarrollo) ubicado en el distrito de Mochumi- Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla William  es el servicio de transporte público. Desde hace 10 años él cuenta con una mototaxi (moto que tiene una cabina, en la parte posterior, donde se pueden transportar pasajeros) desde la cual realiza su labor.

William cuenta con clientela fija en la zona, debido al buen humor que este contagia la competencia que tiene no le  afecta en nada. 

William solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que destinará en la compra de un motor para mejorar el funcionamiento de su unidad vehicular. Esto le permitirá a William seguir haciendo sus recorridos sin mayores problemas y por ende seguir obteniendo ganancias.

William ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad.
texts.en:
William is 36 years old and is a happy hard working man who lives in the community of Maravillas ( a rural community in the process of development), a district of Mochumi-Lambayeque.

William works in the public transport sector and for more than 10 years he has been relying on a motortaxi ( motorcycle with a cabin in rear that allows passenjer transport), to work.  William can count on reliable clientele in the area due to his contagious sense of humor. The competition he has does not worry him at all.  William is soliciting a loan from  Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles ($550 USD) which would be used towards the puchase of a motor to improve the working condition of his vehicle.  This will help William continue his routes without major problems and therefore continue gaining an income.

William has previously worked with our entity.

loans.use: to purchase a motor

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona madre soltera con sus hijos ha salido adelante, mujer emprendedora, tiene su propio negocio de venta de ferretería, la tiene surtida y desde hace un tiempo tiene el negocio iniciándolo con microcréditos de parte de los proveedores. Proyecto mejorar su nivel de vida, una mejor infraestructura de su vivienda. 
Con el préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, láminas de zinc, golosa, perlines entre otros materiales para el cambio del techo de la casa. Obteniendo protección y seguridad.
texts.en:
Petrona is a single mother, who has gotten ahead with her children.  She is an enterprising woman who has her own business selling hardware.  Her business is stocked.  She has been using the microloans from the lenders to get her business going.  She plans to improve her standard living by improving the infrastructure of her house.

She will use the loan to buy construction materials like cement, zinc metal sheeting, bolts, crossbeams, and other materials to change the roof of her house.  This will provide protection and security.

loans.use: to buy materials to change the roof of the house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy bulb holders to sell

loans.name: Santos Valentin

texts.es: Santos, un productor 47 años, de la zona de San Antonio comarca del munipicio de Pueblo Nuevo - Estelí, de origen muy humilde, casado y con cinco hijos, dedicado a la agricultura desde muy corta edad, entre otras actividades se dedica también a la siembra de tabaco, lo cual solicitó su crédito para poder pagar el alquiler de las tierras donde tiene sembrado el tabaco, él nos cuenta que tiene un contrato con una importante empresa la cual es la que le compra el producto y le genera buenas ganancias. Manifiesta que no ha sido fácil conseguir sus objetivos ya que tuvo que dejar sus estudios en el tercer año de secundaria para poder trabajar la tierra y sufragar los gastos de su hogar. En un futuro desea comprar una motocicleta, una pequeña casa para su familia y seguir trabajando en la siembra de tabaco y porque no comprar un terreno donde pueda sembrar su tabaco sin incurrir en gastos de alquiler de terreno.
texts.en:
Santos, a 47 year old tobacco producer, lives in the San Antonio zone, a region in the Pueblo Nuevo – Estelí municipality.  He comes from very humble beginnings.  He is married and has five children.

He has been a farmer from a very early age.  Among other business activities, he also devotes himself to growing tobacco.  

He requested a loan in order to pay the rent on some land where he grows tobacco.  He tells us that he has a contract with an important company.  This company buys his product, which generates good income for him.  He states that it has not been easy to reach his objectives.  He had to leave his studies in the third year of high school in order to be able to work the land and pay for the household expenses.

In the future he wishes to buy a motorcycle, to buy a small house for his family, to continue working at growing tobacco, and, why not, buy land where he can plant tobacco without incurring the cost of renting the land.

loans.use: to rent land to grow tobacco.

loans.name: Novily

texts.en:
Novily, 32, is an entrepreneur from the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. She has a rice farming business, a fish pond and a sari-sari store. Novily hires farmers to help till her land. She works hard to manage her business and sustain her family.

Novily requested a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies. She hopes to gain more knowledge in managing her businesses well.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alex Renieris

texts.en: Alex lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where he makes a living by selling corn. He is the father of three children and has run his small business for the last seven years. Alex is requesting a loan of 15,000 HNL to purchase a bulk supply of corn. In his free time, Alex raises chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk supply of corn.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells children’s undergarments in Abura as a peddler.  The tray in the picture above has some of the underwear items displayed. Adjoa has attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Adjoa has been selling underwear for 9 years. She assists her partner in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more underwear to sell.

loans.use: buy underwear to resell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en:
Remy is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children, aged 7 and 5. She is a farmer who tills land in the town of Santo Niño, South Cotabato. Remy particularly plants rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. Her family mainly depends on the farm.

She has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. Remy hopes to have a stable business that will sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es: Blanca Margarita de 36 años de edad, reside en casa propia en zona de muchas carencias, junto a ella sus 4 hijas y su madre de 60 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado establecer como madre soltera, una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia. Blanca es una mujer emprendedora llena de metas y sueños. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y no pierde las esperanzas de que algún día verá a sus queridas hijas convertidas en grandes profesionales. Su familia es la que la impulsa a seguir adelante y trabajar duramente para darles lo necesario. Últimamente ha estado pensando mucho en la manera de hacer crecer su negocio ya que este es su principal fuente de ingresos y piensa seguir manteniéndolo activo y recibiendo los frutos que hasta el momento ha recibido. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, pan dulce, huevos, golosinas, etc. Para surtir su negocio con el fin de atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel de ventas e ingresos de tal manera que su calidad de vida y la de su familia se vea mejorada.
texts.en:
Blanca is 36 years old, lives in her own house in an area of many shortages, with her four daughters and her mother who is 60 years old. She sells staples. Thanks to her hard work as a single mother, she has established a small convenience store in her home. 

Blanca is an enterprising woman, full of goals and dreams. For her, what is most important is her family and she has not lost her dream that one day she will see her beloved daughters become important professionals. She keeps going and works hard for her family to give them what is necessary.

Lately she has been thinking a lot about how to expand her business as it is her main source of income and she is thinking of keeping it open and receiving the income that it has provided up until now.

This is the reason for which she is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL. She wants to buy beans, rice, sugar, oil, pastries, eggs, candy, etc. She wants to supply her store in order to attract more customers in order to increase sales and earnings so that the quality of life for her and her family will look better.

loans.use: to buy products for her store such as: beans, rice, sugar, oil, pastries, eggs, candy, etc

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is from the village of Cabisera 27. She is 52 years old and married with eight school-age children. Carmelita raises pigs to fatten and sell. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase piglets to raise and sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her  business

loans.name: Rolando Elias

texts.es:
Rolando, se dedica a vender trapeadores (de toalla y de tela) el mismo los elabora junto con su esposa, tambien vende CD Y DVD, ya tiene siete años de hacer este oficio,  todos los días salen a venderlos en los pueblos cercanos de lunes a domingo solo que van a cada pueblo el día de comercio.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar materiales: toalla, tela para elaborar trapeadores, CD Y DVD, teniendo más surtido el negocio y venderlos con más facilidad, y de esa manera podrá obtener más ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.
El propósito de Rolando es tener un negocio en un puesto estable y siempre mantener la elaboración de trapeadores, de esa forma la familia mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rolando sells mops (terry-cloth and clothe), and he makes these together with his wife. He also sells CDs and DVDs and has been doing this for seven years. They go to the surrounding villages to sell them every day, from Monday to Sunday, but they only go to each village on market day. 

He needs the loan to buy materials: cloth and terry-cloth to make mops, CDs and DVDs. By having more stock in the business and selling it more easily he will be able to get more income to support his family. 

Rolando’s goal is to have a business in a stall and to keep on making mops. In this way the family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy terry-cloth and cloth to make mops.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the inventory of his business by buying 20 crates of beverages

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 48-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Mai has a childcare business and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase new toys and beds for the children.

Mai is looking to expand her childcare business by moving it away from her home.

loans.use: to purchase  new toys and beds for her childcare business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, está iniciando nuevamente la siembra de granos básicos, por esta razón solicita nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de insumos como abono y herbicidas, para beneficiar la milpa; El préstamo anterior le ayudo para sacar una buena cosecha, aumentando la producción de granos básicos.
Él ha mejorado sus funciones, además su familia está más estable, ya que con la venta de granos básico se ha logrado reponer y tener una condición más solvente.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is once again starting his cultivation of staple grains. Therefore, he is again asking for a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides to improve his plot. Wilfredo’s previous loan helped him increase his production and get a good yield. 

He has improved his practices and his family is more stable. Thanks to the sale of staple grains, they have been able to recover and establish a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Blanca Olivia

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora que quiere brindarle a su familia las mejores condiciones. Ella es jubilada pues recibe cierta cantidad de dinero de parte del gobierno, por medio de esto ha podido mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de cemento, bloques, arena, madera entre otros. Sus aspiraciones son de mejorar su vivienda pues debido a la temporada de lluvias ha sido difícil pues el agua se filtra es por eso que quiere realizar el crédito.
texts.en: Blanca is a very responsible and hard-working woman who would like to provide her family with better living conditions.  She is retired and receives a certain amount of money from the government.  With this money, she has been able to improve her household income.  Blanca is requesting this loan to buy cement, blocks, sand, wood and other building supplies.  Her aspiration is to improve her home because, during the rainy season, life is difficult as the water seeps into her house.  For this reason, she would like to take a loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, blocks, sand, wood and other building supplies

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San is a 56-year-old mother, who is married and has six children. Her oldest son works as a car driver for a fee, while some of her other children work at the rice field and are still in school. She started farming on her rice field 30 years ago to support her big family. 

San has been with VisionFund since 2010 and successfully paid back her previous loan with VisionFund. After the first loan cycle with VisionFund, she can afford to buy some basic household necessities for her family. San leads a group of two female members. She is now requesting another loan. She wants to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field. 

She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it at a good price which will enable her to earn more income to build up some basic household assets and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her rice field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de  16 y 10 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.
 
Ella es en una gran esposa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar trabaja en una fábrica en la vía a Manta. Realiza el crédito para el esposo el cual tiene una lancha con la cual se dedica a la pesca, él se desplaza en su lancha a alta mar en las noches y no regresa sino hasta el otro día con el producto de la pesca para luego entregar el pescado  a los comerciantes que llegan hasta este lugar y ellos  llevan a distintas ciudades para ser comercializados. El también compra en Guayaquil materiales de pesca para vender a sus compañeros y con esto él se gana un dinero extra.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, anzuelos, grapas y otros materiales para la pesca además de combustibles para la lancha. Lleva 9 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos siempre le han ayudado.
 
Su sueño es comprar un barco más grande para que su esposo.

En la foto está la socia con su hijo, el niño de atraz de ella es hijo de otra socia.
texts.en:
The village bank Proyecto 2003 meets twice a month in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This is a place known for the beautiful beaches that bathe the shoreline of this lovely location. Most of the people who live here are very hardworking and make their living from the sea. 

Here we met Rosa, 37, who is married and has two children, ages 16 and 10, both of whom are in school. Her husband is a fisherman.

She is a great wife because she helps her husband with their household expenses by working in a factory on the highway to Manta. This loan will be for her husband, who has a boat that he uses to fish. He goes out on the high seas at night and doesn't return until the next day with the fish which he later sells to the merchants that carry them off to different cities to be sold. He also buys fishing materials in Guayaquil which he sells to his fellow fishermen in order to earn a little extra money. 

This loan will be used to buy nets, ropes, hooks, bait holders and other materials including gas for the boat. She has been in the village bank for 9 years and lives it because the loans have always helped her. Her dream is to buy a bigger boat for her husband. 

In this picture, Rosa is with her son, and the child behind her belongs to a different member of the group.

loans.use: to buy nets, ropes, hooks, bait holder, gas and other materials for fishing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Isack

texts.en:
Isack lives in Kitunda area in Dar es Salaam.He is married and has five children.Two in primary school and another two in secondary school.
Isack keeps layers and broilers nearby his residence.He is in a plan of adding the flock of chickens from 300 he usually kept to 500.Isack has to employ one person in his business to take charge of the increased stock. The expansion strategy need some additional funding as more chicks are to be added and a stock of poultry  feed.The expansion  plan will enable Isack pay for school fees for his secondary school children and increase income for his family. To implement his growth plan he need additional capital of  USD 550.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Gerishom

texts.en: I am a 32-year-old father of 4.  I take care of 3 other children. My life will improve because I will be able to pay the school fees for my brother in secondary school.

loans.use: Expand my business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos “Chamo” V. has a farm where he grows rice, hay and cattle. He lives with his wife, Cecilia, and his four children. His oldest son works with him on the farm to grow their products, while the other three still go to school. He is a native of Salitre and has been raised in agriculture his entire life. He also has a small butcher shop in the small town of Salitre. He hopes that with this loan he will be able to invest in feed for his cattle and possibly buy some more steers. With the profits he will continue to educate his kids and feed his family.

He is the latest addition to one of the new Communal Banks in the Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the 10 de enero Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Salitre named 10 de enero. They will use the microloans to prepare the lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the 10 de enero Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but is imperative for the communities Mifex works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Loan Use and Repayment

The loans in this sector will be used to create water deposits that will prevent flooding in the case of heavy rains or store water in case of droughts. They will also be used to treat the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase fertilizer. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 5 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the sixth and final month.

Below is more information about Salitre compiled by the staff at Mifex when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Salitre

Salitre is a rural sector in the Province of Guayas known as the capital of Montuvios (montuvio is a cowboy) with approximately 30,000 inhabitants. The main economic activities are herding and agriculture which make up about 80% of the economy. The infrastructure and basic services are poor, especially the roads and water services.

Salitre is highly dedicated to farming rice and cattle ranching. Rice is a crop that yields about every four months. In order to farm rice, the environment must be very humid and there must be a high volume of water. The lack of a structured water system makes it difficult for the small farmers to be highly productive. The best months for cultivating rice are early in the year when it is the rainy season in the coast of Ecuador.

Salitre is a national tourist attraction as many Ecuadorians visit the fresh water Salitre River. There are cottages, small restaurants and water attractions that people come to enjoy.

Access to Credit

There are not many financial institutions that provides services to the productive sector of the local economy. The primary access to credit comes from loan sharks who charge extremely high interest rates averaging around 20% a month. The locals are also exploited by the intermediaries that buy their products in order to commercialize them in the city and to export abroad. These intermediaries buy crops in advance at very low prices, finance soil at extremely high prices and often provide emergency loans for even higher interest rates than the loan sharks.

Risks

Salitre is a dangerous sector considering it is in the rural area. There is a high incidence of robbery of cattle that results in many of the ranch owners owning weapons to protect their property. Because the police are not present in these areas, farmers and ranchers must apply their own laws and provide their own security. In some instances they have formed their own cooperatives and associations to have a community crime prevention effort.

Salitre is in the lowlands of Ecuador and is vulnerable to flooding in the rainy season. In the event of a heavy rainy season, often at its worse when El Niño occurs, the farmers of rice lose many of their crops. All this is due to a lack of infrastructure in the area.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Alia

texts.en: Alia lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a widow and she is educated. She lives with her children and she is the only support of her family. She is a tailor. She wants to take a group loan to buy sewing machines and also to change the design of her shop to attract more clients and help her family. She is happy that she can support her family.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María Elena L. is married and the mother of three children. She tends to a events location owned by her family. She has a store there, where she sells a variety of gifts and presents appropriate to the types of events, parties, and celebrations that are held at the location.

Parallel to that business, María also makes and sells lejia (an alkali made from ashes, flour, and some fruits, that is used in chewing coca leaves) at wholesale. This business is making enough money to subsist.

María needs money to be able to increase her production of lejia. She will buy ingredients and raw materials at wholesale prices, and thereby ensure her income and the wellbeing of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María Elena L., casada y madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la atención de un local de fiestas perteneciente a su familia, en ese recinto ella posee un ambiente donde vende una variedad de regalos y presentes adecuados para el tipo de eventos, fiestas y celebraciones que se realizan en ese local. Paralelamente a esta actividad, María se dedica a la fabricación y venta de lejía (preparado a base de ceniza, azúcar, harina y algunas frutas para acompañar la masticación de la hoja de coca) al por mayor, negocio que está generando los ingresos suficientes para poder subsistir. Actualmente María necesita de dinero para poder incrementar la producción de Lejía, comprando insumos y materia prima al por mayor, de esta manera asegurar sus ingresos y el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and raw materials used to make lejia at wholesale prices

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
After working a long time as a taxi driver, Alejandro became seriously ill with spine problems, disabling him from returning to work. His wife, who worked selling secondhand clothing in small quantities, got him interested. Alejandro decided to help wife develop this business and both poured in their efforts, initially working weekends only. Today they have a store that is opened everyday of the week.

They need to buy more clothes that they can sell during the winter season and electrical apparatus so they can increase profits. They are seeking a loan of $1125, which they will pay in installments over 6 months. Your support will help the H. Family make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Después de dedicar largo tiempo como chofer de camiones, se enfermó gravemente de la columna dejándolo inhabilitado para regresar a este trabajo. Su esposa como parte de ayuda en el hogar se dedicaba a vender en pocas cantidades, ropa de segunda, lo que le interesó a Alejandro y decidió ayudarle a su esposa para crecer el negocio y así con mucho esfuerzo comenzaron con los fines de semana y hoy tienen un local que está abierto toda la semana.

Por la temporada invernal, necesitan comprar más ropa que puedan vender en esta temporada y aparatos electrónicos para poder obtener mayores ganancias en el negocio. Están solicitando un crédito por US $1125 para poder pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda la familia H. podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sam Ang married in 1990 and has one son and three daughters. She has been in the business of purchasing bananas on contract and reselling them at the market since 2004. She is currently purchasing bananas from villagers who are living nearby, and reselling them at a market in Phnom Penh. Her husband, Mr. Vann Sovin, is a security guard at Kean Svay market.

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase bananas on contract from villagers and resell them at the market in Phnom Penh city.

loans.use: Purchasing bananas on contract and reselling at the market

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira has always maintained a close relationship with her community, Maco, the place in which she was born and grew up. Unfortunately, upon forming a family, she saw the great responsibility that she faced. Motivated by her husband's energy and dreams of getting ahead, she had to abandon her beloved home to settle down in a place with better possibilities of progress, with the hope of offering a better quality of life to their beloved children. Now in an area far away from her community, they grow potatoes and corn on large expanses of land, which they transport to the city of Tarma to sell wholsale. Elvira hopes to increase her economic income by opening a small grocery store in her home to meet certain unsatisfied needs. With the hope of obtaining this loan, she extends this petition to you.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elvira, siempre ha mantenido una estrecha relación con su comunidad, Maco, lugar en el que nació y creció. Desafortunadamente al conformar su familia observó la gran responsabilidad que tenía que enfrentar y animada por el ímpetu y deseos de su superación de su querido esposo tuvo que abandonar su querida tierra para instalarse en un lugar con mayores posibilidades de progreso con el objetivo de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos.Aún en las tierras de su alejada comunidad cultivan papa y maíz en grandes extensiones de cultivo para transportarlos hasta la ciudad de tarma y comercializarlos al por mayor.Elvira, desea acrecentar sus ingresos económicos aperturando una pequeña bodega en su domicilio para apaciguar de alguna manera ciertas necesidades insatisfechas.Con el deseo de obtener la cantidad que solicita les extiende su petición.

loans.use: To start a small grocery store to increase the economic income of her home.

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
Reparing bicycles is a very profitable business in Chinandega as this is the mode of transport most commonly used in the village. Mr.Justino L. picked this line of business two years ago. He began with a small investment of 7000 córdobas which he used to refurbish a small shop in the outskirts of Bisne market.

Currently Mr.Justino needs to increase the amount of stock held in spare parts since he has started selling these items as well. In the past 7 months Mr.L. has received 3 microloans from CEPRODEL which have been invested in purchasing spare parts.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Spare parts purchase

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu has been a member of the SMT program for 3 years. With her previous small loans, she expanded her business selling food items. During this period, Isatu developed a good relationship with SMT and built her business capacity. She now feels comfortable and able to expand her business.

Isatu is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 350. Isatu now has the confidence and feels she has the experience to manage a larger loan and help her business get off the ground.

loans.use: to expand her little food stall

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 34 years old and the father of three children. He lives with his family in south Lebanon, in the town of Nabatieh. He makes a living repairing cars, and has applied for a loan to buy equipment to repair car wheels.

loans.use: to buy equipment to repair car wheels

loans.name: Mary Nansamba's Group

texts.en:
Mary is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is 38 and married with 4 children. They are 10, 12, 8, and 3, and 3 of them are in school. The area she lives and works in is a slum, and it is prone to floods in the rainy season. The community is semi urban.

Mary hires a vehicle onto which she loads the charcoal that is bought from the rural areas and distributes it in the neighborhood wholesale. She sells some of it retail.

Her challenges are the high transport costs, high rent charges, and working in the open, where her charcoal gets wet and she experiences the hazards of the weather.

Her achievements include improved standards of living and being able to pay school dues and rent charges.

She plans to construct a semi-permanent stall for her business and eventually move out of the low-lying area that is vulnerable to flooding.

Mary has paid back more than 5 loans.

loans.use: She plans to construct a semi-permanent stall for her business and eventually move out of the low-lying area.

loans.name: Gam D 2028-3 Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Esther T.. She sells vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Esther is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children, ages 25 and 30, who go to school. Each week, Esther makes approximately 100 sudanese pounds in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Esther is joined in her small group by Veronica N., Sunday W., Hellen J., and Regina M.. Veronica N. sells bread and charcaol and wants to build a house to rent to others. Sunday W. sells charcaol and wants a loan to open a hotel. Hellen J. sells beans and oil and wants to build a big shop for selling oil. Regina M. sells charcoal and beans and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Endurance

texts.en:
Endurance I. sells over-the-counter drugs to local villagers. She studied for three years before opening her business in 2006. Endurance has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years.

She is 26-years-old and is married with two children. She lives in shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting a loan to buy more drugs and provisions for maximum business growth and for profit maximization.

loans.use: To buy more over-the-counter drugs

loans.name: Zainab's Muhajirina Group

texts.en:
Zainab is 30 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children aged between 6 and 20. She has been selling clothes and bites (snacks) since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Zainab now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who sell firewood, bites, and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Lutfillo

texts.en:
Lutfillo D. is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children. Lutfillo is an optimistic, hard-working father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Lutfillo has been in agro-business for more than 4 years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city.

Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix up his house and save enough money to pay for his kids’ school. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) which he has committed to repay within 10 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Lutfillo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Shyrley

texts.es:
La Srta. Shyrley M. de 21 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres, es estudiante del segundo año de la carrera de ingeniería comercial.

Shyrley es propietaria de una ropería, anteriormente desempeñaba la función de secretaría de la administración del mercado municipal de la cuidad, con el salario que ella percibía pagaba sus gastos familiares y ahorraba poco a poco, hasta que reunió un capital para empezar con este negocio, aproximadamente en el año 2.005.

Shyrley invertiría este crédito para comprar más mercaderías específicamente en la compra de ropas en general como remeras, jeans, faldas, camisas, etc.

Ella sostiene que sin fuente de trabajo, sin una carrera profesional no podemos progresar, ya que ella en un momento dado fue obligada a dejar sus estudios por que su condición económica no era la más favorable.
texts.en:
Ms. Shyrley M. is 21 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She is a student in the second year of studying civil engineering.

Shyrley is the owner of a clothing store. Previously, she worked as a secretary for the administration of the city's municipal market. With the salary she received, she covered household expenses and saved, a little at a time, until she had enough money to start this business, approximately in 2005.

Shyrley will invest this loan to purchase more merchandise, specifically to buy general clothing such as t-shirts, jeans, skirts, shirts, etc.

She maintains that, without a source of work, without a professional career, we cannot progress, since at one time she had to give up her studies because her economic situation was not the most favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch S. was born in 1960. She now lives in Deum Pour Village in Takeo Province. She has a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

She now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, which badly affects her crop. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to help her field and to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. S.'s husband, Mr. Touch Phen, is a construction worker who can earn $3.50 per day. This is a small income to support his family. They have two children who are all attending the local school.

Mrs. S.'s husband is in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to help make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Hoang Thi N. is 43 years old.  She joined TYM in 2002.  She has five children, three of whom are grown up. Now her family’s main income comes from raising chickens, a grocery shop, and her son's salary.  With sales of 12 million VND ($720 US) per month, her family’s economy is developing.  In the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 20 million VND ($1,175 US) to invest in her grocery shop and buy more chickens for raising.

loans.use: To invest in her grocery shop and buy more chickens for raising.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Cette dame de trente huit (38) ans d’âge  à Adidogomé est une revendeuse de produits de beauté dans le quartier d’Adidogomé un quartier de Lomé non loin de l’ONG « IJD ». Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2003. Elle na jamais obtenu de crédit de chez WAGES, la demande ayant augmentée, elle sollicite ce crédit pour s’approvisionner en mèches, chaussures et sacs de dames.
Elle est mariée avec Monsieur ANANI Prosper et ont ensemble trois (03) enfants. Avec les revenus tirés de ce commerce, elle compte aider sa famille dans les charges quotidiennes du foyer.
texts.en:
This 38 year old woman sales beauty products in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé, not far from the NGO "IJD". She practices this business since 2003. She has never received a loan from WAGES, but the demand has increased so she is requesting a loan to buy extensions, shoes and women's purses.

She is married to Mr. Prosper ANANI and together they have three children. With the income from this business she will help with the family's daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of extensions, shoes, and women's purses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi Nga Group

texts.vi:
Nguyễn Thị Nga sinh năm 1962 ( Mã số: 010107010024 ) hiện đang sống cùng chồng và ba con tại thôn Lực Canh, Xuân Canh. Gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp. Hàng ngày, chị đi chợ, chồng đi làm thuê. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay 4.578.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có:
 Trần Thị Chúc sinh năm 1961( Mã số: 010107010025)  gia đình chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi gà. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 2.500.000 vnđ/tháng. chị than gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
 Đào Thị Lý sinh năm 1964 ( Mã số: 010107010026). Hàng ngày ngoài công việc đồng áng, chị còn đi chợ rau. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 vnđ/tháng. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 3.270.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Nguyễn Thị Q. sinh năm 1959( Mã số: 010107010027)  . Gia đình cũng chủ yếu làm nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó chị còn đi làm thuê. Thu nhập bình quan của gia đình khoảng 3.000.000 vnđ /tháng. Chị tham gia vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 vnđ với mục đích chăn nuôi.
 Lê Thị Thuỷ sinh năm 1966( Mã số: 010107010028 ). Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hàng thu nhập khoảng 200.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị tham gia vay vốn mức vay: 4.142.000 vnđ để đầu tư đi chợ.

loans.use: small retail business

loans.name: Magda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Magda estuvo trabajando en empresas desde hace los dieciocho años, pero nunca estudió por dedicarse a su trabajo, aprendió a usar las máquinas de talleres únicamente observando. En el pasado trabajó en fábricas de ropa, pero a causa de su presión alta tuve que dejar este trabajo y quedarse a trabajar en casa.

Ella es madre soltera, y aunque el padre de su único hijo siempre la ayudó económicamente, Magda tuve que criar sola a su hijo, que ahora ya tiene treinta y dos años, con las ganancias de su negocio solamente. Desde su casa ella se ocupa de la compostura y arreglo de ropa. No obstante, ahora su hijo mayor, que todavía vive con ella, se ocupa de la mayoría de los gastos del hogar y las ganancias de su negocio son exclusivamente para mantenerse ella misma y para reinvertir en su negocio.

Magda ahorra sus ganancias para reembolsarlos. A sus cincuenta y cuatro años desea poder en un futuro comprar una remalladora grande para incrementar su negocio y poder producir ella misma ropa para vender.
texts.en:
Magda has been working in various businesses for the last eighteen years, but she never finished her education because she had to work. She learned how to use machines in the workshops only through observation. In the past, she worked in clothing factories, but because of her high blood pressure she had to leave this work and work from home. She is a single mother, and although the father of her only son has always helped her economically, Magda had to raise her son alone with only the profits of her business. Her son is now thirty two years old. Since returning to work from home, she alters and mends clothing. Nevertheless her son, who still lives with her, is now in charge of the majority of the expenses of the home, and the profits of her business are exclusively to maintain herself and to reinvest in her business. Magda saves her profits to reinvest them. At fifty four years old, she wants to be able to buy a large sewing machine for the purpose of mending, in order to increase her business and to be able to produce her own clothing for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials necessary for her business, including paper, thread, and things for her home.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is selling frozen meat, fish and chicken and vegetables for almost a year.  Using their motorcycle and her husband as the driver, they roam around their village and other nearby communities selling their products.  The couple devote their time in their business to earn a living for their family.  They are both hoping for the development of their business and with this, she came up with the idea to ask for additional business capital.  Luzviminda is asking for a loan amount of PHP7,000 to sell more products and achieve her business plans for the welfare of her family.  She also exhorted that people must be optimistic and should work for their best. She is inspired by her husband who helps her in the business.  

Luzviminda is married to Roy and they have six children: Romeo, 27  years old and working in the city hall of Cauayan; Jhonny, 22 years old, college undergraduate and now helping his father in the farm; Roy, 20 years old and Rodel, 17 years, were both college students; Rommel, 15 years old, a high school student and the youngest is Rey youngest, 11 years old, grade four elementary student.  They lived a harmoniously life in the village of Marabulig 1 Cauayan City.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural products for sale

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame  Assitan Traoré  a 45 ans et vit avec ses huit enfants et  son époux dans une famille monogame à Mamassoni, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’éssaya à beaucoup d’activités génératrices de revenus. Depuis maintenant  sept  ans elle opta  pour le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat  vente  de pagnes wax,  d’ustensiles de cuisine (tasse “Super”, tasse nickel, poêles, etc), des jouets d’enfants, des sacs à main pour femmes,  des montres, etc. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par  sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Vu la situation de sa boutique  au bord d’une des artères les plus fréquentées de la ville et d’accès facile,  son activité marche à merveille et la clientèle est très satisfaite.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de six  ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 8ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 5 pièces de pagnes wax, 3 complets de “Super tasse”, 4 montres, une dizaine de poêle, 5 sacs à main et 10 poupées. Elle s’approvisionne à Dakar (république du Sénégal) et revend dans sa boutique Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Assitan Traoré, age 45, lives with her eight children and husband in a monogamous family in Mamassoni, an outlying district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to go to school due to societal reasons, she tried many kinds of work to earn an income. Seven years ago, she opted for commerce in various goods, buying and selling Wax pagnes (colorful West Africa cloth), kitchen utensils ("Super" basins, nickel basins, frying pans, etc.) She is in high demand by her customers (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her goods. Given that her shop is located on the roadside of one of the busiest arteries in town, and it has easy access, her business is booming. And her customers are very satisfied.

Wanting to do better in satisfying this ever-growing customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over six years ago. After six solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area, she is now on her eighth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

She intends to use this loan to buy five bolts of Wax pagnes, three sets of "Super" basins, four wristwatches, a dozen frying pans, five handbags, and ten dolls. The merchandise is gotten in Dakar (Republic of Senegal) and is resold in her shop in Sikasso.

She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Rebeca Noemi

texts.es: La sra. Rebeca trabajaba anteriormente en un banco de emprendimiento, ahora se individualiza, vive con su esposo en la casa de sus suegros, tiene un pequeño hijito, se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado Rodríguez, un mercado muy concurrido en la ciudad de La Paz, su esposo trabaja como chofer asalariado, apoyando a la esposa en lo gastos de la casa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mas flores para surtir su puesto.
texts.en:
Rebeca previously worked in the village bank. Now, she is on her own. She lives with her husband in her in laws house. She has a small son. She sells flowers in the Rodríguez market, a very busy market in the city of La Paz. Her husband works as a hired driver, helping his wife with the household expenses. The loan will be used to buy more flowers to stock her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers

loans.name: Abdudjabor

texts.ru: Сохибназаров Абдуджабор проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 40 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Работает в бизнесе . Торгует мясом на центральном рынке. Покупает бычков , сам режет и реализует жителям района.Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 10 лет. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот, то есть купить бычка для продажи на мясо.
texts.en:
Abdudjabor S. lives in the Rudaki district. He is 40 years old, married and has four children. He is an entrepreneur and sells meat at the central market. He buys cattle, cuts it himself and sells the meat to the residents of the district. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Abdudjabor plans to obtain this loan to increase turnover by buying an additional bull to sell for meat.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Good Faith Group

texts.en:
This is Hawa O. B., Isatu C. B., Mohamed K. and Dora S.. They named their group Good Faith. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made meaningful contributions towards the development and wellbeing of these entrepreneurs. Previous loans enabled them to expand their businesses, made better sales and increased profit. Consequently, their standards of living have improved. Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are requesting a new loan of SLL 3,000,000 to further strengthen their businesses.

Hawa O. B. (second from left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a businessman and they have two children together, both of whom are still in primary schools. Hawa, together with her husband, sells rice, soda, cements, etc. wholesale. She has had over ten years of experience in business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Romanita

texts.en: "I am a fish vendor. I sell fish in the village, in the streets and in nearby towns just to get an extra income. My only wish is that, someday I will have other businesses that will help me support my family. I’m not married yet but I am trying to save an amount from my business for my future children," says Romanita L., 49 years old and single from Maribojoc, Bohol. Romanita would like to obtain a loan from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell. The loan will surely grow her fish business even more and will help her earn a bigger income. CEVI helps small business to grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Osato

texts.en: Osato O. is 43 years old and is married with ten children. She sells loaves of bread. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mr. Tit U., 60, and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Khan, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, and the other three children have full-time employment. One daughter attends school.

Tit has been a wooden-house builder for over ten years. Mrs. Sophy is a farmer; she grows cucumbers and melons in the farmland near her house. Tit is requesting a loan of $500 to pay fees for his daughter, who is learning hairdressing skills, and to raise the land around his house.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for his daughter and to raise the land around his house

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is a 32-year-old woman married to Misael, a driver, and they have two small children (aged 3 and 4). They make their home in Pandan, a beautiful coastal town in the north of Antique province.

When Jenny started her business two years ago with ASHI (the field partner), it was to buy a tricycle for her husband to drive so they could make money. A tricycle is the most common form of transportation here, especially for the poor. It's a motorbike with a side car that people ride short distances in to get from A to B.

Jenny has paid off all of her previous loans and is now seeking a loan to buy parts for the tricycle to make it run smoother, such as brake pads, engine sprockets, new tires, bearings, and a new chain.

Everything she does, she does for her children. She dreams one day of having more than one tricycle and a shop where her and her husband can store them overnight and make repairs. Ultimately, she would like to send her children to college.

Jenny thanks you for your consideration in supporting her loan.

Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Repairing and upgrading her tricycle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 37, married and has 3 children. He is a carpenter in the southern town of Nabatiyeh and requests $2,000 to buy wood. He has been in business for more than 10 years and he is skilled at what he does. He has clients from all over South Lebanon. His main difficulty was to find a place to work and his future goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: Wood

loans.name: Obasogie Dolly

texts.en: D. is 38years old and married with 4 children. She sells eggs. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more eggs to sell, she says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more Eggs to sell.

loans.name: Catherin Group

texts.en:
The Catherin Group is a group of five entrepreneurs led by Catherin S.. Catherin is 33 years old. She dropped out of school in seventh grade due to poverty. She is married and has three children. She also cares for a sibling, Her children range in age from 8 to 18 years old and their educational levels are 1st through 8th grade. She lives in a commercial community called Waterside that is south of downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

Catherin sells underwear. She buys wholesale and sells retail to customers of Waterside Market. She started her business 16 years ago with a very small stock, but her store has improved bit by bit. Catherin believes that talking nicely to customers makes them want to come back and buy from you; that’s her secret for maintaining customers.

Catherin needs this loan to purchase more underwear at wholesale prices so she can earn more profit to meet her family's needs, especially educating her children. Her goal is to expand her business to a very high level. She dreams that she and her family can become successful.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock food

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores C. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Dolores owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. Dolores is just starting this business.

In 2009, Dolores joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Proscovia

texts.en:
Proscovia is 31 years old, married with two children aged 6 and 9 years. Both her children go to school. Proscovia owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Proscovia takes care of additional family members.

She owns a stall selling second-hand clothes and uses public transport to and from shopping. Proscovia sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale. Proscovia has been in this business for seven years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her sixteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent and school fees.

She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and starting selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 49 and married with three children aged between 24 and 27 years. None of her children goes to school, but her grandchildren do go to school. She owns a four-roomed house where she is staying with six people. Deborah takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She uses public transport to and from shopping. Deborah works seven days a week and receives an average of 25 customers a day. She sells to all categories of people but at retail only. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of second-hand clothes and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her because she works in an open place. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family and medication. She has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for ten years, servicing her twentieth loan. Deborah joined MCDT because it was near her home and it was easy to work with it. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 35-year-old married woman with four children between 10 and 16 years of age.  All her children go to school. She rents a three-room house where she is staying with eight people. Peninah takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.  She incurs transport costs to and from buying clothing materials from Kampala city and uses public transport to and from shopping. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Peninah works six days a week .She receives an average of six customers a day and sells to all categories of people. She pays monthly rent of 50000/= for her business. Her major business challenges are the increasing price of clothing materials and the rainy season, which hinders her customers from reaching her.  Peninah has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for five years, servicing her 14th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more rolls of clothing material. She hopes to see her business grow and start designing bridal gowns.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of fabric

loans.name: Khudiar

texts.en:
Khudiar R. is currently in the business of selling local beer and groundnut paste. She is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer and more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell. Khudiar is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver. She has 7 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer and more bags of groundnuts to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 43 years old. She is married and the mother of five children who are in school. Monica lives in Axim in the western region of Ghana. Axim is in the coastal area, and the major occupation for most women there is fish mongering and selling.

Monica buys a supply of fish from the seashore and smokes them by herself. She has customers from the greater Accra and the Ashanti region who buy from her in bulk. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and because of that many customers buy from her stand.

She has seen much improvement in her business, but the main challenge is funds to buy more fish. Monica would use the loan to purchase good quality fish to supply her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thị

texts.en:
H. Nguyen Thị (10117120017) is a 42 year-old woman living in the town of Dong Anh - Hanoi.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nguyen Thị operates a family member's business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling soft drinks in the local community.  Nguyen Thị H. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, Nguyen Thị joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nguyen Thị has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.250.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  Nguyen Thị is now requesting a new loan of 6.758.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 8th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Nguyen Thị H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Glenda's Group

texts.en:
Glenda B. is from the village of Imurong, Baggao, in the province of Cagayan. She is 40 years old and serves as the leader of this 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Glenda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Glenda farms rice and has been doing so for over 23 years, earning approximately 4,000 PHP a month.  Glenda joined ASKI last year to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glenda has successfully repaid a 7,500 PHP loan from ASKI and is now requesting a second loan of 14,000 PHP to be used to purchase fertilizers.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Koem Sorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem Sorn T. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Andoung Samretth, Takeo province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a laborer while the other three are attending the local school and also supporting their parents' farming. Mrs. Koem Sorn T. and her husband, Mr. Heang Roth, shown on the left in the picture, are farmers who own a piece of land upon which they cultivate rice.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Koem Sorn T. sells eggs, earning a small income that contributes to the support of her family. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more duck eggs to resell and to enlarge her business, with the rest of the loan to be used to support her crops.

loans.use: To buy more duck eggs

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es: Martha Patricia tiene 35 años, por lo que su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Por lo que tiene más de 10 años de proporcionar este servicio que es su único medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 2 hijos. Además de Martha tiene conocimiento de otro negocio que es la crianza de cerdos, ya que este negocio se lo heredo su Mama y fue así que aprendió esta otra actividad. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como tela, zipper, agujas y tijeras. Martha sueña con establece un taller en su vivienda ya que en su comarca hay muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia, 35, is a seamstress. She has been in this line of work, which is her sole source of income to support her two children, for over 10 years. In addition, Martha also raises pigs, an occupation she inherited from her mother, who taught her these skills. She is asking for funding to buy supplies like: fabric, zippers, needles and scissors. Martha dreams with establishing a workshop in her home because she gets a lot of work orders in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Ses

texts.en: Mr. Ses P. was born in 1975 and is currently a resident of Kompong Tom province, where he earns a living selling wood carvings. His wife, who appears in the photo here, is a vegetable grower in the village. The family lives with two kids who are attending the public local school. Ses P. has an older house that is surrounded by pollution, affecting his health and his daily living conditions. To resolve the problem, Ses P. requested a loan to buy a plot of land to cover the bad conditions.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to cover the bad conditions.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen D. Guadalupe inicia su primer ciclo con 10 socias, las socias son D. Muchic, Distrito D. Huaytara, Departamento D. Huancavelica.
Las socias realizan diferentes actividades como la venta D. animales menores, quesos, cereales, además del servicio D. lavado D. carros.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Teofila que es casada, tiene 3 hijos, Teofila venD. cuyes, al inicio vendía otros productos como la venta D. quesos y frutas, y con la ayuda D. sus hijos su negocio ha mejorado, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. cuyes. Los sueños D. Teofila es constituir una empresa y exportar cuyes.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamo como 100 soles, 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles haciendo un total D. 3,000 soles en prestamos en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen D. Guadalupe begins its first loan cycle with 10 members. The members are from Muchic, in the Huaytara district, Huancavelica department. The members do different activities such as selling small animals, cheeses, cereals, and one has a car-wash business. For example, Señora Teofila is married with 3 children and sells guinea pigs. At the start she sold other products such as cheese and fruit, and with the help of her children her business has improved. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs. Teofila's dreams are to set up a business exporting guinea pigs. The members need different loan amounts such as 100 soles, 200 soles, 300 soles, 600 soles, making a total of 3,000 soles in loans in this communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Togtohtuya

texts.en:
Togtohtuya D. is 30, married, and the mother of a 6-year-old son. She and her family live together in a house, which they own, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son, Chingunjav, attends a local kindergarten. 

Togtohtuya operates a tire repair service with her husband. Her husband, Amarsanaa, used to work in a tire-repairing place. Afterwards, he had the idea to run his own tire repair service and implemented his idea in 2006. 

Togtohtuya and her husband have been successfully operating their business, and expanded their business by operating their service in another location as well. In addition, they hired two employees for their business. 

Togtohtuya and her family have been planning to grow their business in the future.  Togtohtuya is a helpful person with a good personality. She says, “My dream is one day to change my tire repair place into a large auto repair service.” She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to repair and furnish her house. Their stove has a problem with emitting lot of smoke which is uncomfortable and unhealthy for her family.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 39, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She runs a small shop inside a public high school, where she sells a few snack foods for students. She earns an income of approximately $3.50 a day, helping to ensure her family has a stable income. She currently cares for two children. Both of them attend school. She is married to Toch, 47, who is a truck driver. 

Mrs. S. is asking for a loan in order to purchase a new motorcycle to provide transportation for her family. She is hopeful that the loan will allow her to cut down on traveling fees. (Mrs. S. was busy working when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann S. is from the village of  Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old and married. Mary Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling goods, such as ready-to-wear items, in the local community. Mary Ann has been involved in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Mary Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mega

texts.en:
Mega is married to an Anglican priest with whom she has four children, all of whom are in school.

Mega has been in her restaurant business for three years. She wants to use this loan to stock more foodstuffs like bananas, rice and sweet potatoes. She rents her business and her customers are the local people. She works six days a week.

Mega depends on this job to earn a living. Her main challenge is people who steal her things and her greatest monthly expenses are medication, rent and school fees. She incurs transport costs to and from the market to her business and uses public transport to and from shopping.

Mega is aspiring to see her business grow big and to own a fully furnished hotel (larger restaurant). She joined MCDT to boost her restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like bananas, rice and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Sun Shine Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Sun Shine” group. They are small-scale-business women based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits and consequently improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Kadiatu K., age 38. She was born in Makeni, is married to a civil servant at the Ministry of Agriculture, and two of her children are in college.

Kadiatu sells cloth – lace, linens, etc. She has had fifteen years of experience in business. With her share of the loan, she will buy more lace and linens to add to her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more lace and linens to add to her inventory

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza G. is from the village of Magsaysay Misamis oriental. She is 40 years old. Flordeliza is married. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.
