Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe L. is from the village of Diwan, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has 10 children, school- and adult-aged. Ma. Fe owns and operates a food stall, selling a variety of fruits in the local community. Ma. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month from it.

In 2006, Ma. Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 5,000 from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ma. Fe is requesting a new loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan W. is currently in the business of selling bread, groundnut paste, and fried eggs at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish and more eggs to sell. Susan is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a plumber. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

loans.use: To stock fresh fish and more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 44 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, d’habits et de chaussures.
Ces femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et excellent dans l’achat vente de condiments alimentaires, de tissus et de chaussures. 
MINATA S., un des membres du groupe, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises le plus généralement à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Tiessiri group, all married, are on the average 44 years old, with three children; they all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, a sub-prefecture of the Koulkioro region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and neighbors; their line of business is selling food condiments, clothing and shoes. The Tiesseri group is on their third solidarity loan; the women excel at their business retailing condiments, fabrics and shoes. Minata S., one of the group members, plans to use her part of the loan to purchase packs of food condiments. She usually stocks up in Bamako and sells her wares from her home, at the Fana market and at other nearby markets, retail, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of both women and men. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 40,000 West African Francs, which will be used toward everyday family expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glue and paint

loans.name: Roberto Jose

texts.es:
El señor Roberto José López V. labora  en UNICA
  Labora como jardinero , realiza labor de limpieza en los jardines el cuido de la belleza de la Universidad, tiene una persona a su cargo es  un crédito por primera vez, este lo utilizare para completar la compra de un terreno ya que con mis ahorros completo esto.
texts.en: Roberto José López V. works for UNICA (Managua's Catholic University.)  He works as a gardener, cleaning up the gardens and caring for the beauty of the university.  He supports one other person.  This is the first time he has taken a loan.  He will use the loan, along with money that he has saved, to  purchase of a piece of land.

loans.use: to supplement his savings so he can buy a piece of land

loans.name: Naseem Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Naseem Akhter lives in Faisalabad which is an industrial city in Pakistan. She has been living in a two-room brick house with her family in the Malikpur housing colony for five years. Naseem is a 47-year-old housewife who spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household works. She is married to N. A. who runs a barber shop in the market. He is very famous among his clients and people prefer his services because of his ability to do different kind of haircuts. Naseem has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her elder son and daughter are working in a textile mill and her youngest son is studying in 7th standard. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband's business. With the loan, her husband will buy scissors, hair creams, gels and hair colors. Naseem is hopeful that with his 25 years of experience in this business, her husband will successfully improve his business and increase his income as well. 

Naseem is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client who never misses any meeting and pays installments on time. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem Akhter.

loans.use: To buy items for a barber shop

loans.name: Eunice Wanjiku

texts.en:
Eunice bought her truck two years ago and has been using it for transportation in Naivasha town. She is 38 years old and has been taking care of her seven children alone after her husband died.

Eunice was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her third loan and she repaid all her previous loans in good time. She plans to use the loan to open a grocery shop to supplement the income from her transportation business. In future, she hopes to own a fleet of trucks for transportation.

loans.use: To open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To puchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adjo Semehela

texts.fr: Adjo a 43 ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de sachets d’eau et d’huile. Elle est née à Noinpé et habite Akodessewa.  Pour se procurer de la marchandise, elle le fait au grand marché de Lomé et revend au  marché d’Akodessewa. Elle cumule aussi dans cette activité près de  4 ans déjà.  Elle demande un nouveau crédit pour augmenter sa marche bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Adjo is 43 years old. She runs an income-generating business selling packets of water and oil. She was born in Noinpé and lives in Akodessewa. She obtains her goods at the grand market in Lomé and re-sells them at the Akodessewa market. She has already gained close to 4 years of experience in this business. She is seeking a new loan to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy packets of water and oil

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  

Sarah has a tailoring business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products from home by means of retail.   

Sarah has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of cloth materials.  She also generates additional income through room rentals.  

The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school and to build more rental rooms.   

Sarah lives in a home that she owns.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of cloth

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma D. is from the town of Talibon. She is 29 years old. Vilma is married. To make a living, Vilma owns & operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for breeding. Vilma wishes to have a stable income.

Vilma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Fredy De Jesús

texts.es:
Fredy de Jesús M., quien por la falta de oportunidades y después de verse desempleado, se vio obligado a retomar el oficio que aprendió desde joven al lado de un vecino suyo, fue entonces cuando la elaboración de escobas y traperos se convirtió en la fuente de sustento para él, su esposa y su hijo, quienes también apoyan su labor. 

Con la fuerza propia de un emprendedor, Fredy afirma que cada vez que se levanta piensa en trabajar con gran empeño no sólo para sostener su hogar sino también para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hijo quien sueña con ser administrador de empresas. 

Actualmente, Fredy requiere comprar más insumos para responder ante los pedidos de sus clientes que cada vez son mayores. 

A futuro Fredy espera construir tres pisos en su casa para ubicar allí su microempresa, pues actualmente ésta funciona en el patio.
texts.en:
Fredy de Jesús M., facing the lack of employment opportunities and finding himself unemployed, was forced to take up again an occupation that he learned as a young man from a neighbor.  He started to make brooms and mops and this became his source of income to support himself, his wife and his son who also help him with the work.

With the strength typical of an entrepreneur, Fredy affirms that every day when he gets out of bed he thinks about working with great effort not only to support his household but also to provide a better future for his son who dreams with becoming a businessman.

Fredy needs now to buy more supplies to meet customer demand which is greater every time.

In the future Fredy hopes to build three stories on his house to install his micro business since it currently operates in the patio.

loans.use: To buy supplies to make mops and brooms.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en al zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto. La señora se dedica a la venta de ganado ubicada en el mismo domicilio. También se dedica a la comercialización de pan, el cual compra de los hornos en cantidades mayores. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. Ella tiene un hijo.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de Pan, pues es muy buen negocio y tiene muchos clientes.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro y es la segunda vez que solicita el crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Celia lives in her own home, in Rio Seco district, in the city of El Alto.  She works selling livestock from her home.  She also sells bread which she buys from bakeries in large quantities.  This is her main source of income through which she supports herself.
 
Celia will use this loan to buy bread since it is a very good business and she has many customers.

This is Celia's second loan with Impro and the second time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bread in bulk which she will then sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman who lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: a rice retailing business, farming, and a food vending business.  Her husband Herman, who is 52 years old, works as a farmer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 5 children who are between 5 and 17 years old. 

Christina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Christina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 8000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 1500,  uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 4 cycle loan, Christina is borrowing PHP 12000, which she intends to use as working capital for her businesses, so that she can continue to save up for future business improvements. Christina V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as working capital for businesses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en: Aloysious is a hardworking married man with 4 children living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda, with a family dream of buying a plot and building a commercial building. He has been into general merchandise for 3 years. He started it from his proceeds of 1,000,000ugx that he got from the sale of tobacco, and he wishes to set up a wholesale shop. Aloysious needs the loan facility to buy soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of soap, sugar and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang S., 38, resides in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She sells groceries, earning an income of about $15 per day. Her husband is a soldier, earning an income of $5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $35 on food and $50 on the other necessary expenses. Seang is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her 2nd loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat is a mother of three children. One is a laborer, while the others are studying in the local public school. She was born in 1961. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she grows rice, some of which she sells, and some of which she uses to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Vong, is in construction. Although they try to work hard, the couple earn little income. So to improve their condition, Mrs. Phat is seeking a loan to buy four piglets and pig food to start a new pig breeding business. She will also use some of the loan to buy a water machine.

loans.use: to buy four piglets and pig food

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, de 46 años, es una mujer soltera, alegre y con mucha vida. Ella vive junto a su mamá Romilda, de 70 años y su abuela Bernarda, de 94 años. A las que quiere mucho y cuida con amor en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Villa Visca. Desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra y ha dedicar la mayor parte de su vida a ella. Pero el apoyo de su madre le sirvió para realizar estudios de pedagogía, ahora se dedica a la enseñanza de niños memores de 6 años, en una escuela del estado. Pero su mayor pasión es la siembra de papa y arveja en sus 15 hectáreas de terreno agrícola que posee. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son los momentos que dedica al cuidado de sus cultivos, ya que su trabajo como profesora le impide poder dedicar el tiempo completo; “para ello contrato peones que limpian la maleza y fertilizan constantemente”, asegura. Además cuenta que hace poco incursiono en la crianza de cuyes, con lo que podrá obtener un dinero extra. Su principal preocupación es su mamá y abuela, ya que requieren un cuidado especial por su edad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Visca”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de integrar a una asociación respetada y querida. Aida, invertirá el crédito  solicitado en la compra de 3 bolsas de semilla de arveja, asimismo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Aida is 46 years old and is a happy single lady full of life.  She lives with her mother, 70 year old Romilda, and her 94 year old grandmother, Bernalda.  She loves them very much and gently cares for the home, located in the Villa Visca settlement.

She learned to work the land when she was very young and had dedicated a good portion of her life to it, but thanks to her mother’s backing she was able to study to be a teacher and now teaches to six year old children at a public school.  Her greatest passion is still raising potatoes and peas on her 15 hectares of farmland.  What she enjoys most about her work is the time she spends caring for her crops, even though her work as a teacher prevents her from doing it fulltime.  “For that I count on field hands who take care of the weeds and fertilize regularly.”  She also tells us that she recently began raising Guinea pigs so that she could earn extra money.  Her main concerns are her mother and grandmother who require special care because of their ages.

She is a member of the “Villa Visca” communal bank.  This will be her second loan through MFP, and she is grateful for the opportunity to be part of this respected and admired group.  Aida will use the money from this loan to buy three bags of pea seed and some sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
Jose es un poblador del distrito de Eten ubicado en Chiclayo, el tiene 36 años de edad y vive con su esposa, quien es costurera y con su mejor hijo. La esposa de Jose lo ayuda económicamente con el trabajo que desempeña desde su domicilio, todo por el bienestar de su familia.

Desde hace 10 años, Jose ofrece el servicio de renovadora de calzado, el cuenta con una gran experiencia en su trabajo y tiene un puesto (el cual alquila) en las calles de Monsefú – Lambayeque. Jose es muy conocido en la zona y eso se refleja en la gran cantidad de clientes que requieren de su servicio.

Jose solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles, que desea invertir en la compra de productos para su negocio como cuero, suelas, hilo y pegamento; pero sobretodo en la compra de un esmeril (especie de lija que utilizan los zapateros para cortar cuero).

Jose sólo ha trabajado con  Edpyme Alternativa y los créditos que nuestra institución le han brindado los ha cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
José lives in Eten District in Chiclayo.  He’s 36 years old and lives with his wife, who’s a Seamstress, and with their minor son.  José’s wife helps him economically with the work she does at home for the family’s wellbeing.

For the last ten years José has been a Shoe Repairman.  He has a lot of experience in this kind of work and has a stand (which he leases) on a street in Monsefú-Lambayeque.  José is very well known in the area and this is reflected in the large number of customers that request his services.

José is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy supplies for his business like:  leather, soles, thread and adhesives but, above all, to buy an “esmeril” (a type of emery file used by shoemakers to cut leather).

José has only worked with Edpyme Alternativa and the loans our institution has granted him have been repaid punctually.

loans.use: to buy a leather cutter and work tools.

loans.name: Cecilia Isabel

texts.es:
Cecilia de 37 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, es soltera y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años que estudian en colegios particulares.

Empezó su actividad hace un tiempo atrás como profesora en un escuela y tuvo la oportunidad de poner su propia escuela. Su trabajo lo realiza con 5 profesores y el horario es de 6H00 am a 13H00 pm. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere adecuar su escuela haciendo mas ampliar para después de un tiempo hacerlo en colegio y aumentar el grupo de alumnados que tienes y así tenerlos mas cerca de ella y que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
37-year-old Celia lives in a peri-urban area of el Fortín de Guayaquil. She is single and has two children who are 11 and 5 years old and study in private schools.
She began her business awhile ago as a school teacher and had the opportunity to set up her own school.  She works with 5 teachers, and the schedule is from 5am to 1pm. With the help of the loan she hopes to renovate her school, making it bigger, in order to one day include secondary studies and increase the student population, so that she can keep them closer to her and help them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her school: cement, sand and paint.

loans.name: Idalba Poderosa

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Idalba, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene una hija de 10 años la misma que estudia en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Ella tiene una tienda de comestible donde vende productos de primera necesidad, también vende remedios, bisutería y artículos de bazar ya que esto le da ganancias extra comenta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 19h00, dice que tiene muchos clientes porque en su tienda se encuentra de todo, trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo. Lleva 15  años que tiene su  negocio y le ha ido muy bien. Su mercadería compra en Portoviejo, aunque la mayoría la recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va emplear en surtir más su tienda con productos como: arroz, azúcar, detergentes, aceites, enlatados y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva varios años en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son con intereses muy bajos.
  
Su meta es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The “La California” communal bank meets every two weeks in the Nueva California neighborhood in Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.

We met Idalba, 49, here.  She is married and has a 10-year-old daughter who is in school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She has a grocery store where she sells basic need items and also remedies, notions and kitchenware since these provide extra profits.  She works every day from 7am until 7pm.  She says that she has many customers because one can find everything in her store.  Her husband helps her work.  She’s had the store for 15 years and she has done very well.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo although most of it is delivered to her locale.

She will use this loan to stock her store with more merchandise like: rice, sugar, detergent, oil, canned goods and other basic need items.  She’s been in the communal bank for several years and likes it because the loans have very low interest rates.  Her goal is to have a much bigger store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en: Lida is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Lida has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, and canned goods. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods. Lida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, and canned goods
